Reviews.Title: “Not a four star experience”
Reviews.Author: SquaraJean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a three day weekend, and were disappointed to see the construction when we arrived. Is it just me, or is this information not clearly stated on their website? A giant tarp where a lobby should have been was pretty weird and unwelcoming. The room itself was fine. More bland and generic than the "European elegance" claimed on their website. The lack of hot water, was definitely not fine though. There were a couple pluses to our stay at Swissotel. The location is good, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. These few good points certainly did not redeem our experience, and I wouldn't pick this place again, even post-construction.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water & poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Amanda M
Reviews.Content: Under construction, no hot water Saturday or Sunday morning, and worst of all, the front desk was completely unconcerned. Also, be sure to check your bill because they did not charge us rates per our Priceline reservation. We had to stand in line over 15 minutes to speak to someone and then they made the change to our bill. Our room was clean and nice enough, but all in all, not a good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: hlalwine
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Swissotel I was excited. It's location is prime and beautiful (other than the major construction taking place next door - but I could see past that). You drive up and ask for valet, to which you are pointed in the direction of the TIGHTEST drive WAY underground to the garage. There are no signs directing you and nobody there to tell you where to park or drop your keys. We had to walk up to a window where a woman was busy paying more attention to her computer than any guests arriving in this confined sub-basement garage. She tells us to park right where we were and we left our luggage with the bellman who came out. We arrived at 11 and check-in is at 3. We knew that but were told our rooms (2 of them) would probably be ready when we arrived. Not the case, but that was ok. Once you get up to the lobby you quickly enter a construction zone within the Swissotel. A strange registration area where there is no real line, just people standing all over the place trying to figure out if they are in line or not was difficult to navigate. We were assured that our luggage would be safe and that when we returned at 3 it would meet us in our rooms. (Valet - $55 per night) We returned at 3 and were given our rooms. Lakeview rooms were actually complete views of the wall of construction next door. They are going to need to re-name those rooms because there will not be a lake view until you are well above the 20th floor. Our luggage was lost and they called our rooms asking us to describe our bags because they never tagged them, only "threw them in a room with hundreds of others". After 2 deliveries and about 45 minutes, we finally had our bags. The TV's were flatscreen and about half the channels wouldn't come in and the other 40% were snowy. The only channels that came through clear were the ABC, NBC, CBS and about 2 others. Beds were great (although our friends room did not have sheets on their bed). Very comfortable rooms. We set our room temp at 70 (about 80 outside during the day) and the room was still humid and hot through the night. The hotel was very loud. We could hear people using showers, toilets and talking in the hallways. You could also hear people outside and we were on the 19th and 20th floors. Wi-fi is available for $10 for 24 hours. Although when our friends tried to get it, they sent up an IT person who after about 30 minutes of trying to figure it out, told them that our whole side of the hotel would be unable to get wi-fi. It's hard to believe that a hotel that big and these days still charges for wi-fi... considering how much you have to pay to stay there! Woke up the next morning to a shower that was between cooler than luke-warm and cold. An hour later it was still the same way and never warmed up. Was the same for our friends on a different floor. The breakfast was the shining star of this terrible hotel. An amazing breakfast buffet ($26) was the best part of the stay. Very European and freash! I would walk to this hotel, from a different one, just to have the breakfast again. We were told that to get our car from valet would be about a 30 minute wait. We were then sent to the garage to pick up the car again and squeeze our way through the twisty turny skinny tunnel to get out. We have a normal size SUV and it was TIGHT! I would not stay here again. It's too bad because it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sjack80724
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a two day conference. The hotel is next to the river leading out to Lake Michigan. Depending on your room the views are great. The food was very good and the rooms were very updated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: mrlindberg
Reviews.Content: Why is this hotel open? It's still under construction. Lobby not open yet, main entrance closed. For some reason it was impossible to reach room service, had to go out to eat instead. The rooms are OK though, nice modern TV system which is important to me since I spend a lot of time in the hotel room. Internet WiFi connection was fast and 10 USD per 24 hours is a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location with a personal touch...”
Reviews.Author: AussieInDallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for a conference recently and really enjoyed the hotel. The staff were welcoming and very professional. My birthday occurred during my stay and the hotel left a plate with a cupcake and fresh berries in my room. A nice personal touch! There is some renovation going on but it only impacted the entrance to the Palm (nothing that would hinder your stay).

Reviews.Title: “Wow, that sucked”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Three nights there on business. Hadn't realized that the place was under construction and therefore the bar and restaurant are in the basement, very bleak. Told the front desk that I hadn't realized about the construction, so I'd have to switch hotels, they said they were still going to charge me for 3 nights. So I stayed. TV didn't work. Tried to get them to fix it and they ignored me...eventually after I called again, a few hours later, a couple grumpy maintanance guys came and fixed it. Long and complicated experience at the business center (which doesn't open until 9am, BTW), where I ended up paying $45 to print 55 pages. Had to buy these cards, and then the woman behind the desk ended up printing them herself anyway, (and charging me for them). I was left with $22 on a card for use at the business center in the basement of the Swissotel in Chicago, 2000 miles from where I live. I asked for a refund on the card and -- no surprise -- she declined to help me with that. Nice room, nice view, but the hotel is sterile and the service was incredibly bad. Worst experience I've ever had at a hotel when traveling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until construction is complete”
Reviews.Author: Gina B
Reviews.Content: This was an overflow hotel for a conference I attended in Chicago in March 2012. The staff was excellent and the location was fine but the hotel itself is under construction, making this the worst business stay I've ever had. The lobby was non existent and lacked basic amenites you don't think about until you don't have them, like chairs in which to sit and gather your thoughts and paperwork before you head out for your day, no free Internet in the lobby or a place to even stand; no other guests in sight, no house phones in site, no views, no parking lot or driveway, and hidden restaurants that have been relocated during construction to the basement concourse level. My first attempt, I went down to the basement as instructed and found myself in a construction zone, came up above ground and was told I took the wrong elevator -- the elevator which was in the lobby. Turns out I was supposed to have taken a second bank of elevators that were down a narrow temporary hallway. I went down again, found the restaurant, saw that it was empty as well as overpriced, and left the hotel in search of breakfast. The hotel felt deserted; the experience made me feel isolated and on my own. Here's another example. When I asked for directions to the Business Center to pick up a Fed Ex box, the receptionist told me that she wasn't permitted to tell me what floor it was on but that all I needed to do was get into the elevator and press "business center." Huh? I picked this hotel because it was terrific three years ago, before construction started. I also selected this hotel because of flattering reviews on TripAdvisor, but now I notice I was reading outdated reviews. Final note, I've been home for a week and have yet to receive one of those electronic "tell us how your stay was" emails. Two very bright notes: excellent, polite, professional staff, and the bed and temperature in the room was very comfortable. But this was the hotel stay that made me appreciate for the first time how important the common areas of a hotel are.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: TrueCritic787
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Swissotel and enjoyed every second of it. I checked into the hotel late Thursday night... 1 am Friday morning to be exact. With a heads up to the hotel prior to my arrival, they were more than understanding and made my check-in a breeze. Although I can't remember her name, the woman working Friday night who checked me in deserves much praise. Thank you! We stayed in the Corner King Rm 2804. I was told that the view was breathtaking but... WHOA! I couldn't have asked for more for an incredibly romantic weekend. With three large windows that nearly took up the entire wall, we were able to see the Navy Pier and the river right from our room. Let's not forget about the view from the bathroom. The bedroom was spacious, clean, very well lit with natural light and easily darkened with the energy saver curtains and most important...very well heated. It was a relief to stay in a warm room, as other hotels that I've stayed at in Chicago...well...sucked as far as warm rooms, for whatever reason. And that bed...is dangerously comfy. I never wanted to get out of it. I read some negative reviews but decided to be the judge for myself. I'm so glad that I did. I am so picky and could probably find a problem with the way that heaven is constructed and... I can't say one negative thing. I love it. I love it. I love it. The Swissotel is my new favorite and I don't plan on finding another to replace it! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “it is a swissotel”
Reviews.Author: kunteper007
Reviews.Content: after all it is a swissotel. you can never go wrong. all around the world, the quality of hospitality in hotel business must be benchmarked to these hotels. I had a grand time at swissotel chicago. the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. the concierge was excellent. there was construction next door. friday afternoon was little bit noisy. during the check-in there was a miscommunication with AMEX travel services and the reservation but the front desk was able to pick up the ball in matter of minutes and fixed the issue. other than that the stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and excellent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mosum3310
Reviews.Content: my father booked a room for me for an expo and forgot to put the room in my name and we were having Problems checking in manger alex helped me out so much as well as the lady who checked me in I forget her name but she was awesome to they had my father on the phone and made exceptions to help me out. We upgraded for only 100 more dollars a night. The room was gorgeous and very clean. pool was a little sketchy. But had a great time I havent even chrcked out yet I didn't even want to leave my room to go where I needed but I just cannot get over how helpful the staff was I will def be staying here for every visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great service!”
Reviews.Author: jammerlammy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was tough to find according to GPS, and the entrance was under construction, but other than that it was great. We were upgraded to a better room with a view of Navy Pier upon our arrival because we were celebrating a birthday! Also our mini-bar wasn't stocked, so they sent up complimentary soda and bottled water for us. Very friendly staff, and the room was excellent! Within 5 minutes from everything we needed. Great location. Thanks to Trip Advisor my trip went swimmingly well.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while he attended a conference and I was pleased with the accomodations - comfortable bed, quiet, clean. We had a wonderful view of the water. I was very pleased with everything I found within walking distance - maybe the more touristy areas but for my first time to Chicago I thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Family Gathering”
Reviews.Author: Sidi-Haji
Reviews.Content: An excellent Hotel. Good location. We stayed for one night. I am very familiar most of Chicago hotels. Swissotel goes one of my top ratings. Gusts should not be surprised if they are charged extra dollars for internet use or the swimming pool or parking space, unless you make prior arrangements with the hotel directly for free internet use. You can't find free services when you are already receiving the cheapest rate to stay per night if you reserve through travel websites ete..and you are not going to get the same price if you call the hotel directly or reservations. There are good rerstaurants within walking distance.. I like having breakfast at "Wild Berries", and dinner at "Fire Grill." Chiocago is a great city! S. Haji

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMillerMt_Vernon_IL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chicago Swissotel on several occasions. The facility is amazing and the service is excellent. I would suggest and recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a really upscale place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good views and unique elevators”
Reviews.Author: Shubhankar S
Reviews.Content: I got a room with a view of the river and downtown, which while not a lake view was still impressive. The elevators have already been described in other reviews, so I won't them more except to say that I got quite a kick out of it. The staff were quite helpful and the gym (which I didn't have to pay for) was nice. The bed seemed just a little bit more comfy than other hotel beds I've slept on. The breakfasts that I had at the hotel were topnotch (esp the health nut breakfast.) The only weird part was the layout of the elevators vis-a-vis the lobby. the lobby is on the street level but you have to take the escalators/stairs up to the 2nd floor and walk to the back to get to the elevators. All in all an enjoyable experience and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fastest elevators in town and direct access to the Pedway”
Reviews.Author: uskern
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Swissotel in Chicago. On arriving the lady at the reception offered us two different upgrades for the room we had chosen - quite tired from a 7-hour flight we let us bamboozle to chose one of the upgrades instead of insisting on getting the original room. But that was our mistake. So we got a lakeview-room which was nice. But also a bit noisy, as there is a construction site right next door, between Swissotel and the lake... The room was very spacious and clean, the bathroom offered both a tub and a shower! But the best part was, that we got to use the internet-connection from a Hotel right across the river. We had to stand right next to the window, but it was free :) We were a little disappointed that with the high price you pay for a night at Swissotel neither Internet nor breakfast nor the gym was included.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: emily127
Reviews.Content: We were really excited to be staying here but after staying the night we were not impressed much. Had to wait in line 30 mins to check in...you would think a large hotel would have more than two people checking people in. View from the room was great! However, there was food on the floor from whoever stayed before...the volume skipped on the tv...there was no microwave or minibar as stated on the website...and we had to wait 20 mins on a table for poorly prepared breakfast even though there were plenty of empty tables. All in all we expected a little more from an upscale hotel...probably wont return.

Reviews.Title: “One night”
Reviews.Author: bnice2dogs
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed one night. Yes there was construction but it did not bother us. We heard nothing in our room. We had great view of lake. Bed was comfortable. We loved the location. We walked to dinner and back from shed aquarium along the lake shore( very nice day). Staff was nice. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Why do you have to pay to use the gym?”
Reviews.Author: Ffatso
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was fine in terms of accommodation: comfortable bed, quiet rooms, decent shower...but there were two issues which are just frustrating when you're travelling for business - namely having to pay extra for use of the pool (honestly...you think I can put that on the company expenses?) and that the wireless internet is patchy at best. It feels like a place where they just hire out beds to businessmen, rather than a place to spend half a day of your life. Which would you rather, when spending your 50th night of the last year in a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Escape the tourists”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Felt like being in europe. Perfectly same weekend in Chicago with the kids. Great location, excellent service, no crazy tourist madness.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough bang for the bucks”
Reviews.Author: roxyloraine
Reviews.Content: At check-in no one told me which floor I was on or how to use the elevator system. The room service menu was overpriced ($30 for a sandwhich + 20% gratuity) but the food was delicious and delivered quickly. The faucet in the bathroom dripped all night and it sounded like my neighbor was showering all night too. I hear the Swiss has a great river veiw but mine looked into an office building. In the morning I asked for directions to my meeting and the nearest starbucks and was told the location was right through the glass doors on the concourse level and that there was no Starbucks near by. After 2 blocks of walking I found a Starbucks and the building where my meeting was held. I will try the Hard Rock Hotel next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen82
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travelled to Chicago to see a concert and decided to stay at this hotel. It was a great pleasure staying there. The rooms were recently renovated and were very clean. Size of the rooms was really good and view was amazing. We saw the city alive!!! The staff was extremely friendly. The hotel was big yet charming. It almost had a boutique feel with a grandeur appeal. Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central location!”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in 2003. Since I just recently joined Tripadvisor, I thought I should offer my two cents to members on this one! The Swissotel Chicago is a great property for business, leisure and individual travelers. It is centrally located, and their staff is knowledgeable and able to provide you with very good ideas on activities as well we good input on where to dine, etc. We had a very enjoyable conference and I still have a vivid memory of the entire stay, though it has been a while since I have visited. Taking SwissotelÂ´s operating standards into consideration, I am pretty sure that the service, quality and value provided than is still the same, or even improved to date. I would definitely stay here again if happen to return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Quality”
Reviews.Author: sbva
Reviews.Content: This sleek hotel, run with Swiss efficiency, is our favorite place for a weekend vacation. There are usually package deals available which include room, VIP tickets to a major attraction, use of the fitness center, and breakfast in the Geneva Room. The triangular tower shape means there are no long halls that funnel noise and that every room has a good view. We have never been disturbed here by drunken parties or unruly children. If you plan to stay in a lot, you may want to upgrade to a lake view room to enjoy Navy Pier sparkling in the night. The generously sized bathroom is spotless with soft towels, robes, and very hot water. The bed with enormous pillows is extraordinarily comfortable. The breakfast buffet features many fresh, healthy foods and eggs can be made to order in the kitchen. The fitness center offers a variety of machines as well as the pool. Our only complaint is the charge for wi-fi which should be included. And we do recommend you ask the staff for directions to the Pedway, the underground walkway system which is accessible from the hotel and will spare you many blocks in the cold Chicago wind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great views!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChelsea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swissotel in July and had a great experience. It's the second time that I've stayed at this hotel and would definitely stay there again. We got a great deal through our Continental Presidential Plus credit card. The room was a great. The views from the room were absolutely stunning. We had views of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. Definitely ask for a room on a higher floor; the higher you go, the better the views. If you are visiting Chicago during the weekend, don't miss watching the fireworks from your room! You'll have the best views and get great pictures. The hotel is perfectly situated between Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park. It's centrally located to all the great touristy things in Chicago. It's about a 5-10 minute walk to Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park and Navy Pier. While you're in Chicago, you must do a architectural boat tour. The tours are just a few minute walk from the hotel since they are usually right near Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: nottheusernameiwant
Reviews.Content: We stayed between Christmas and New Year. There was building work taking place so it was not obvious where the entrance was. I think they said it was a park view room but I couldn't see a park. That said, I am not interested in paying extra for a better view. The bed was, I think, one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in! The shower was good too. We found the location to be good - easy walking distance to the sights/attractions we were interested in. Didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. My rate was booked as a package and pre-paid but they knew nothing about this on check-out and so I had no choice but to pay and then wait for a refund once they confirmed it had already been paid for. Okay, they kept me informed of what was happening but I imagine they have people staying on flight +hotel packages all the time - surely they know about this kind of thing? One more thing, the 'business centre' shuts very early at the weekend. It would be an improvement to have somewhere accessible 24 hours with your room key.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Bummer”
Reviews.Author: K H
Reviews.Content: Looked to stay here after seeing several good reviews, and and pretty good prices on several websites, but could not find a site that didn't post hundreds of dollars in extra person fees. If you looked up a room for 4 people they would give you the price for the double and then in the summary show $300 in extra person fees making it well over the prices of any other hotel. $300 for extra people for 3 nights?! Bah! I would also look up 2 doubles for 2 people (sort of cheat the system) and they wouldn't even post rooms available for 2 beds unless it was 3 people or more and then charge you extra person fees on top of that. Expedia, Priceline, Momondo, Bing, all the same story. As 4 collage students looking to spend part of their spring break in Chicago, this is not the place for a good deal for an off season deal. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: xprncd_trvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel recently while attending a conference. The hotel is very comfortable and at a nice location. I would give it an "Excellent" rating if it weren't for the bait-and-switch techniques and the elevators. We arrived the day before the conference started, when all the people started coming in, and we checked in around 4:10pm, which was a little over an hour after check-in time started. The hotel gave us a room with a different bedding arrangement than we had reserved. They claimed that our preferred bedding arrangement was not available, which I didn't believe because it was just after check-in had started and I know that lots of people at this conference preferred a bedding arrangement different from ours. After some prodding, we were told that they did have a room like we had requested, but we would have to pay $35 per night more for it because it had a lake view. We didn't go for the bait and switch and took original room. Later, we found out that they had tried the same technique on other people, namely give them a room that was different from what they had requested and then try to extract more money from them to get the room they had requested. This was irrespective of the bedding arrangement requested. Another thing is the elevators. If you want to take an elevator, you have to punch in the number of the floor that you want to go to and the system tells you which of the 6 elevators you need to take. The elevators take a VERY long time to arrive under the best of circumstances. There are no buttons inside the elevator, so you are really very dependent on the system working properly. But then the system broke down and I would go into the assigned elevator and instead of taking me up to where I wanted to go, it took me down. Then, I needed to get out on in the basement and punch in the floor I wanted to go to again and wait for a long time and just hope that this time I would be taken to my floor. The whole thing was very disconcerting because there is nothing you can do once you are inside this elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless execution”
Reviews.Author: investroll
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business convention and it ran at 100% capacity. Their execution was flawless. The rooms were clean, service fast. My room had a spectacular view of the lake and the Navy pier. The bath tub was comfortable and the bathrobe plush. The elevators have the new controls where you punch the floor number into the control and the screen directs you to an elevator, rather than choose the floor inside the elevator. It takes a little getting used to, but it is much more efficient than the old style. Thy Hyatt Regency next door was part of the same conference, and it has the old system. The difference was remarkable, as there were long lines and slow rides at the Hyatt. There is a bunch of construction going on, so the site is a bit confusing. The breakfast buffet ($26) was great. No omelette station, but the usual hot foods in a high class hotel breakfast buffet. The location is an easy walk to lots of great stuff in downtown Chicago. Internet was nice and fast at 6 Mbps, and $10 per day. I had a problem with the internet and they sent tech support to my room instantly, and the guy fixed the problem fast. Parking was expensive at $52 per day, but you don't really need a car if all you are doing is a downtown convention.

Reviews.Title: “not a real Swissotel. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: airvern
Reviews.Content: Lots of cons for this property and very few pros. Cons: run down rooms; weak Internet connection; very long delays for room service; all kinds of construction going on; not centrally located; much better hotels for much less money (we paid about $150 and the Palomar, rated #2 by tripadvisor, was $110); noisy heater. Pros: bathroom was ok. Nice view (if you're willing to shell out an additional $30). If you've stayed in other Swissotels around the world, this property will disappoint you. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: fab0720
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for one night on a business trip. Check in was fast and friendly. The room was spacious and had a great view. I stayed at other hotels in the immediate area. This room was larger for a much better price. The only facility I used was the restaurant/bar for a late night snack. Service was excellent and friendly. They knew when to check on you and when to let you work. The bed was very comfortable and provided a great night's sleep. Other people at my company stay there and recommended it highly. I plan to stay there on for a personal trip to get a more in depth experience and will provide a more detailed review then.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammy1006
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in the city that are better with similar rates - we did get a very good deal for New Year's Eve ($150 per night - all in price), but I would not stay here again. The view can be quite good, although neither our travelling companions or us had a particularly nice location within the hotel. Nothing overly negative to say, nothing overly positive, hence the average rating. Hotel was in the process of being renovated, so that caused some issues. However, those things happen.

Reviews.Title: “Even though I'm from Chicago area, I felt as if I was really on a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Patricele
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! After searching multiple chicago hotels last month for something special, but also a rate that wouldn't prevent us from paying our january mortgage, i was lucky enough to find this hotel for a one night family getaway. They were offering a special rate for a corner suite. It was sooo nice! Room was clean (which is a big priority with me!), beds comfy, Bose radio, tv built in bathroom mirror (so cool), plenty of seating on the couch, beautiful view of city. The staff in hotel, restaurant and parking were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included with our package and it was delicious. Loved the Swiss oatmeal!!! Only downsides: lobby under construction (temporary problem); pool and whirlpool not as impressive as pics on website appeared (especially given the fact you have to pay extra!). Rather small and crowded (we never got a chance to swim because soo many people:(

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as past experiences”
Reviews.Author: jimmysnack
Reviews.Content: We moved to the western suburbs of Chicago 5 yrs ago and have visited the Swissotel often for a break from the suburbs. I stayed for 2 nts the week after Christmas 2011 checking out on Dec 31st. Overall, we had a nice time though we paid a little more than we had in the past and we didn't find a deal for free parking but overall the price was fine. We parked elsewhere and saved about $40. The lobby was under construction so you had to walk around and the check-in area was a makeshift operation while the construction occurred. Nonetheless, check-in was efficient. The room for some reason was smaller than I had remembered and more typical of the standard 3 stars we have stayed at in the past. We were on the 20th floor w/ a view of another building and the river so I'm not sure if room sizes vary significantly but it was fine for one adult and 2 children. We were upset that the price of the pool was not included in the price of the room but luckily we were informed when we went to pay the $15 per person per day for pool/fitness room that we could join SwissCircle for free and have free access to both (yay!). The other negative was that WIFI service was $9.95 per 24 hours of use. My girls who had just received their IPADs for Christmas were disappointed that I wasn't going to pay for that. There was also some sort of noise which we thought may have emanated from an ice machine perhaps on the floor below us which my daughter described as "2 hollow rusty metals rubbing against each other" The location is great and the bed, as has been described to much detail in other posts, was wonderful as always. I will likely return but will probably be checking out other hotels if they offer free parking and breakfast. There is no shortage of hotels in Chicago so let's hope that competition leads Swissotel to at least offer free WIFI and pool/fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with even better views!”
Reviews.Author: aurxdoc05
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Swissotel Chicago was great! We were in town on business, so we didn't spend much time in the hotel aside from sleeping and getting ready; therefore, I cannot comment on amenities outside of the hotel room. Our room was very comfortable, perfectly cleaned and had a fantastic picture window. The bathroom was beautiful and I wish I could have brought the rain shower head home with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Beautiful City View”
Reviews.Author: Hhunterr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. What a wonderful place! Rooms were large, modern, very clean and quiet! Rooms give you a great view of the Chicago River and Lake. Staff was very kind. I will stay here again. Oh yeah... you get a break on parking by driving a hybrid car.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: yumster76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Swissotel in downtown Chicago for a business meeting. The pros are the location (near everything conveniently), the best bed I ever slept in (very comfortable!) in a hotel, clean, and good service. The cons were had to pay $9.95 everyday for internet service (would think it would be included given how much I was paying per night for my room), had to valet my rental every time too (which cost extra), and they would charge my credit card as I was staying there instead of charging me in one lump sum at the end of my stay to avoid confusion (had to clear certain transactions that were made by accident by the hotel a couple of times). Plus, I'm big on soundproof walls and I could hear the guy in the next room yawning as if he was right next to me (dislike). All in all, I would stay here again only if I had to just for the bed alone but I most likely would stay somewhere else that had free internet included and thicker walls.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to stay”
Reviews.Author: Avia2r_01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very upscale and very modern and sleek. The room is very large and the views from the windows are wonderful. It has a huge office style desk that you'd wish you could have a home. The bed was very confortable and they use fine sheets and down conforter. There are no breakfast but the location is excellent. Bus right across the street and eating a couple blocks down.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valerie P
Reviews.Content: Each time we stay, they amaze me even more than the last time. The beds are so comfortable - it is like sleeping on a cloud. The staff is very friendly, courteous and helpful. Even though we had a smaller room this time, it was still terrific. We ordered room service breakfast and it came with a 2-slice toaster and delicious bread to toast - which, of course, is the perfect solution to avoiding the toast becoming cold & soggy before it gets to the room. Only at the Swissotel! They have thought of everything. The food was great too! Walking distance to the Mag Mile - perfect choice. We have been going here for 10 years and it just keeps getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Close to a trip to Switzerland”
Reviews.Author: Mark1206
Reviews.Content: By which I mean that the service, staff attention to detail, room amenities and room decor are like staying at a fine hotel in Zurich. Even the food at the conference I attended was far better than you'd expect when they're trying to serve 400 people at once. Only downside was very limited WiFi signal in the basement ballroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: beardown80
Reviews.Content: We were only there one night but it was in a great location and our room had a great view. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The only complaint was that there was gum stuck in the carpet by the couch but I assume the can fix that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect shipping location!”
Reviews.Author: Lobonness
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in August with husband and teenager in one of the suites, very well appointed and clean room. Friendly and quick check in, especially for a Friday . One block from The Magnificant Mile so a great local if you will be shopping. Walking distance to Navy Peir and all the beautiful parks! Coffe, espresso and pastry in lobby for a quick breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rich30306
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to the parks and close to the shopping. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Service is also very good. I would recommend this hotel for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey b
Reviews.Content: great location but help is a premium when trying to contact the front desk,concierge,directions,etc and the new elevator system is not user friendly at least for us

Reviews.Title: “Made my birthday special”
Reviews.Author: WriterPerson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked Swissotel for my birthday weekend last May through Priceline. We were treated like any other guest. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a special room. It was extremely comfortable. We had plenty of room to move around. I even met a writing deadline while my husband slept. The onsite spa and pool were a great getaway as it was raining like crazy all weekend. We were just recounting our trip seven months later.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average service.”
Reviews.Author: Yazen
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel was a little tricky finding. The rental car GPS kept taking me in circles. East Wacker Dr and the hotel are located about three blocks up to the right of wacker nd you won't see the hotel until you actually come up to it. Don't think Wacker ends and make a left to turn around. Concierge service closed early on Saturday - not helpful when we needed assistance. Parking was 50.00 and required a 15 min call ahead everytime we wanted the car. Room was very nice and clean but I used the spa for a massage and the vent above my head was filthy. At 130 dollars for an hour massage, I expected a clean environment. I can't really tell you much else as it was a short trip but overall they could have done more to make the stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Carldaddy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times for an annual conference I attend and have always enjoyed the Swissotel immensely. Granted the lobby is a little small to do anything other than check in and get to your room and it doesnâ€™t have the grand first impression that you get at other hotels, but this is not a luxury property, simply a good hotel. The rooms are large, the furnishings of high quality with some nice touches that remind you that you are not in another Marriott or Hilton. It is very quiet, has good linens, and very comfortable beds. (You might want to pack a drapery clip as the blackout slides tend to gap and let the light in from adjacent buildings at night) The work stations are well set up with convenient plugs and a comfortable desk chair. All in all this is a very pleasant place to stay for a couple of nights. In bad weather you can access the subterranean pedestrian walkway (via the hotel concourse level) which will get you almost to Millennium Park without having to go outside. While the walkway may look deserted from the Hotel end of it, follow the signs for Michigan Ave and you will quickly find yourself in a busy pedestrian mall with several lunch counter restaurants, coffee shops and newsstands. Most of the rooms have decent views of the skyline, the parks or the water once you get above the twentieth floor. With all the new construction in the surrounding blocks, rooms with unlimited views of the lake are pretty rare, and my experience is that they may not be worth the premium for true â€˜lakefrontâ€™. The exception to this are the corner rooms which are quite large and situated in the â€œVâ€� of the triangle shape which defines the property. You end up with two walls of windows and what seems like a 240 degree view that is amazing. The size gives you all kinds of space and extremely quiet sleeping. Definitely worth it if you are on a romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: txtravelagenttx
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious. We had two very comfortable queen beds, desk, two chairs, two night stands, dresser and flat screen tv. Roomy closet and even bigger bathroom (stand alone shower and separate bath). We arrived in the city early (9am) and asked if we could store our bags while we explored. They did even better and were able to check us into a room at 9 am! Everyone was very friendly. I first thought the hotel would be too far from any major attractions but soon realized that was not the case. Its a short 5 min walk to Cloud Gate and the parks. Buses pick you up about 50 steps from the hotel. Quick and easy!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: geethegreat
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel! Our room had a great view of the skyline and river. The room was spacious and comfortable, with loads of storage and a great bathroom. The beds were heavenly and the pillows were perfection. The location is great, just down from a bus stop and within walking distance to millennium park, navy pier, and Michigan ave (as well as Giordanos-for amazing pizza). Definitely coming back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a business meeting.”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeAlum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Chicago for a 2-day business meeting in early November. Quick notes: Business side: comfortable conference rooms and great audio-visual staff to handle speaker microphones, projection screens, background music for breaks, etc. The meals (breakfast and lunch) were very good, nice variety, good coffee. Personal side: rooms were comfortable, but just normal hotel rooms... I had a great view (1401) of Navy Pier and the lake. The fitness center, pool and spa were great primarily due to the view from the 42nd floor... the location of the hotel is convenient to Michigan avenue, nay Pier and everything in between.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler91
Reviews.Content: The web site describes a luxury hotel but it may have been that when it opened but not today. The lobby is dismal and the check in desk area is tight, not staffed well and in need of a major redo. The rooms are ok but as with the standards today are not up to a great room/ bath experience. The elevators have the most unusual way to get to your floor. You need TO get used to the lack of buttons in the cars. This is not a flagship property for this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property...Good location”
Reviews.Author: CAD4321
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for a business meeting in September. This is a very nice property. I stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Some quirks but still a very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosedale71
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel has stood up well and we enjoyed our weekend stay. Positives: nice room looking out to Navy Pier; excellent downtown location; close to everything. Negatives: our son got a "non" lakeview room, but it was much bigger, had a nice view of the lake to the south, and was much less expensive than ours; my mobile wi-fi didn't work in the room, forcing me to pay for the hotel's wi-fi (why do hotels charge for this??!!); valet parking seemed awfully steep at $52 a day; the lobby bar is small, cramped and unattractive; the coffee shop downstairs would be an embarrassment at Motel 6... we went down the road to the Corner Bakery instead. Knowing all this, I'd still come back because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel - modern luxury and great location”
Reviews.Author: waterrabbit13
Reviews.Content: Had a great check-in experience with a very personable staff - we had a corner suite booked and she gave us a higher floor with an ever better view. The corner rooms are great - looking out over the river, the lake, and downtown all at once - very nice both night and day. The room itself was unusually shaped, due to being on a corner and had a very modern appearance and decor. The bed was a mountain of inviting pillows and was luxuriously comfortable with fabulous sheets. The bath was all marble and shared the same great view of the river and lake. Very nice separate shower and tub with new fixtures. The location was very convenient to the Art Institute and Millennium Park, a bit more if you want to go all the way to the Water Tower area for shopping, but there are plenty of shops on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: loveinamist007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the Swissotel several years ago and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We flew into Chicago and rented a car to tour Wisconsin before attending a board meeting there. We decided to spend the last night of our trip,on our return to Chicago, at the Swissotel for memories sake. We were able to get an outstanding lake view room for Sunday night. Though the hotel was completely booked, due to two conventions on Friday and Saturday nights, when we decided to stay an extra night on Saturday, we were wait listed for that night. Even though there was a mix-up with our original Sunday night booking and it and our wait-list had been lost, upon calling back, the person I spoke with was able to confirm a wonderful lake view room on the 31st floor for both nights. Once again we had a most delightful stay and thoroughly enjoyed the terrific view of Lake Michigan. Our room was beautiful, extremely comfortable, and incredibly clean. Perhaps my only complaint is the $50 per day parking fee, but that seems to be the norm for large cities. Our two meals in their Palm Restaurant was another story. See separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel a business paradise with great service”
Reviews.Author: sanfrann
Reviews.Content: I have to say after a stay in the Chicago Fairmont, I was a little disappointed in the room at the Swissotel Chicago - it was quite utilitarian, but not necessarily all a bad thing. If I were on a business trip I would have been completely satisfied with the stunning lake and river views. The rooms were clean and well-planned. The bathroom was also clean. But...we were there for a romantic interlude, so the small-ish lobby full of conventioneers, the on-site Palm restaurant full of conventioneers, and the bar full of conventioneers was sort of a drag. The location is on a cul-de-sac, so is actually quiet despite the heavy construction to the North of the hotel - we never heard any noise whatsoever. Downtown is literally a couple of blocks, and Millennium Park and the Art Institute and many restaurants are steps away. Lakeshore Drive is also a couple of blocks away if you want to rent a bike for a few hours along the lakeside. I guess the service is the story here - to then man/woman, everyone went out of their way to say hello, to ask how our stay was, did we need anything, can I help you out...it stood out as exemplary. The breakfast restaurant below the lobby level provided a very nice spread, and, once again, the service was wonderful. I asked if there were any stray newspapers on one occasion and the server went upstairs and got me a brand new one.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience That Was Good for the Soul”
Reviews.Author: Petal1953
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel and I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone who is visiting Chicago. We stayed here for 2 nights and the staff were excellent in their professionalism and warm rapport.The amenities are first class, the room was a great size and the restaurants had a fantastic choice of menu options.The hotel is situated in a great position that offers easy access to all sight seeing opportunities and shopping. Anyone who is visiting Chicago must stay at the Swissotel as it is "good for the soul!" Congratulations to all of the staff who work there. Petal

Reviews.Title: “Overrated...but ok”
Reviews.Author: Mucaromd
Reviews.Content: Externally the place looks great. But when we got to the room, the pillow case had a nasty looking stain and the shower door had a bad looking crack. If anyone got caught on the crack it could seriously hurt them. We were also not told that the fridge had a sensor that if you move a bottle, you will get charged to your room. When you look at the fridge door...it has very small print. This is something that should be mentioned before you enter the room. Also the beds.....I think I could have slept better on the floor...the beds were rough! If it wasn't for my company paying for this trip, I would not have stayed there in the 1st place.

Reviews.Title: “My Chicago Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: cl2walker
Reviews.Content: I am in Chicago once per month on business. On my last visit the Swiss was not availble so I stayed at a hotel on Mich. Ave. My stay at the Mich Ave hotel really made me appreciate the Swiss. From the pleasant and helpful staff to the beautiful view of the lake and the fruit welcome basket that I receive, the Swiss makes me feel special. The rooms are well appointed and impecabbly clean with a comfy bed and good linens. World class shopping and restaurants are just a short walk away. I highly recommened the Swiss it is a business class hotel and is typically more reasonably priced than the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, but decidedly not the best location or most luxurious in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Swissotel in Chicago for three nights with my fiance, who was attending a work conference held at the hotel. The hotel is located pretty far out east on Wacker Drive, just south of the river. (It's located past the Hyatt Hotel, also on East Wacker.) The location turned out to be a detriment when the under-staffed cab line didn't move at all on a busy Friday night as we were trying to make a show that evening. It was so inconvenient trying to hail a cab at the hotel that we decided to change our plans the following evening and have dinner at the Palm Restaurant in the lobby level of the hotel. Room service was efficient and edible -- not the best, not the worst. There is a fully equipped minibar as well as a Keurig coffee machine (the kind that uses individual pods to brew coffee!) in the hotel room. We had a fantastic view of Lake Michigan facing south, which was great from the 32nd floor. Unfortunately, when we called ahead to the hotel before the trip, I was informed that the gym requires an additional fee of $15/day. Because we were staying at the Swissotel with a group booking for my fiance's work, both wifi and the fitness center ended up being complimentary. Wifi has a charge of $10/day, otherwise. Next year -- for this and other annual meetings that require us to travel to Chicago -- we will be staying closer to Mag Mile on Michigan Avenue (likely the Conrad or the Park Hyatt). Location-wise, the Swissotel is a bit out of the way for visitors who enjoy walking around and are attracted to the main tourist attractions downtown. Our stay was certainly comfortable, but there are hotels in Chicago that are more geared toward leisure/family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Super great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DM1Lund
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 6 year old and another couple and their tow kids (12 and10). We were able to book for a really reasonable price and recieved an upgrade to the 33rd floor. Beautiful view of lake, river and Navy Pier. Watched Sat. Night fireworks right out our big window in the room. Concierge was super helpful, valet parking (a little $, but its Chicago). Always got us taxis quickly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: teachmehow2bucky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in a king corner room which had beautiful views of the city and the lake. It was close enough to walk to Michigan Avenue and a short cab ride to other sites. The valet service was very slow and employees weren't super friendly. Also the breakfast was closed in the morning for a private event which was a little annoying. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying there. Everything was clean and we were able to get a great deal for our corner room!

Reviews.Title: “No thanks.”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustAdvisor
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a couple things going for it including location (only a short walk away from Millennium Park and Navy Pier, not terribly far from Michigan Avenue shopping), a courteous and prompt valet staff, and it was relatively quiet. Beyond that I don't think it was worth the price paid. Upon check-in they didn't have the type of room that I had originally booked. I wasn't willing to shell out more cash for an upgrade so I was forced to settle for a room that didn't really suit me. The woman at the front desk didn't seem very sympathetic to this and was clearly irritated by my inquiries as to why my room wasn't available or if they could do anything for me. Also, while it was to be expected, any extras were steep. Valet, room service, minibar, pool/fitness center, and so on. I'll admit that I'm not used to staying at nicer hotels but some of the charges seemed over-the-top. I suppose I would have understood if the hotel wasn't so underwhelming as a whole -- the lobby, the rooms, etc. Everything was so bland (design-wise especially), I really was expecting more based on the prices. On the bright side, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice (a variety of toiletries were offered and the fixtures seemed newer). So, after walking around the city and seeing all the places I could have booked, I was pretty bummed. I'd research all your downtown hotel options if you have time because there's plenty better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2009Virginia
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for my anniversary. Room was nice and staff helpful. The front desk gave someone the wrong room and they walked in on my wife & I. Think they got an eyefull.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location, modern, nicely furnished, great views!”
Reviews.Author: 2RollingStoned
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in a Premier Corner King room. Widows on all sides, fantastic views. The room was very nicely furnished, very modern and upscale. Go with the corner room if you can, it's definitely worth it! The location is good, but a little but out of the way. You will have a few blocks walk/taxi to Michigan Ave, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel for a meeting for 4 nights in Oct. The staff was very helpful and friendly on all of my encounters. My room was quiet with a large King bed (which was very comfy), and a great view of Navy Pier and the saturday night fireworks. Location was away from the busy hustle of Michigan ave, but close enough to walk the Magnificent Mile. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: concordia7
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and was very impressed with both the service and quality of rooms at the swisshotel Chicago. I did not expect as good a room as it was. Spacious, great view, quick elevators, friendly staff, great location. I can't say anything bad about this place. Room was on 33rd floor. Great view. Special thanks to the maid who came to my rescue with an ice pack after seeing me bang my face against an ajar door. Did not expect it. No bar fridge tho? Empty fridge that works . Again. Overall impressed and would easily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: jsEyes
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a girls weekend and got a great deal on this hotel . We typically stay farther north so i wasn't convinced that we would like this location. We had a corner room with views of the city from one direction and a view of the lake and Navy Pier from the other direction--awesome!! The river runs right along the hotel and it was fun to watch the kayaks and tour boast go by. We had an easy walk down Michigan Avenue to shop and eat...saw the new Marilyn Monroe, took a short cab ride to Trump Terrace for drinks. Loved this location. Hotel staff was great. Room was large.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: parisianheart09
Reviews.Content: You will be amazed at the downtown parking rates. Call ahead because it can add up to $100. a day to the bill. Palm Restaurantis great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFromNJ
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Swissotel in Chicago for one night - room was upgraded to a suite that was just wonderful. The staff were helpful, the room was spotless and the setting was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lake View and Downtown Location!”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a long weekend in September 2011. The hotel was newly remodeled. The room was very comfortable and well decorated. Our room view overlooked Lake Michigan, and we could see the museum campus, which was in the far distance. The gym is equipped with new machines and it overlooks the lake. We did not order room service or go to the restaurant, because there are many restaurants in the immediate area. Access to the Magnificent Mile and shopping on State Street (Macyâ€™s (formerly Marshall Fields) and other major chain stores) are in close walking distance. The theater district is close, too. Access to the river walk (there are some nice restaurants along it) and the lake are very close to the hotel â€“ be sure to go for a long stroll down to the museum campus and back (bring water and sunscreen though)!! Because of the rooms and location, we highly recommend this hotel. However, it was a bit pricey. If you want to stop for a drink on your way back to the hotel, stop in the neighboring large glass bar in the Hyatt. Also, beware of guests in town for football games - they can be a bit of an annoyance if you are not in town for the game. One other note is that if you touch anything in the minibar, your account will charged even if you did not remove anything from it. Just inform the hotel desk, and they will remove the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DallasTricia
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Swiss. Pleasure for me and our 3-month-old, business for my hubby. Everyone from the Front Desk and Concierge to the Valet Attendants and Room Service staff treated us like we were special guest. They were friendly, attentive and very helpful. Having a large, clean, comfortable room was critical to the enjoyment of our time in Chicago. We checked in late and thought we would get a 'crappy' room as a result of the time of day and convention visitors, but the front desk clerk gave us a great room, 2220, with a super comfy king sized bed and an awesome view of the river and lake.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Doc055
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, 1 block from millenium mile, short walk to navy pier, the lake and beaches, for a big city hotel the price is good value as i would rate it a 5 star hotel. Rooms were beautiful, Staf very good, indoor pool really good, everything good.One of the best hotels we've stayed in. The only downside was the parking at $52 a night which mounts up as we stayed three nights. Having said that it was valet parking and the cheapest self parking car park was $30 and was well away from the hotel so for the extra to have the car taken for you and ready when you check out and being on holiday and it being in a large city its not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (location, service & value).”
Reviews.Author: Cairo_traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance and were really lucky. It is centrally located (you can walk to most of the city's sites) and has a nice view too. The room is very spacious, excellent quality bathroom, as well as room equipment (tv, iron, internet, etc.). Though we didn't have kids, I loved how the hotel gave special attention to kids at the reception with a VIK (very important kid) desk !

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: mb0511
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for a long weekend and can confirm that it is a very good and convenient hotel. The concierge and personnell throughout the hotel, i.e. reception desk, bar, restaurant etc., were very friendly and always very accomodating. The hotel is also quite conveniently located in the center of town. It's a 5 minute walk to the Michigan Ave., the famous Magnificient Mile where you can do all your shopping. It is equally close to sightseeing tours which are offered right at the crossroads of the hotel street and Michigan Ave. The breakfast buffet was not overwhelming. I think it could offer more, yet, you have the choice of course to order from the menu. I guess no one will stay hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful stay- will be back!”
Reviews.Author: doctortow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel as part of a business meeting for five nights. This was the selected conference hotel, but I was very happy to become acquainted with it because I will definitely plan on using it again for my next trip to Chicago. I loved the location- very central off Wacker. I love to walk when I come to Chicago so this facilitated my walking sprees down The Magnificent Mile, to Millenium Park, and to the Navy Pier. You could even watch the fabulous fireworks over the Navy Pier from the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The check-in was prompt without issue. The elevators are modern and you select the floor and the panel indicates which elevator will take you there. For some reason, I had not seen this before, but it seems efficient. The rooms are a generous size with very nice views and nice sized bathrooms. The bed and pillows were super comfy and the turn-down service left chocolates. I used room service once and they were on time....the food was fine but did not blow me away with taste or value (but, that is typical). The conference rooms were nice and well taken care of during the meetings. The penthouse level gym was nicely outfitted and the hot tub was clean and large enough to share comfortably with strangers. I enjoyed using the facilities greatly at the end of my stay and wished I had used them the whole time. Wifi capabilities in the room were good and were included in my stay (as was the gym). The bar downstairs is not large but has some friendly staff that are probably a bit overworked depending on how busy the hotel becomes. As far as restaurants, I did go to the Palm. I had never been before. Some people seem to love this restaurant and I just don't quite get it. I feel like the menu is priced pretty high for what I received. Granted, I did not order the steak and lobster...maybe I should have. I got the cesar salad which was good followed by the crab cakes which were suprisingly not good. The flourless chocolate cake was tasty. The waitstaff was fine. Perhaps this was not a place to eat solo. I just did not care for it overall and the value simply wasn't there for me. As for restaurants within walking distance, I would suggest Volare for Italian, The Purple Pig for shared plates/drinks, and The Gage for a tavern feel with creative takes on American cuisine and great beer options. The overall takeaway for me is that this hotel was not lacking in any way and I really enjoyed my stay. I have stayed in about 10 different downtown Chicago hotels and this one ranks #1 for me. I will look to stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location.”
Reviews.Author: martinandreassen
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is a nice hotel near to the Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue (Millenium Mile). Had a great corner room with an excellent view of both Navy Pier and the city. The room was clean and the king bed was very comfortable. Good plasma TV in the room. Used the well equipped fitness center at the 42nd floor and enjoyed the view while training. There is also a pool but I did not use it. Stayed all day at the hotel during a conference and the hotel staff made a good job servicing all participants. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iowabeachmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice rooms and many have a nice view of Navy Pier. Unfortunately our room faced an office building. The lobby is kind of mediocre. There is a bar in the lobby with some couches. The gym is very nice and there is an indoor pool. The location is great, allowing you to walk everywhere. Service was just okay, nothing special. We got this room for a very attractive price but I would choose another hotel if the price were not so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AMBLF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Chicago for 1 nioght in August. I found the staff to be very helpful. The room was beautifully equipped and the downtown location can't be beat. I would highly recommend this hotel for buisiness or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, too many extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: denajennell
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life heard of a hotel charging to use their fitness room or pool. Also, I know mini bar prices are outrageous, but this hotel wanted to charge $7.95 for a 12 oz aluminum bottle of coke. I know this because I moved the coke in the fridge to put in some medication and was charged for it (it runs on weight sensors). The hotel will take off the charge of course, but still, just the thought of somone making the decision to charge $8 for a coke makes me angry. Don't get me started on not offering free Wi-Fi either.... I would rather have have free Wi-Fi instead of a shoe horn, sewing kit, and shower cap. On a happier note, the hotel is beautiful and the views are specacular. The elevator system is very efficient and if you can't figure out how to use it, that is no fault of the hotel. The room is very comfortable with a nicely updated bathroom. The staff was very friendly as well. I disagree with others who say this is an excellent location, i thought it was a little out of the way actually. Good stay, but beware of the extra costs. Thankfully I didn't have a car to park!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction and Service”
Reviews.Author: heffkids
Reviews.Content: Purchased on Priceline.com for a Labor day weekend trip. Unbelievable workout room and pool included in package. Other revies said we would be Nickle Dime... we did not find that to be the case. Self park available behind hotel at $30 a day. The Workout room has all the fabulous equipment you could ever want.... Our room was on 14th floor with great views of the city and Chicago river. The Hotel is a short 15 minute walk from Nave Pier and just one block off Michigan ave. Beds were very comfortable. Digital TV had trouble with a signal at times but we were not there for the TV. Bath has both shower and tub and was well appointed. Overall great hotel and trip. Especially at the rate we got via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel ammenities and location”
Reviews.Author: HK_TorontoCA
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Chicago is fabulous - we would love to go back! We found a great deal on hotwire, and the hotel exceeded our expectations for the value. It is located just off the Magnificent Mile (~10min walk), and right in the same area as the Fairmont and Hyatt, just over the river from the Sheraton. The Swissotel is well appointed - triangular in shape so all rooms have great views. We got moved up to the 38th floor and had a nice view of the river / magnificent mile. The room was very large, with a very nice bathroom (separate shower w/ rain showerhead); The bath products are lovely - fresh and not overpowering. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room also has robes and a nice desk for working.I would highly recommend this hotel for people going to the city - it's a nice place to touch down, and a central location for exploring Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The View Makes Up for Everything”
Reviews.Author: Canuckinbklyn
Reviews.Content: Yes, parking is expensive ($52 p.d.) and the fitness center/pool is expensive ($15 p.d.) but we knew that going in so we were not surprised. The room was very nice, the toiletries were first rate and the view of the river, the lake and the pier was spectacular. When we had to call several times to get our TV fixed (they finally replaced it), we were comped to a breakfast buffet, which was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle62844
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent a recent Friday, Saturday and half of Sunday at this hotel. Not sure what all the fuss about the elevators is about....they could not be easier to use. This location was close to Michigan Avenue and State Street and tons of restaurants. It was a short cab ride to Navy Pier and to Union Station. As for the concierge, she was very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at the Swissotel and will go back.”
Reviews.Author: Doymo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel over Easter weekend as a gift from our daughter using GroupOn. We were wondering if we'd be treated any differently as a result of the coupon. We think we were treated better. Their friendly, professional staff offered us a choice of floors and style of room. The hotel is elegantly European. The rooms are spacious, very clean, very quiet, and the beds are amazingly comfortable. We loved it there and will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't Open Your Mini-Bar!"”
Reviews.Author: CanadaClaudia-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day trip to the Windy City. My husband booked through Hotwire so I read the reviews after finding out that we would be staying at Swissotel. Our check in went fairly well, they would not let me check in because my husband booked through hotwire so he had to be there. They did apologize. The room was nice, beautiful view of the pier. The bathroom is rather small and not very modern. Location was great, in walking distance of the magnificent mile. Now what I didn't like: -The hotel charges 15 dollars a person, per day!!! to use the pool and the fitness centre. Why have a pool if not many people will be using it?? We spoke to two young gentlemen in the elevator one day who had just returned from the pool and I asked if they paid the 15 dollars? The told us that they booked the room using a "Groupon" so the pool was included. However, they did pay 20 dollars a night more for the hotel than we did, so there is the pool "charge". -Before we left, I read a reivew warning to not open the mini bar because it is censored and you will be charged for using it. Upon arrival to our room my son opened the fridge and I told him to quickly close it because of what I had previously read. Well guess what, when we checked out we were charged an extra 20 dollars for using the minibar which we never did. The front desk quickly rectified the mistake and reprinted my bill. So my advice is: don't open the fridge and check your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be coming back”
Reviews.Author: msmika_11
Reviews.Content: We will not stay here ever again. The electric sockets on the wall did not work. I had to use the socket in the bathroom to iron my clothes. The ice machine was broke on our floor and had to go up 3 floors to get some ice. The rooms were small then what they show online. We didnt like the fact that you had to pay and extra $50 for a refridgerator. That should already be in your room along with a microwave, which wasnt in our room either. I did like the nice robes which was provided in the room. Internet could of been free for the amount we paid for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: Had a double room w nice river view. Room very clean, bed comfortable. Toiletries not the best, no conditioner provided so if you use it you should bring your own. Towels were fine unlike some other guests reviews. Separate tub and glass shower stall. Nice keurig coffee maker. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: r0man53
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is close to the Lake and within easy walk of all main attractions in Chicago. The rooms are large and well appointed with very comfortable beds and large bathrooms. It has several floors - try to get a room as high as possible for the excellent views. The lobby can be busy but the checkin staff are generally fast and efficient. I have been to many hotels in Chicago but this is one of the best in terms of value for money, comfort and situation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View of the Lake and Fireworks!!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTXTraveler60
Reviews.Content: The rate for the room (double beds with a lake view) was very reasonable as we had paid the same rate in a Best Western in Wrigleyville the week before. The room and bath were very comfortable. The bath was very nice and included a deep tub and a separate free standing marble shower. All of the technology features were available in the room, however, it did seem unreasonable to be charged an extra $10 per day for wireless internet since most establishments now consider this a basic service. The exercise facility and pool are beautiful, but the daily per person usage fee is high. We mentioned this at check in and received complimentary use of the facilities during our 5 day stay. The hotel is very conveniently located and we walked everywhere. Parking is pricey ($50/day) and the service is sometimes very busy so plan ahead if you need your car by a specific time. We did not use any of the restaurants, bar, or room service. Lobby is somewhat cavernous and impersonal, but the staff is friendly and remembered us by name. Every Weds. and Sat. night at approximately 9:30 pm we had a spectacular view of the fireworks near Navy Pier. Room was very quiet and pleasant for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sitzi
Reviews.Content: I consider the swissotel in CHicago as one of the best businesshotels in the US, and I have quite seen a bit. Although the lobby/entrance isnt very impressive, the rooms are very nicely furnished, and the one to lake michigan have a stunning view. If u book there, ask for aroom in the upper floors with a view to the lake. And the fitnesscenter on the 42nd has also an impressive view over Chicago and the lake. The only downside is that you have to pay for the wireless which is rediculous at 220$/ night. Its also not very elegant to charge 8 bucks for a bottle of mineral water in the room. But other than that this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at the swissotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: letsmotor101
Reviews.Content: Corner suite , lake and city view, courteous and accommodating staff as usual - only place we'll stay downtown Chicago plus they're green and reward you with half off nightly parking charge!

Reviews.Title: “NOT ALL IT SHOULD BE”
Reviews.Author: LouisiAnn
Reviews.Content: The building itself is remarkable from the outside,but once going inside it seemed a bit dated. After a five hour flight delay from Dallas we were exhausted and just wanted to sleep. We were given a room on the 26th floor and had a quick lift up the computerized elevators. However, upon entering the room we were quickly awakened by a dismal room. We asked the front desk attendant how many stars the hotel was rated and she said 5!!! Really?? The bathroom was quite small for the 5 star rating with a toilet that had to have the handle jiggled to make it stop running. I've stayed at Ritz Carltons, W's, etc and should have done so this time. The beds were comfortable and the view of Navy Pier was great. Everything is within walking distance so if you will only be in the room for a couple of hours to sleep then it's ok. Don't be fooled by the European accent and impressive tour on the website!! LOL!! The front desk staff was courteous and removed our room service charge because the food was horrible. We made the best of it since we out exploring Chicago the majority of the day and dining at night.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, nothing impressive for an upscale CHIC hotel”
Reviews.Author: borntoexplore
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay in chicago. I have visited Chicago probably 14+ times and stayed at most of the deluxe properties and was looking forward to experience the SWISSOTEL. There was nothing impressive at all about the hotel and I was quiet disappointed. Whilst our friends stayed at the Renaissance and I wanted to experience the SWISSOTEL I wished I had joined them: the lobby is dark and weird shaped, the front desk check-in was not very friendly, the room was average sized - I bought a package incl parking, bfst and pool area. I find it surprising that access to gym/ pool would be assessed with $ 15.00 p day - and had high expectations. We were disappointed with pool area (only spectacular views from the gym) - it reminded me very much of 70' constructions of a non-remodeled hotel. The bath room amenities are sparce and low quality - Hyatt Place or any equivalent 3* hotel provides way superior products. Upon check-out, I had to argue to receive the package I had originally paid for and I was told that they had a misprint and they could not state all exclusions ? I find it disappointing that only after insisting and talking to the manager they reluctantly agreed to honor the package they had sold to me - all in all, nothing to be considered for future stays. There are plenty of great hotels in convenient walking distance downtown CHICAGO in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “NOT ALL IT SHOULD BE”
Reviews.Author: jeromeoconnor
Reviews.Content: Triangular-shaped, Harry Weese designed, and still visually striking after 30 years, river or lake views from almost all rooms are spectacular and among the best in this magnificently beautiful city. But not all was as expected, leading one to conclude that management has unnecessarily and surprisingly become miserly on some aspects of hotel appointments and appearance. An unready room, which had been changed from king to double and previously confirmed with Swissotel central reservations and the hotel itself, had been overlooked, resulting in an unready room at a 345pm check-in.
