To the hotel's credit, but only at my request, Alex, an assistant manager, corrected the oversight, furnishing a full breakfast voucher as an apology. (Breakfast is excellent with made-to-order eggs, but otherwise rather expensive.) Because of the building's architectural footprint, the mostly low-ceilinged lobby wanders hither and yon without adequate sineage, and is surprisingly dark and colorless. Yet, the 6 new elevators are among the fastest in town, and computer controlled from the elevator lobby and not in the elevator itself. The Front Desk, while official and courteous, yet seemed stressed (confirmed by later visits), and lacked the welcoming attitudes characteristic of deluxe hotels. The same could be said for the concierge desk - stressed - and also furnished incorrect information about a church mass. Yes, the hotel was fully booked, but aren't staff trained for such situations? Guest rooms are certainy bright and well-appointed, quiet, excellent quality mattress, 42 inch flat screen television that actually was HD (and not a big screen analogue TV as common in many hotels.) But no CD player as shown on web-site. The bath appointments, such as the silver dollar sized soap and downscale motel - sized no-name shampoo and bath accessories, were a major surprise for a quality hotel chain. The aroma, or was it an odor, in the bath, could have been from the cleaning solution or from the soap, or perhaps both or none. Whatever it was, change the bath accessopries to match the hotel quality. Other indications of a lack of guest consideration included only a few free newspapers at the front desk and restaurant - and they had to be snatched early - and a fee-based internet. Contrast all of this with the James Hotel, where I stayed 5 nights in July. At the James, local, national, Wall Street Journal, are available in sufficient quantity seven days a week. Internet is free in business center. Deluxe bath accessories are far superior to Swissotel, CD players with excellent mini-speakers are part of room appointments, and the smiling staff is much more accommodating and knowledgeable than at Swissotel. The Palm Restaurant at Swissotel can be highly recommended, especially the happy hour menu with generously-sized mini portions at reasonable prices. Swissotel Chicago management was made aware of these issues in reply to computer - generated query, but to date has not replied. These complaints seem petty and overall the hotel merits patronage, but little things still mean a lot. A deluxe hotel is expected to be deluxe in every category from front desk welcome to concierge awareness, to bath accessories. Thus, in these areas of inn-keeping, the Swissotel Chicago has not succeeded.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dryadFortWayneIN
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern hotel with a chic feel to it. Ideal location near everything downtown. My room was a basic double room with a river view. At check-in I was offered an upgrade to a lake view room for an additional fee, but declined as I was only staying one night. The room was spacious, ultra clean and well-appointed with tasteful photographs of local architecture. Beds were very comfortable, linens were crisp and clean, pillows (one large one small) were perfect. There was a business desk, reading chair that looked out the window that offered a great view (28th floor) and a nice tv with lots of options (didn't watch but looked like it was free cable with the usual upgrades available for purchase). The bathroom was large and bright and very clean, with a separate tub. Shower was nice, good water pressure and temperature. Hairdryer and basic toiletries included (shampoo/soap/lotion) and plenty of soft towels. Bathroom light switch offered a "nightlight" setting. Robes in the closet looked luxurious! Also a nice touch was a "loaner" umbrella in the closet that you could use and replace during your stay, or purchase outright at a fairly reasonable price if you needed to! Even though the hotel was very busy and seemed at full capacity, my one-night stay was very quiet. Check-in and check-out was smooth and efficient, if not what I'd call friendly. Even the concierge station seemed more dutiful than helpful, but I can't say they were unfriendly, just not very energetic. No complaints, but no praise either. I noticed previous reviews where guests had some fee issues, and I did indeed have an erroneous mini-bar charge on my check-out statement, however it was (seemingly) resolved quickly and easily at the registration desk. There does seem to be an additional fee, some of them quite exorbitant, for things that may be included or cost less at other hotels (like internet access, pool-spa access, self-parking) so compare other hotel rates with these possible up-charges in mind. All in all, I would return for the right price and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: swiss1008
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 nights with the hotel, checked in at 7pm Sat, the small drive way was cramped with cars waiting to be valet parked. Could not even unload the luggage, The lead service men was quick and efficient. I was able to self-park behind the hotel $30 for 24 hours. better than the $52 a day. or $24 at the millennium garage 10 min away. The only thing we didn't like was the $15 per person per day to use the fitness and pool on the 42nd floor. Even though we were at the lower level (5th) with several buildings blocking the view, but we can see the lake and river. Navy peer is in sight, but don't be fooled -- it is a hike to there, because you can't walk across the highway/loop or the river. So, you can even see the fireworks from the room - that was nice and cool. Internet is extra of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mlustig
Reviews.Content: We stayed herre for most of our Chicago trip. The hotel is modern, sleek and clean. We got a great deal through priceline so it was a good value too. The service was pleasant and responsive but we had ongoing minor issues with toiletries, towels, and Keurig cups. On the upside the hotel is close to everything downtown and our room was still there, clean and cool (except one night when the AC broke, but they fixed it quickly) when we returned to collapse from our day's excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time & Will Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Rose012NewYork
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is a great place to stay in Chicago. Great staff & very helpful. The rooms were very clean, had all the ammentities and more. The hotel is in a great location and close to Millenimum Park, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier. Transportation is everywhere. Lots of cabs, buses, trolleys and near the L train. The city is very clean and we felt very safe. Great harbor. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Roamingretriever
Reviews.Content: For our 25th anniversary, the hotel upgraded us to a corner suite on one of the top floors! Amazing view! Amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Chicago Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmjules
Reviews.Content: We were on a tight budget for our 7th anniversary so we excited to receive the Swissotel on Priceline (name your own price). When we arrived, we were greeted with an upgrade special for a corner room. I was skeptical but we went with it anyway. The view was amazing! We were on the 21st floor and had sweeping views of Navy Pier, Aqua, even Buckingham fountain! The corner room is spacious and has modern amenities plus a great bathroom with separate tub and shower. If you like to walk downtown Chicago, this is the hotel for you. We were able to walk to the taste in Grant Park, Michigan Avenue shopping, Navy Pier and more! Before you stay: * If you value your money, don't park here! It's a pain to drive into downtown Chicago anyway. We came from the south so we parked at a park saver lot at Midway airport and took the train in (the midway train station is right across the street from the parking lot!) *Also be aware that if you book on priceline, you may not be able to get the king room you were hoping for, hence why we took the upgrade. *There is a CVS around the corner from this hotel, which makes it very easy to pick up vacation essentials like bottled water, snacks, etc. *Visit Yolk for breakfast! It's an easy walk from this hotel and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kibons
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good location! The room view is beautiful. Service is very good. The only negative thing is the paid internet conection.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Dottydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a Chicago Family Weekend Getaway! The experience was AWESOME from the moment we pulled up until the moment we checked out. The kids loved the pool and the restaurants. Thank you Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful "staycation" at the Swissotel! The location can't be beat and we were upgraded to a corner suite overlooking the river and lake. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. And the pool and jacuzzi were a nice option. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it but.....”
Reviews.Author: nevittsf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the service was excellent. However the cost was high. We are now in a wonderful Washington DC hotel on Pennsylvania Ave close to everything.. To compare? Here wireless is free and works well. At the Swissotel it cost almost $10 a night. Parking in DC is $34 a day, at Swissotel it was more than $50 a night. Here we get a good continental breakfast. At the Swissotel they had no continental, only a very good, but expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyb007
Reviews.Content: Wondeful location but pricey.... I would not have stayed here on my own but was the business hotel of choice. Extra charge for excercise room AND pool, which I have never experienced before. Parking was 50 dollars a night. Nice view of the lake and Navy Pier from the elevator area, notsomuch from the room. The elvators had a strange system where you chose the floor from the lobby area and then it told you which elevator to take. This was not explained to us when we checked in. Once we knew, we adjusted but a heads up would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: byelderman
Reviews.Content: I got a room on priceline for $100 a night. The room we got was beautiful. It was a corner room where we had a panoramic view of the river and Lake Michigan. The only obstruction was the huge HD TV that was on the desk. Wish they had put it in a different place or had one of those remote control cabinets that the TV would "pop up" from the cabinet when you wanted to watch TV. One other criticism -- the toilet paper. The toilet paper for a room that retails for more than $350 I would expect better toilet paper than toilet paper they have in an airport rest room.

Reviews.Title: “They charge just for breathing.”
Reviews.Author: todavis
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice comfortable beds. The room was spotless. The view of Navy Pier was awesome. We went to our room and the fan in the A/C started making a horrible noise. The people next door even started knocking on the wall. I called the front desk and they sent a maintenance man, (I wish I could remember his name) he showed up in less than 10 minutes and he said the fan would have to be replaced. He told us we would have to change rooms. He got our room changed, with a better view, brought us the keys and offered to help us take our luggage to the other room. He was awesome. We told the people next door what the problem was and they were cool about it. I did make sure the A/C was turned off as not to bother them. The girl at the front dest was very friendly when we checked in. It was really hot in Chicago, July 4th weekend and they had ice water dispensers and cups in the lobby for no charge.(that's all that was free) Cons: They placed an invoice under the door that we were being charged for a bottle of Vodka, $38.00. That was weird since no one in our group (we had 2 rooms) drinks alcohol. I went to the front desk and they removed it. They said it is based on weight and if we had moved anything in the refrigerator or placed anything inside of it, you can be charged. That was resolved with no problems. The curtains don't keep out much light. They charge $15.00 per day, per person to use the pool. That's highway robbery. They charge for internet service $9.95 per day. Parking $48.00 per day.How can you enjoy your stay when you get charged just for breathing? If economy motels can offer internet service for no charge, so can 4 star hotels. If your wanting to be close to all the action on Michigan Ave, this hotel isn't for you. Overall the stay was good. It was quiet at night compared to the hotels around Michigan Ave. The hotels around Michigan Ave are by the hospital and you'll be kept up all night with sirens blaring. I grade 4 start hotels down when they charge for what economy motels give individuals for free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: takesbus11
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this hotel and found the staff to be helpful and the rooms are quite large and clean. Room service was relatively prompt and hygienic. I would stay here again because it's location makes it easy to access restaurants and tourist sites both north and south of the river. Also there's a convenient UPS center located at the basement, but they will still charge for just holding items delivered to you, even if you're a guest at the hotel. The gym was also well-equipped and well-maintained. Stay was in March 2011.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy, but beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKJC
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after using an online bidding website (so we didn't exactly choose the hotel). First impression was bad - girl at front desk was outside on her phone, so we waited a good 5 mins for check in (it was after midnight). She did upgrade us to a suite, which was nice. Beautiful room with 2 bathrooms, great bed, high floor so nice and quiet...until the yappy do down the hall started barking in the morning. I had no reason to ask if I was a pet- friendly hotel, but couldn't they all go on one floor so the rest of us don't have to hear? Otherwise a nice hotel - just too noisy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. great staff, great views”
Reviews.Author: sjacobs07
Reviews.Content: Short visit for our anniversary. Very friendly and competent staff. Reasonable price for upgrade with fantastic view of lake and Navy Pier. Nice surprise of champagne and chocolate covered strawbs when we returned from day out walking thru this beautiful city. Strongly recommend Millenium Park with the amazing Bean, Ghery designed Pritzker Pavillion, Crown Fountain, and adjacent gardens. All great for fun and people watching. Don't miss the Chicago Cultural Center across the street...outstanding architecture, stained glass and mosaics, and art exhibits... and all free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: PSTTK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for July Holiday weekend. Everything was wonderful from the front desk staff to the Concierge. Stayed in a corner suite with views of the Lake and the River with Navy Pier in the middle. Room was spacious and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Clintonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, 2011 for 3 nights. The location is great. It is right downtown, near the lake, the river, the mag mile, navey pier etc. We were able to walk just about everywhere we went. The views can be stunning depending on where the room is located within the hotel. The bed was so comfortable and the room was clean and fairly spacious. Decorated much like a business hotel. The only drawbacks are things that can be completely be avoided if you are aware of them ahead of time. The gym and pool costs money to use. It costs money if you want the internet in your room. The food is OUTRAGEOUSLY Priced. We received a free voucher for 2 for breakfast (buffett). The meal was so-so at best. The bill came and it was $57... or I should say would have been $57 if we did not have the voucher. Basically do not order any food or roomservice unless you want to pay through the nose. We read about this in advance so it was no surprise to us and we simply ate out, or ordered in. All in all this is a good place to stay so long as you're aware of the pros and cons before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeJess
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Chicago. location is awesome, view was beautiful (we watched the fireworks from our room!). If you don't want to pay the $50 a day for parking, park right next door at 303 whacker (30/day) an connected to hotel. loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Don't touch the fridge.”
Reviews.Author: roadtripX7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location. You are a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile and the theater district. The river and the lake are literally "right there". You have a great view of Navy Pier. The rooms are beautiful. The beds and pillows are dreamy. Our bathroom was nice, but not immaculate. This hotel offers everything you may want, but be prepared to pay for it. They have a ridiculous minibar sytem that automatically charges you if you even touch something in the fridge. Internet is $9.95 per day. You have to pay to use the pool (maybe it's worth it; we didn't use it). Parking is $50 per day. Despite the constant attempts to get into your wallet, the location and the quality of the rooms make this a fabulous hotel and we plan to go back again. We'll just remember to keep the minibar fridge closed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and views, but customer service is less than par”
Reviews.Author: StephanieDenver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. When I arrived at the hotel, the line to check in was almost to the entrance. I waited about 20 minutes. There were two people working at the front desk on the first day of check in for a major conference. During my stay, my coffee maker stopped working. It took two calls to get this replaced. Finally, when I checked out, my bill was incorrect. I had to get a manager, who was neither helpful, nor friendly. Despite the fact that I had a reservation code with my correct rate, the manager refused to look at this. I finally had to pull the conference organizer from his lunch to have the rate corrected by the manager. When I checked out, there was no apology for this inconvenience, nor thanks given for staying at the hotel. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again nor recommend anyone else to.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was not very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: bmsAppleton
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Long wait time. Room type not honored for 1st night and was told not guaranteed I would get double beds for my 7-night stay. Also, told that I didn't reserve double-beds, but then showed the rep the printout I had. Rep also said if my daughter comes and stays for two nights (reason why I requested 2 beds, my rate would be increased from $159 to $200-something because they would lose money by giving me 2 beds if I stayed at the quoted $159. After standing in line for quite a while to check in, I brought my two suitcases up to the 20th floor. My room keys did not work. I then saw a worker on the floor, and the worker opened the door after I showed him my key room number. The room was occupied with somebody else's belongings, so the worker locked the door and I then had to lug my suitcases back to the lobby, stand in line again, and talk to the manager. The gal who issued my room keys had written the incorrect room number on my card, not to mention that she was also very rude to me when I checked in. The first night, I was in a room with a king-sized bed. The safe did not work, so I kept my valuables in my colleagues room on 6th floor (I was on 20th floor). Second and subsequent nights, my safe did not work. Somebody came to work on it twice. Said he would have to have an engineer look at it. Never left me a message that the engineer could not fix it. I called front desk. They told me the safe door was on back order and they could not get me a safe from another room (even though I was staying 7 nights). Major inconvenience. I was told I could keep my money, jewelry and netbook at the front desk. That was unacceptable as I was not going to run from the 28th floor to the front desk every time I needed one of those items, nor was I going to run to the 6th floor to my colleagues room. I left the netbook unlocked in hopes that nobody would remove it from my room. I kept my money and jewelry under the bed mattress. Not acceptable for my stay. Every time I pressed the service desk button on the phone, somebody would answer; and while we were talking, the phone would keep ringing, and a second person would answer. Once, I even had a third person answer while there were two others on the line. Unbelievable. It got to the point that I wouldn't even explain why I was calling to the first person, I just simply waited for the second person to answer, assuming the first person would eventually hang up. Group had a Karoake and Comedy Sportz night in the hotel. There was a cash bar. A beer or glass of wine was $9/$10. Everyone left because of the terrible price of drinks. Hotel bar had $5 beer. When I received my bill, there was a bottle of wine charged to my room from the mini-bar. I took photos of the contents of the fridge as proof that I did not touch the mini-bar. Along with all of this frustration, I was not offered a free night's stay. I think the hotel should have at least offered some compensation for all of this frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Peachy13Keen
Reviews.Content: If you are going to do the double decker tour bus this is a great location to get on and off the bus, being only a couple blocks away from different bus stops. This was the cheapest hotel we found in downtown but it is by no means a cheap value. Plus side our room was very clean with very comfortable beds and although checkin wasn't until 4:00 we were able to check in around 12:00 when our flight landed and spend the rest of the day exploring Chicago. There was some downsides to this hotel. First you had to pay for internet which we found is not uncommon in Chicago but it was a bad connection. The first few hours we were there we had no internet access and after that the internet would randomly cut in and out at various times. Even if the internet had been free I wouldn't have been very happy with it. Second, you had to pay to use the pool and for parking. With as much as it costs to park and eat in this hotel the pool should certainly be free. We decided to not even bother paying to swim as we have a pool we can use at home for free. All in all if we come back we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: dbldutchtreat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and the room was fine. However, the real cost is significantly higher and it seemed like the whole time they were either trying to sells something or charge us for something. Parking is $30, they pushed a $30/day room upgrade (we declined), workout room or pool is another $15 per person per day, Internet is $10 per device per day.....it just seems to go on. Check on all the hidden fees an costs because our hot deal was not such a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Scarpaci
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago over the Canada Day/Independence Day long weekend. We got a good deal through Priceline, and I figured we would just get a standard room with a crappy view. We checked in and mentioned that we were celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary. The gentleman at the front desk, Marco was his name, said he was upgrading us to a corner suite and giving us a complementary breakfast! He treated us like royalty and made the 10 hour drive from Toronto worthwhile. The room had an unbelievable view. The bathroom is huge with a separate shower stall. As mentioned in previous reviews, do NOT touch anything in the minibar or you will be charged. I would suggest eating outside of the hotel since the cost of food here is very high. Even the free breakfast was not that great. If we had to pay for it, it would have cost us $30 per person for an omelette, toast, fruit, and some cereal. Walk over to Eggsmart just a block away outside or through the underground pathway. You can get a breakfast buffet there for $12.99 and it is a lot better. Parking is also ridiculous. They charge $52 per night for valet parking. All they do is park it in an underground garage. There is one just around the corner on Columbus Dr. Park it yourself there and it costs just $24 a night. You exit the garage in the building right beside the hotel so it is very convenient and could save you over $80 for the weekend. I would definitely stay in this hotel again just for the great location, which is just a couple of blocks from N. Michigan Ave and the Magnificient Mile. Millenium Park is close by as well. Internet service costs $9.95 a day and the gym costs money too. There's a lot of nickel and diming at the hotel, but if you just want a great room in a good location, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “The views are fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Worldly Woman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over 4th of July weekend and booked one week in advance on Hotwire. The property is a bit off the beaten path, very clean, has a friendly staff but lacks some amenities. I loved the room - great bed rivaling my favorite Westin Heavenly Bed, and a great shower. Views from the odd numbered rooms are of Lake Michigan and some newer residential space. Brand new construction beginning right next store, so be sure to ask if your room will face the construction site. Downside was no quick food service option for the morning to grab a coffee, fruit, bagel, etc. Lobby bar is small and uninspired. Served my needs for this trip, but probably best for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel - Great bed!”
Reviews.Author: S4Snowflake
Reviews.Content: I scored a great deal online at the Swissotel over the July 4 holiday weekend. The location is a few blocks off of Michigan Ave on Wacker, so easily walkable to various shopping destinations or a short cab ride to Oak Street. Highlights: great bed, large "rainwater" shower head, lots of towels, nice TV, spacious room, awesome views from top floors, excellent workout facility / pool. The Palm restaurant was nice, but this is definitely not a place for a wild and crazy nightlife. Nice family/business hotel. The Big Bar at the Hyatt a few doors down is a good nearby destination for a fun atmosphere. You won't go wrong here if you're looking for comfortable, quiet, convenient accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jazzlover23
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the view. The views from our room were truly spectactular. The location is also convenient. Other than that, it is an average property and experience to me. I booked into the Swissotel for a conference I was attending at the Fairmont. The Fairmont was full when we booked so Swissotel was the alternate. There were two other adults in my party and my 6 month old daughter. I called the hotel ahead of time and requested a room with two double beds to comfortably accomodate my party. When we arrived at the hotel, late Saturday night, there was one person at reception. We had to wait about 15 mins before we were served. Upon being served, we were told that there were no rooms with double beds available only kings. I told the receptionist that I had called in advance with my special requests. After some back and forth, she tells me there is a double room available after all but that it will need to be cleaned and that it will be about 45 mins to an hour before it would be ready. We agree to wait as we really have no choice. Some 15 mins later, someone claiming to be the manager comes over to us and tells us there are no double rooms and the only thing he can do is give us a king room with a rollaway and switch us to a double the next day. No explanation as to what happened to the double room they were supposed to be making ready for us. Tired and exasperated and needing to get our 6 month old to bed, we complete the transaction and head up. Once in the room, it takes 2 phone calls and more back and forth before the rollaway bed is brought up. We are told that it will cost us an extra $50.00 a night to have the rollaway (smh at this point!). Nothing of the sort was mentioned at reception. We were told that there would be an increase in the room rate because of the third person in the room but nothing about a charge for the use of rollaway. Random charge being added perhaps?? Throughout the whole ordeal at check in, no apologies from the lady at reception for getting our reservation wrong, no courtesies, no smiles, she was downright cold and indifferent notwithstanding that we were standing unfront of her with a very sleepy baby. And that cold and indifferent face was the first we encountered on entering the hotel...well it set the tone for the rest of our stay. With the exception of the room service attendants and the very kind lady who made up our room everyday, the staff of the hotel, especially the front desk and the concierge was unfriendly and most unhelpful! For the last couple of days of our stay we moved over to the Fairmont and it was like a breathe of fresh air. Like night and day in terms of quality of service, attitude and standard of hotel. In terms of amenities, our room was nothing special. The view was great and the room including the bathroom was spacious but the shower stall and bathtub were tiny and outdated. We had room service a few times and also had breakfast at Geneva. Nothing special and expensive. I could have dealt with the issues with our room if were afforded a professional and courteous manner. But the attitude of the front office lady and the "manager" left alot to be desired and there are just too many hotel rooms in Chicago to subject oneself to poor service and incompetence. It goes without saying that I will stay at the Swissotel in future even if you paid me and will not recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay but a Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: klkme
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Chicago for a business trip and booked here for several nights. Swissotel has always had a 1st rate reputation so I was very much looking forward to my stay. Upon check-in, I asked about a lakeview room. For $35 more a night, this was a go - plus, I got a high floor (40th) which I am very much a fan of. Super happy with my new room assignment - off to the elevator I went. An elevator door opened as I approached, so in I jumped; doors closed; and then --- uh-oh. There are no numbers to push. The semi-annoyed young man in the elevator with me informed me that I needed to key-in the floor number outside the elevator in the lobby. Whoops. Once I finally figured out the elevator and got to my room, I opened the door to what has to be the BEST view in Chicago - the Navy Pier and lake filled the entire window - just spectacular. I was very proud of my upgrade and then looked to the bed --- or beds as it turned out. The front desk failed to mention that this room had 2 of the tiniest beds in the state of Illinois. I guess they were double beds, but in the age of luxury hotels in America, no one expects smaller than a queen. The bathroom did have a seperate shower and tub, but honestly, there was no way I was bathing in there (unfortunate since this was another reason I was looking forward to the stay). The tub was old and stained as if it was the old tub/shower combo that had not been changed out when the bathroom was upgraded years ago. All in all, this was a confortable stay. I had most everything I needed (even an expired snack mix, with compliments - yuck), but I honestly expected much more from a Swissotel. The details were somehow missed at the Chicago location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't imagine a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: acegrad2011
Reviews.Content: Every member of the staff was helpful and went above and beyond in making us feel welcome. Rooms were spotless, beds were comfortable, and view was unbeatable. I loved the location because it was close to the Navy Pier, close to bus pick-ups, and had free fishing (hired by the city of Chicago) right across the street. If you want an alcoholic work of art, go to the Palms in the hotel. It's pricey but your drinks will be so pretty you will have to take pics of them before you drink them. I cannot imagine that there is a better place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice, service not so much”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom35805
Reviews.Content: I went back to this hotel for the second time for a conference that is there every year. The rooms are still nice, and well kept. The view from the higher floors is fabulous. The conference rooms were comfortable and well appointed. However, the service has slipped. The business center did not notify me about a package I was waiting for, and when I inquired about it they denied having it. Only after I checked the tracking number and it showed delivery did they even look. When I asked the front desk for help they were snippy and unhelpful. The chairs in the lobby are stained and dirty, and really need to be replaced. It gives the lobby a very shabby feel. On Friday, I asked for a 12:30 checkout (regular checkout time is noon). They flatly refused, because of " hotel capacity". I can't believe that half an hour would make a difference to them but it would have make it a lot more convenient for me. I hope the conference goes somewhere else next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a splurge”
Reviews.Author: libertinejvb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our wedding night. Got a corner king which had views of the river, the Loop, Michigan Ave, Navy Pier and the lake. Simply magical views - the pictures on their website do not lie. Service was excellent. The room service was over-priced and good, but certainly not worth the cost (room service really never is). The staff at the hotel were friendly and polite, the bed was comfy, the tub was fantastic to soak in, the shower clean and enjoyable. I really loved it and, if I had the money, would definitely stay in a place like this if I were a tourist in Chicago. Great location, close to so many attractions, and you never forget that you're in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel located Conveniently”
Reviews.Author: cloudiedays
Reviews.Content: Very lovely and comfortable hotel. We arrived late at night and still received a warm welcome as though from but took a less than 10 minute walk over to N Michigan Avenue and were able to find some wonderful places to sit down and eat. Not only that, it's convenient to many things (the Bean, the trains, shopping, eating, landmarks, etc.). I loved the room. We had a queen size bed with a view of the Chicago River and the Navy Pier. The bathroom had a tub and separate shower. It was very comfortable stay. We were lucky that we went after the snow storm, but it was still cold and rainy there. The comforters were great for the cold, but after awhile, I found myself peeling out of it mid way through the night. Complimentary Starbucks refreshments like fruit in water or apple cider (small shot sizes) in the lobby. A definite re-stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service for a Four Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: momofthreeboys29
Reviews.Content: Went to check in and front desk clerk told me my reservation was for one night only and I told her that was corrected and I had been sent a new confirmation by the booking company handling the convention. She went and got a supervisor who continued to tell me there was nothing they could do for me. After dissappearing to the back for quite some time, he once again came out only to tell me they would not have a room for my second night. So here I am travelling with my small children and all they could offer me wa to go find the convention people and ask what they suggest. After pretty much causing a scene in the lobby, they offered to call the booking commpany for me and find out what happened. Now the thing that really mad me off about this whole situation it that the hotel offered someone else beside me an upgrade for $100. So obviously the hotel had rooms available and just did not want to go above and beyond to provide excellent customer service as I would expect from a four star hotel. In addition, WiFi is an additional $9.95 a day, and pool usage is $15 per day/per person. Now that is what I call ridiculous. I mean you can go to almost any hotel in the day and age and get those amenities for no charge. Indoor pool felt as though they had the air conditioning on and not so clean as I saw clobs of hair in the water. Beds were nice-that is the only good thing I can say about Swissotel Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, but.......”
Reviews.Author: BtwBlackandWhite
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great view over Navy Pier and Chicago river. The habor and the Wheel, at night they were breathtaking. During summer time, every Wednesday and Saturday night they have the fireworks over at Navy Pier and rooms in this hotel get the front line seats. Negatives: Very plain bathroom. The tub and the shower curtain were somewhat disappointing. In general the room looked a little old if you pay attention to the small details such as the closet space and the armchair, although still within accpetable range from normal expectations. Lack of attention in room service. The restaurants they have in the hotel close at 10pm (which in my opinion is very early), so I ordered room service. They told me 20-25 mins but it took way more than 45 mins, and when food was delivered they forgot the beer that I ordered. I didn't check if they charged me for that beer, my guest and I were just too starving to argue at that point. Btw food came with plastic wrap on the plates, which was a little scary because that reminded me of airline food, but the taste was actually decent. All in all an okay hotel, location is great if you are looking for the view, the service, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: map2260
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. And what more could you want? Stayed just one night while in town visiting friends. Had read a couple negative reviews so was a bit apprehensive. However, after our stay I was left wondering if those negative reviewers had actually stayed at this hotel! When we arrived there were many many people in line to check-in (2-3 conventions and a wedding party at the hotel that weekend) but the staff handled everyone courteously and efficiently. The beds were AMAZING...like sleeping inside a marshmallow! That's all I can say really. Bathroom was spacious and well appointed with separate tub and glass shower. We didn't bother with a car while in Chicago (why would you!?) but I did notice parking was listed as $52/night(!!!). I did not remembering seeing that mentioned when we made the reservation so I could understand someone frustration with that surprise. Really though, with this hotel's location you don't need a car unless you're spending lots of time going between far flung suburbs (and then why would stay at this hotel?). There were always plenty of taxis, several major bus routes and metra stops within a 10-15 minute walk of the hotel. Michigan Ave, Millenium Park, Grant Park, Lakeshore, Navy Pier...all within a pleasant, easy walk from the hotel. Will definitely keep this hotel in mind next time we are in town! Two final notes: wireless throughout the hotel at a cost of $9.95/day. Fitness center and pool located on the 42nd floor which guests can use for $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and although it is a bit if a walk to the shops of Mich Ave, I cannot fault it! Absolutely amazing views especially if you get a corner room! The staff are friendly however I would admit that the breakfast buffet is really not up to much and is shamefully in the bowels of the hotel with no exterior views which is such a shame. Also the lobby can get very congested! But otherwise a very relaxing experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best of all our hotels this trip and thats 10”
Reviews.Author: bcrocombe
Reviews.Content: I only wish that all our hotels in America were even 70% as good as the SWISSOTEL we would have been overjoyed, after saveing for the holiday of a life time the SWISSOTEL lifted our expectations so very high pity the others didnnt

Reviews.Title: “Dependable Quality”
Reviews.Author: DPBird
Reviews.Content: Over Memorial Day: obtained 4/nights for $130/night (tax included) via Hotwire.com. Though not in middle of "Miracle Mile", close enough to most atttractions by walking or a short taxi ride. Quiet, understated hotel atmosphere: doesn't pretend to be anything other than it is - an efficient busy/family hotel of dependable quality. Large bathroom suite: shower and separate tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BandBCuties
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swiss during restaurant week and were very pleased. The location is great because it is on a street with a minimal amount of traffic but you are still steps away from the lakefront and Michigan avenue. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Also the room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was comfortable. We would definitely stay here again. The only down side is the expense of parking but if you have stayed anywhere in the city you just realize that it is going to be standard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - great views”
Reviews.Author: MidwestJA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May at the Swissotel. Rooms were well appointed and very clean. The entire hotel was in great shape and the architecture allowed for good views from all rooms. The restaurants were pricy ($26.99 for a basic breakfast buffet) so we did not eat there. You pay for parking ($52/night) internet and pool/spa access per day/per person. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. Nice location on the river near Navy Pier. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel info”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelfromMI
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there and was a little worried after reading the reviews. yes the parking is expensive. Very clean hotel. No bugs. Even though this is a convention hotel , you must walk next door to the Hyatt, which is no problem, unless it is pouring rain. The shuttles to the convention were on time. Once I got used to the elevators, they were very efficient , never waited over 1 min and the hotel was full. Yes they work different but I think its a better system, than the standard ones. I needed a refrigerator for medication and they brought one up n/c. no wierd charges on the bill. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in It's Own Way!”
Reviews.Author: NBMGR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a company-sponsored Gala. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay. The room itself was nice. It's tricky getting in there, so first time travelers, pay close attention on Wacker Dr. It's a quick right turn otherwise, you have to U-turn which can be hectic if you're unfamiliar with the area. When I arrived, everyone including the parking attendant, front desk, and bell-man were very nice and welcoming. The bell-man gave the usual tour of the room and facility. I had a double queen with a nice view of Navy Pier. Nice fluffy pillows and comforter. Internet was not free which to me is a dissatisfier. Parking was a bit expensive, $56.00 for the night but I think that's the going rate for a Downtown Hotel. I slept well, was not able to hear anything but I did stay out at the Gala til about 2AM at the Hyatt. When I awoke the next morning, I decided to have room service. Green Tea and Pancakes ran about $30.00 (including gratuity) but I have to say the food arrived rather quickly. I was satisfied with the breakfast, it was tasty and the service was great from the gentlemen who delivered it. My only gripe was nearing check-out. I casually looked over my bill that was slid under my door and noticed the expensive parking and an additional $78.00 for a bar-tab. Bar tab? I don't even drink alcohol what could that be? Belvidere Vodka....apparently is very expensive. I have to say when I called the front desk, they were very nice and removed charge immediately. So I really can't complain about that; however, pay close attention to your bill. Can you imagine how many times patrons are charged for that when they don't read the bill; probably numerous. Nice clean room and I would definitely stay again. I really felt everyone was caring and genuine; not snooty. Good job Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Amazing with this place !!”
Reviews.Author: rileychun
Reviews.Content: from the moment of arrival all was perfect, assistance when needed and a quiet.This hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Excellent location. Very friendly staff. Wonderful view of the Navy Pier,no additional charge.lots of food and entertainment close by and the hotel itself was just amazing. The entire staff was professional, fun and glad to help us naviagate our girls weekend. The lobby, bar and resturant was clean and inviting. Thanks for all service

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Most Difficult Group Reservation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kurt5280
Reviews.Content: My family wanted a two day weekend getaway in Chicago with four adjacent rooms on the same floorâ€¦but this was almost impossible because of the reservation system. When I requested four rooms together with the online reservation system I never received any e-mail confirmationsâ€¦after I called in I finally received four e-mail confirmations on different floors with different views either including or not including breakfast. After about six telephone calls and numerous e-mail confirmations I decided to cancel all of the reservations and move to Hyatt Regency next door but by chance Jackie, In House Reservation Manager, answered my call and corrected these continuing problems. However, when we arrived at the hotel we all had the same rate with breakfast but again on different floor with different viewsâ€¦the rooms had not been blocked before our arrival so another thirty minute correction at the front desk with a twenty dollar tip to the Desk Managerâ€¦on the same floor but we still did not have four adjacent rooms in a half-full hotel and the mini refrigerator was deliver to the wrong room. Basically, the problem is that there is a central reservation and an in house reservation and neither have automatic e-mail confirmationâ€¦and if you have a reservation with breakfast this has to be manually updated in the system by either calling after making the online reservation or at the front desk at check-in. Also the rumor about charging for the included breakfast is trueâ€¦My parents and my aunt went down to breakfast early and told the server that they had breakfast included with the room and were handed an menu to order and a complimentary bill at the end of breakfast which was instead charged to my roomâ€¦so after we ate breakfast I was a little surprise later that day with $80 breakfast bill was added to my room charge for my parents and auntâ€¦this continuing problem could easily be corrected by providing guests with a buffet breakfast voucher like other hotels but this is an obvious "bait and switch" to get guests to twice pay for breakfast. Regardless, I was another thirty minutes at the front desk correcting this problem and the only reason I think this charge was removed was because it was added to my room and not my parents and aunt roomsâ€¦also this breakfast charge was submitted to my credit card within hours and had to be removed before check-out. In summary, if you believe that a group reservation for four rooms at a $200/night hotel should include 30-minutes online making a reservation, 2-3 hours on the telephone correcting the reservations, another 30-minutes at the front desk correcting the reservations again, then another 30-minutes correcting additional charges before check-out, and like this much chaos...then I highly recommend the Swissotel for your next family weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be better than this”
Reviews.Author: Hexa67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. All has been said about location, cleanness, hospitality & freindely of staff and beautiful views from all directions, but Ms. Charmaine M. Gage ( the night manager ) is the cream of the cream...thank you swissotel, we will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel fancy”
Reviews.Author: akorpi76
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Excellent location. Very friendly staff. Clean and modern, very cool. We felt like VIPs for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “runs like a clock swiss time!”
Reviews.Author: skykid
Reviews.Content: great views and walk to everything. most comfortable bed ever! choice windows hot baths and clean!! got a deal online too. friendly staff and quiet rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tcasey4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view of the Navy Pier, all I had to do was ask, no additional charge. The lobby was welcoming and provided fresh water. The elevators were a fun treat, you pressed your lobby floor number, not simply up or down. The restaurant The Palm, was horrible, but I did not include this in this review. The room was amply supplied with robes, fresh (and extra) linens, umbrella, flash light and good coffee. Oh and an expensive mini bar which I did not partake in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HBo7
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and a great location. I walked almost everywhere and shuttles were provided any place that I couldn't walk to. When I return to Chicago, I definitely will call this hotel. Cheers, Haley

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hockeygoon96
Reviews.Content: First time ever staying at the Swissotel and stayed there because it was the best deal we found online. It ended up being a great decision. Excellent location, close to Millenium Park and Michigan Ave, right on the River not far from Navy Pier, lots of food and entertainment close by and the hotel itself was just amazing. Only down side was how expensive food was actually at the hotel, otherwise it was fantastic. Will definitely choose this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: neville248
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Swissotel the weekend of April 1st. Marco at the front desk was wonderful. He had a wonderful since of humor and couldn't have been nicer. We checked in early and had no trouble getting a room. I have had trouble in the past with other hotels getting a room early. He asked if I wanted a room on a higher or lower floor, it's Chicago the higher the better please. Great room with wonderful view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. Room was good size and very clean. We could hear some low level talking from the bathroom vent, but the room it's self was very quiet. Comfortable beds, and nice size flat screen tv. Bettie are housekeeper was always available for more towels and supplies, she went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. I don't know why people are complaining about the elevator system. It really is a great concept and sure keeps people moving, I loved it. The only complaint I have is with their concierge. They are not really very friendly or helpful. If you need directions to a store on Michigan Ave. they are fine, if you need help trying to get into a restaurant on a busy Saturday night forget it. Just not really impressed with them. A smile goes a long way people. All and all a very positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Painfully overpriced food in restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Meathawk
Reviews.Content: Checked in nice hotel, unique triangular building, made for unique room layout. Great view of the river, navy pier, and sunrise from Lake Michigan. Well appointed ammenities, everything functional. billing was correct, concierge was helpful. Decent corporte room rate. Centrally located to most of the downtown action. Downside - Coffee, Apple Juice, Eggs Benedict for one = $35.00 before tip. So called potatoes were greasy and cold, eggs not poached medium, but bullet proof, no 3 minute check from server, although otherwise service was ok. An absolute ripoff, and I tipped 7% to support my point. Restaurant was in basement of hotel. sterile decor, no view of lake or River or downtown. Plenty of pretention, no delivery on quality of product. Bottled water in the room $8.00, also a ripoff. I've been in foodservice for a long time, and there isn't any bacon and eggs in the world worth $29, nevermind a benny and bevvies for $35 In-room coffee was plastic tub pod system. Coffee tastes like burnt dirt and plastic. thank god it was comped. Business Centre was a desk in a closet next to the front desk, brutally hot, tough to get online to check in to flight in advance. Stay in the Hotel, but don't waste your time or money on anything else in here.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: janet80Morton_Il
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in several chicago hotels and this is one we will cross off the list and never stay there again. On reservation requested late checkout, upon arrivial requested late checkout again. My daughter was competing in a gymnastic event that did not get over with until 1:00pm, husband called hoted to reassure the late checkout, asst. manager said there would be a $75.00 fee. He had to leave the event. Noisy neighbors all night long, management did nothing, requested to be moved, all had to clear the room at 1 30am if we wanted to. (child already asleep) had to call the noisy room ourselves. Daughter had to be up at 6:00am. There is a charge just to use the pool. Not worth it considering the water temp, was cold. Staff was rude and did nothing to help our situation. Great view from room that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Option”
Reviews.Author: Boonstra_Familiy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during an business trip to Chicago. Location is fine, close to the main shops etc. Swimingpool on 42nd and Gym is also a good option. Nothing special, but fine. Airco was a negative point, it's alway on (with sound) and windows can't be opened. Quite some noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: 55711Brenda
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago once a month on business since December and always enjoy my stay. The entire staff is very friendly and always greets me coming in or leaving the hotel. The rooms are always very clean with a great view. During my most recent stay I ordered room service every night and was very pleased with the quality and presentation of the food. The delivery person is very courteous and made sure that my order was correct. Thanks to all the staff for making a weary business traveler feel as much at home as possible. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and will use this hotel for my personal use also.

Reviews.Title: “stay was perfect”
Reviews.Author: letsmotor101
Reviews.Content: from the moment of arrival all was perfect, assistance when needed and a quiet, immaculate suite with incredible view. they also reward their guests by charging half for hybrid cars; nice to be thanked for driving green. former issue with elevators (last fall) has been resolved. we've stayed here many times before and will return for any trip to downtown chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonable price, not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dlobb
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Swissotel. This time I roomed with a colleague so couldn't upgrade to a corner room because it only has a King bed (well worth the upgrade if a king bed works for you). The hotel lobby is a little small and not much going on (the Hyatt next door has "The Big Bar" which is really lively). The Swissotel does have The Palms restaurant located right off of the Lobby which is a fantastic restaurant although it is expensive. Location of Swissotel is not bad but a bit of a walk into the center of town, especially when it's cold. I slightly prefer the Hyatt next door as I prefer a "lively" hotel but would have no problem staying at the Swissotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a luxury getaway in the windy city? Keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: Gigs23
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about our trip to Chicago and chose the Swissotel based on our research. We were in for a surprise! While the location and rooms were good, the hotel staff was unfriendly and rude but most of all my husband and I were extremely upset to find all the extra costs required for use of hotel amenities such as the internet (extra $10), pool and fitness facility (extra $15 per person per day -- yikes!). As individuals who have had the opportunity to stay at some of the world's finest Relais & Chateaux properties, it is expected that when choosing to stay at a luxury hotel of a higher price than others that these amenities would be included in the price. If you're looking for a nice luxurious getaway with exceptional service in downtown Chicago, don't choose the Swissotel -- keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2011
Reviews.Content: Love the SwissHotel. The entire staff was professional, fun and glad to help us naviagate our girls weekend. The lobby, bar and resturant was clean and inviting. The bartender and manager were happy to help us try new drinks and laugh right alondg with us. Oh and the rooms, fabulous! Clean and tastfully decorated. The bed had to have been the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The down comforter kept us warm and happy, just like at hme. Only down side are the fees for everything else, such as the spa/pool/work out room. But that is common place anywhere now to pay extra for what I feel are standard extras. And hey who wouldn't enjoy saying, 'The SwissOtel in downtown Chi-town". :-)

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: kff323
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is, by far, one of my favorite places to stay in Chicago. Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and amenities. Who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem In Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: froglogic
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent the weekend in the city(yes we are from the burbs but I work in the loop so I'm down here every weekday) and we just can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was. The rooms are very nicely finished and the views are great! The staff was also very interested in making our stay wonderful. A great example of this was that on Sunday morning we were about to head out to the Institude of Art and it started to rain right when we hit the door to the hotel. Each room has an umbrella in it for your use but a doorman heard me say that I was going to run back up to the room to get ours and instead told us to just wait a moment. He went to the front desk and got us two!

Reviews.Title: “Prices for dinner and breakfast here were out of control.”
Reviews.Author: Hyatt9181
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The service was wonderful. It was my family's first time staying in Chicago, so when I went online to find a hotel, this hotel seemed clean and well kept. What the web site failed to show was the class of the hotel. I was very shocked with the prices. The breakfast buffet was $26.00, and kids eat free. I asked the front desk and the server how they did the whole kids eat for free, and they said they can eat the buffet for free, period. I thought this was a nice thing the hotel did for kids. The only thing they fail to mention is that you have to purchase the buffet for the kids to eat free. I wasn't the only family who misunderstood this. I watch three families serve their children the buffet, and then wanted to order from the menu, or not at all. For two eggs, it would cost $12.00. My kids did have the buffet, and the server was nice enough to realize I misunderstood how the whole thing on how the kids eat free worked, and let me order off the menu. My french toast and diet Pepsi cost me $20.86 That is crazy. With $20.00 I could have purchased 17 cartons of eggs. Also, the one who I made reservations with, told me we would be a quarter mile from the Shed Aquarium, this was wrong, we had to take a taxi, and it was about a ten minute cab drive. This was not what we wanted. We wanted to be able to walk to the museum and enjoy the the walk with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-around”
Reviews.Author: pantograph
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in an "Executive corner suite". My room was on the 38th floor. The room was really nice and very clean. The staff were all very friendly. The doorman greeted me everytime I came in and said goodbye when I left. The woman who checked me in was very friendly and professional. The room had great views of Navy Pier and also looking south towards the loop. The room was laid out well and I really liked the desk area. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large with a mirror TV! There were also 3 other LCD TVs throughout the room. The hotel is located slightly off from the center but is only about 2 blocks from Michigan Ave. It took me about 35 minutes to walk to Union Station and about 15-20 minutes to walk to the John Hancock Center. The nearest L stop is about 10 minutes away. Overall a good location, and definitely a good location for the views. I didn't try the restaurants but I did order room service. Both the woman on the phone and the man who delivered it was very friendly. The food was better than what I've had in other hotels for room service. Also - I experienced no elevator problems. I never had to wait more than 20 seconds for an elevator in either direction. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best views of Lake Michigan and equally great staff.”
Reviews.Author: SafariAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff who have been here as long as we have been coming 16 years). Everyone is just like family, from the valet parking, concierge desk, bell hop. Housekeeping is also wonderful and prompt. Room service is a delight when you have your grandson visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Incredible views, Treated like a King”
Reviews.Author: lisa1smith
Reviews.Content: A must stay! Swissotel Chicago exceeded my expectations. My room was huge, and well furnished. The views of Lake Michigan & Chicago skyline were breathtaking. Conveniently located; steps from Michigan Avenue. I stayed for business, but took my family. The hotel was really kid-friendly. Pool & fitness center were great. Top-notch service across the board. I felt special and valued. I wanted to move in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce080
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend in Chicago, as we have several times in the past. We stayed at the Swissotel, repeating some of our earlier stays. This has become our favorite hotel in the city. The views are excellent, the rooms are nicely appointed and the service is both friendly and efficient. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Died and Went to Hotel Heaven”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrealand
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is the cleaness hotel that I have ever stayed in and my spouse and I have been to many popular hotels. The beauty and cleanliness of the Swissotel extends from the guests' rooms to the restaurants and public restrooms. We were celebrating our 50th anniversary and we were given royal treatment; The Swissotel management upgraded our room at no extra charge, gave us a cake on a tray that wished us a "Happy 50th anniversay" and a bottle of champaign. Our room had a view of Navy Pier and at night, that view was breath taking. Felt like we had "Died and Went to Hotel Heaven". This was an experience that we will be talking about for the next 'fifty years'. The restaurants' foods were a little pricey but delicious; and you could cut orders in half; everything about this hotel was above excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparty1983
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week here (1/10-1/14) and everything was excellent. The staff was extremely courteous, hotel was exceptionally clean, excellent restaurant onsite, nice workout facility and lounge area. It was also extremely convenient to use the 'Pedway' to be able to walk underground to our meetings in the 231 Michigan building - not having to walk outside in Chicago in January: Priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some areas need improvement”
Reviews.Author: mtpiper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel Chicago on business the last week in January. I had a "corner king" room on the 21st floor (room 2119) with outstanding views looking to the lake and Navy Pier and around to the south toward Grant Park. After taxes, around $200 per night. Check-in went smooth and the staff was very friendly. I called guest services for a tube of toothpaste and it was delivered, along with 2 toothbrushes, in under 10 minutes. One complaint I have with guest services: There is a breakfast menu in the room. Fill it out and hang it on the door for the next morning. I tried this the first 3 mornings I was there, and each morning it was still hanging on the door and no breakfast. Iâ€™ve had this happen at other hotels, so I was prepared to go out for breakfast. If youâ€™re willing to take a 5 minute walk, head over to Delmonico Deli in the pedway for the buffet of fresh fruit and made to order breakfast for much less (than the hotelâ€™s breakfast of oatmeal, toast, banana, coffee and orange juice for $30!). The room was spacious, clean and nice, with a few exceptions. The room is near the elevators and there is VERY noticeable elevator noise in the room when one of them runs (I think it's the one that hasn't been updated yet). At first, I thought I was hearing the "L" go by somewhere below, but realized that was not the case after the first night (the L isnâ€™t even close to the hotel). It's quite frequent in the morning when people are leaving the hotel. I sleep best in hotels with the room fan running, so that helped. But, if you're a light sleeper who has to have quiet, this is not the room for you. I'm sure requesting a room away from the elevators would solve this problem. No complaints on the elevators themselves, other than looking quite worn, for recently being â€œupdatedâ€�. I have also seen complaints about the TV not working right and had the same experience here. Iâ€™m a tech guy and found that the cable connection was loose where it goes into a splitter. I didnâ€™t have any way to tighten it (there are security boots around the connectors), but did find if I positioned it just right, the signal was good and didnâ€™t drop out. Looks like an easy fix, given the correct tools. At check-in, I was asked if I wanted gym access for the week, at $15 a day. Thatâ€™s too much for me, but opted for 2 days of access. When I checked out, they had billed me for 3. They corrected that mistake with no questions (luckily, the girl at the front desk had noted at check-in that I only wanted 2 days). Check your bill before you leave!! Like others have said, if youâ€™re used to â€œ5-starâ€� hotels, youâ€™ll be disappointed with Swissotel. I normally donâ€™t have access, or budget, for really nice hotels, but have stayed in a few. Itâ€™s nice, but not spectacular. And if your version of â€œaffordableâ€� food is a salad and dessert (no drinks) for $30, then youâ€™ll be right at home here. Any restaurant in the vicinity of the hotel will be higher priced (a New York strip steak, 2 drinks, plus tip was $64 at one place). I do have one place you MUST visit if you like Italian food. Club Lago at 331 W Superior (corner of Superior and Orleans). It's a $10 cab ride, or about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. We took a cab there and walked back. Itâ€™s a 3rd generation family owned place and the food is fantastic! Itâ€™s not a high end place, but has a great atmosphere and great prices (dinner was $16!!). Your soda pop arrives in the can, and the food is served on dishes that were probably around when they opened the placeâ€¦itâ€™s like eating at home! I loved it!! I would have gladly paid twice the price for the food! http://www.clublago.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: enigmatic00
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely week end here in Spring. The rooms are quite spacious and some of them have amazing views of the lake, We got a room with a view of the river. The staff was very friendly and gave us good pointers on where to go in the area. It can be hard to find if you are driving there even with a GPS simply because Chicago has four different Wacker drives on different levels. Also the parking ramp for the Hotel is almost impossible to find as its hidden behind the hotel and shared with another building. We would definitely go back but never drive ourselves..;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lakers2011
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel, although I did not stay there too much. The elevators were a little weird but since it was a business trip and I did not have to pay, it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, pleasant staff, very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Gail0724
Reviews.Content: Took my niece downtown for college graduation & holiday shopping. Beautiful hotel, awesome room with a view of the lake & the river. Very accommodating staff, upon arrival through past check out! Purchased holiday shopping package and gift card had expired. Staff was quick to try to find a solution, ultimately crediting my account the difference so my stay was a a very good deal! We felt like we were on a special trip from the moment we arrived. Accommodations were clean, warm & inviting. I will definitely stay at the Swissotel again on my next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Swissotel made my New Years Eve a great memory!”
Reviews.Author: 9yrsmarriedatlast
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening on December 31, 2010. The hotel was full of energy and excitement with many guests coming and going. The staff was welcoming and very friendly. I mentioned to the evening manager that my wife and I were newlyweds and that this was the last evening of our honeymoon. Shortly after getting to our room, room service arrived with a complimentary bottle of champagne. " Thank You Alex & Staff " We had a wonderful evening dining and celebrating in the downtown area. The hotel was extremely clean and modern - a real pleasure and wonderful experience!! We'll be back again when it gets a bit warmer to take in the rest of the city sights.

Reviews.Title: “get a corner room”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the river and because of the triangular shape of the building corner rooms have a great panoramic view from the Wrigley building to Navy pier. I didn't experience the slow elevators or the bad TV reception noted in other reviews. Thanks to some of those same reviews I didn't touch the minibar so no undue charges appeared on my bill. I do share the complaint of others that charging for an internet connection in this day and age is enough to make me seek alternative lodging options the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: CPD004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel from 30 Dec 10---03 Jan11 and stayed in the lake view room. The room was very spacious and it had the best view of the lake and Navy Pier. It was very nice waking every morning with the sun and seeing how the lights from Navy Pier with the ferris wheel and Lake Shore Drive come alive. You couldn't ask for a better view of the fireworks to ring in the New Year with the floor to ceiling windows. Everyone from the hostess at check in to housekeeping were very friendly. The room was very spacious, the bed was very comfortable but the pillows were a little to soft for our taste. The bathroom had a seperate shower and a soaking tub for those wonderful bubble baths. I was very disapointed that the internet and the gym were not free (which we didn't use because of it). I felt for the price and upscale of the hotel, those things should be free. If you don't mind doing a little walking, you can find just about anything to eat and things to do. If walking isn't your cup of tea, cabs are right outside and there is a bus line a block away. We love our city and can't wait until the summer to go back and play tourist again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Wild4ChicagoHotels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Chicago on Christmas day, and they upgraded us, for free, to one of their suites... and everything about the suite was fantastic! The customer service at checkin was great... they let us check in early along with the free upgrade. I will be staying again at the Swissotel Chicago when I return! Along with recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: JJD82
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself looked beautiful from the outside, tall, all glass and by the water. Inside it was just ok. The staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms were clean and fairly spacious. Some guestrooms are facing the water so you get a beautiful view of the river. Other than that, everything else is very average. It's located on East Wacker so in order get to all the shops and restaurants in Michigan Avenue, you need to walk about 10-15 minutes, which is fine, but there are tons of hotels situated on Michigan Avenue or just a block away from. The elevator at this hotel is a total mess. It's not user friendly and often takes very long, which results in large crowds just waiting by the elevators. The biggest selling point for this hotel is the price. It is about 20% lower than other hotels in the nearby area (in the same hotel class), and from the looks of their website, they often do special promotions which brings the prices down even lower. My experience with them was ok, but I personally wouldn't stay here again solely because it look very long times to get in and out the hotel/my room due to poor elevator service; and I would like to be a few blocks closer to shops and restaurants. It is a great hotel for business travelers, I would not recommend this for family or romantic trips.

Reviews.Title: “Room is excellent. Service sucks”
Reviews.Author: RAY0009
Reviews.Content: Room are perfect with excellent view. But service is bad and they don't carry respect. Very expensive parking of $52 and let me tell you a shocking news, they stole my GPS. And they say what is the guarantee that you have a GPS in your car, and fill a claim foam at the end. They don't realize that i pay 3 times for a night room than a GPS, i don't damn care about the GPS but a little respect and care for there customer. I never recommend for this hotel ever in my life again.

Reviews.Title: “It truley was a "home away from home" during the Holidays!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinesMOM2010
Reviews.Content: Visiting my daughter during the holidays,alone, was not easy. I have stayed in many of the best hotels in downtown Chicago over the years, but I keep going back to my favorite. The Swissotel. I am always greeted with a friendly smile,and treated like royalty from Eric, the doorman. ( Honestly , he must work 24-7, right?) Charmaine, the check-in clerk, took care of my every wish, with a smile and professionalism. I was checked in promptly and off to my pristine comfy room, with a breathtaking view. After unpacking...I changed into my swim suit and the plush robe hanging in the closet ---- headed straight for the rooftop indoor hot-tub and pool on the 42nd floor. Then, as I was soaking, and the snow began to fall, the view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier was indescribable.Ahhhhh. Oh! Did I tell you about the fireplace, next to their Starbucks Coffee Bar? And the best shopping in the world ,was only a few steps away...just waiting for me. Erick blew his whistle,for an instant cab, and off for ice skating, with my daughter, in Millennium Park. A PERFECT HOLIDAY!!! Thanks Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it unless you are a thief”
Reviews.Author: Surachai
Reviews.Content: I and my friend stayed there between December 25th and 26th, 2010. I paid $214.20 for the room. Later on, I found another $200 charge by the Swissotel in my credit card statement. As it turned out, the unexpected charge was for a missing multipurpose alarm clock, which I did not recall seeing at any point during my stay (to clarify, I saw no clock in the room at all). The situation has been handled very poorly. There are three separate issues here. Firstly, they did not make any attempt to reach out to me â€“ a customer â€“ regarding the missing item. I deposited my luggage at the hotel concierge after the check out for seven hours and could have simply allowed them to search my luggage if they were eager to do so. Secondly, they did not make any attempt to inform me regarding the $200 charge. From my perspective, this is ironically an act of theft; I was robbed $200 behind my back. Thirdly, I practically have to bear the burden of proof. I had to call several people at the hotel simply to obtain the details of the $200 charge. A few of them indicated that they would return my phone calls to no avail. In addition, I am under the impression that I must be responsible for the imaginary $200 alarm clock regardless. Frighteningly, someone who had an access to the room could have emptied the mini bar, stealing any items (bathrobes, TV, and so on), etc. And I could end up being responsible for thousand dollars for these missing items without any means to prove otherwise. That is, I would be deemed a theft while actually being robbed regardless. On a positive note, the hotel stay itself was as pleasant as the last time that I stayed in 2007 â€“ which was the main reason that I chose Swissotel over many other hotels in Chicago, especially the Renaissance which is my focal choice elsewhere. And I should recognize one of the receptionists â€“ I believe her nickname is Nazir (she has a long last name) â€“ for her exceptional services. All these make it rather sad that I will never stay in any Swissotel hotels again for my entire life. Oh! If you are a thief, try not to leave your credit card account there since they will charge you later on. And for those who are not a thief, you may want to ask for a check-in checklist so that you can walk through and make sure that there is nothing missing during your stay. Surachai Khitatrakun

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: cricket23chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Years Eve so we could watch the fireworks from Navy Pier, that didnt happen because 2 building are right in front of the area where they shoot of the fireworks.
