Maybe from the top floor you could see but we were on the 26th, its a beautiful view of Navy Pier and the city but not for fireworks.We were very impressed with the efficentcy at check in and the security at night.It was so quiet we slept great. (The sheets could be a better quality they were scratchy.) Great bathroom with a great view too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice corner room”
Reviews.Author: Volks79
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 4th floor corner room. Walls of windows. Nice view of pier. Good value for the area. Only problems were related to the elevator service and elevator noise. Very very slow. Had to take stairs a couple of times but this was new years eve, not sure if it is like that all the time. From room 419, elevator noise is obvious and could disrupt sleep. Parking is $$$

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: lmas0515
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend staying at the Swissotel in Chicago. I was travelling with a friend and we arrived at different times. She had booked the hotel but had added my name to the reservation since I would be arriving first. The "night manager" at the hotel was extremely rude and told me I could not check in since they could not find the note about my name being on the reservation. (this was THEIR mistake) They told me I could sit in the lobby for 4 hours until my friend arrived. They did nothing to try and help me until I stood there and complained for twenty minutes. I can't believe that a "manager" would treat a customer this way. There are other great hotels in Chicago. This hotel is not worth the aggravation!

Reviews.Title: “Class, comfort and genuine caring for their clientelle”
Reviews.Author: desimport
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay almost a full week at the Swissotel. I arrived after a 6 a.m. flight, and checked in to a beautifully appointed room, then headed downstairs for breakfast. I ordered off the menu, hoping to avoid a food item I have a known allergy to that was on their amazing buffet, but when my plate arrived, there was the offending item. While I did my best to communicate the need to create a new plate of food, unfortunately I was exposed and needed to seek medical attention. The Swissotel staff, responded immediately to my need for assistance, providing the name of the closest hospital, calling my room to see how I was doing, and offering any aid they could. I was able to sit down with staff and discuss the process for returning a meal because of allergies, and was impressed with the training and policy changes made immediately after my incident. While other hotels have made a half hearted gesture or offered a stock response to issues I have brought to their attention, Swissotel sincerely wanted to find ways to make their service better. I respect and admire this in a service provider, and have wholeheartedly recommended my company and our partners use Swissotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Betty123Go
Reviews.Content: Swissotel provides the ultimate Chicago experience. The 42nd floor shower in the women's locker room allows you panoramic views of Chicago while you shower. It's been my favorite Chicago hotel for 2+ years! Staff is outgoing and friendly. We love to stay here whenever we're in Chicago! Location is excellent and views are unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel with Great Views of the City”
Reviews.Author: traveler60305
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Swissotel and was treated extremely well. Used Hotwire.com and got lucky with this 4.5 star hotel. They treated us as normal guests even though we used Hotwire. Gave us an extroadinary room with beautiful view of the city and lake. Great bedding and amenities in the room. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lostinmadrid28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at Swissotel, where we celebrated my 30th birthday. Check-in was quick, the woman at the check-in desk wished me a Happy Birthday and upgraded us to a corner suite! The room was large, beautiful and, from the 41st floor, had an amazing view of the river, lake Michigan and Navy Pier. Very comfy bed - we slept like babies! After we returned from dinner, the hotel even delivered a mini-birthday cake as a celebratory amenity. This was very unexpected but a great touch, especially since my husband had received a good deal for the room on Priceline. We did not pay full price for our room and still got so many nice upgrades and complimentary additions to our stay. The hotel has a great location, walking distance to the Mag Mile. It's easy to get a cab as well for quick access to amazing restaurants, shopping, and everything else Chicago has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: surf4roger
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated a family members birthday by bringing our families together and staying at the Swissotel. What an amazing birthday it was and one that we will never forget. From the amazing service, the to the first-class amenities, everything was perfect. We even had the opportunity to experience a special dining opportunity to celebrate the milestone birthday with the executive chef, and couldn't have asked for more. We are two months out from our visit and yet every family member is still raving about the wonderful weekend we had at the Swissotel. Thanks Swiss for making this birthday the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do in Chi - town”
Reviews.Author: dobber16
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The location was great, just south of the river close to the lake. Walking distance to just about everything we wanted to do. The service was very friendly and all those we encountered were very helpful. Valet parking was quick and efficient, rooms were clean and well appointed with a great view of the Navy Pier. Had to go up a couple of floors to get an ice machine that worked, however that was the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel, small details in room need to be addressed...”
Reviews.Author: areno24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came with our two infant babies and I had called ahead a day early to make sure that two cribs were placed in the room and a refrig for their formula. I was told no problem we will take care of it, so when we landed we called again and said please make sure the items were in the room and that the refrig be turned on so it will be cold. We were again told, "we see the notes on the reservation and we will make sure it is take care of". When we arrived at 10pm after flying from California there was only one crib in the room and the refrig was in the room but was turned on to the least cool setting so it was still warm. The crib was soon sent up and I moved the chair to find a ketchup packet (unused) under the chair. I said okay no problem, then in the corner of the room was some paper, and then behind the curtain more trash. It wasnt dirty paper, it just made me question the cleaniness of the room. The next day I noticed that the shelves under the TV were covered with dust and that the sheets had a hole in them, the door to the minibar has a broken hinge and the door to the bath room is all chewed up as if someone pried the door open. But let me tell you that the staff made up for all the shortcomings. They were pleasant, and very helpful since I was tarveling with my 5 month old twins. This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel and it is truely a gem for customer service... Thank you to Rhonda and the staff for taking care of my family while visiting your city. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but horrific customer service”
Reviews.Author: Orangestar8
Reviews.Content: Flight to Chicago was cancelled but still charged for full night room. Decided to stay next night and was not offered any kind of upgrade or apology or reason to come back. Fees for fitness center and inattentive to room issues

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: My room on the 41st floor was pretty swanky. The bed was really good. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “we got a good deal, but they'll nickel & dime you”
Reviews.Author: joisey-joe
Reviews.Content: we got a last minute rate on priceline for here.....but the minute you walk in we started getting nickeled and dimed....you want an upgrade, it'll cost you, $50-something to park, $9 for bottled water, $15 for internet....i know they're hitting up foreign business types for these charges, but puh-leeze....we're average folks looking for an overnight for a family function.....the hotel is beautiful & clean (which with the current bedbug situation in big cities is a major concern), so i'll pay the price for the room if it is what get sme clean & nice, but treat your guests like guests, not a cash-cow.......hint & tip....we self-parked about 1 mile away, saved over $20 on parking and cabbd once for $6 and walked back in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: anitawalls
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with a great view! Each summer we stay downtown for a Chicago weekend getaway. This year we stayed at the Swissotel for the first time. The hotel was very nice, with an excellent view of the Navy Pier fireworks on Saturday night. The only caution is the price of meals purchased at the hotel. But since there are so many other great eating options in Chicago, it's no problem. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Tracy70433
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is an amazing hotel. The staff was so pleasant and very helpful. Our view from the room was perfect. Our daughter loved the huge bed, which was very comfortable. The hotel is centrally located to all the hot spots of Chicago. We will definately stay here next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!! Beautiful river and lake views including Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: jwfrazier
Reviews.Content: Swissotel always makes a pleasant stay and the Swissotel Chicago was no exception. The location was excellent! Just a short walk to Michigan Ave and you are just right across the road from the river which now has a great waterfront for walking or a morning run. Beautiful city, beautiful views from most rooms, very good service and ammenities. You can sign up for their rewards program and receive complimentary breakfast and use of the gym and pool as well. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “There should be more Swissotel's in the U.S... great brand!”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Swissotel might be my favorite hotel in Chicago. The views are gorgeous from the upper rooms. The penthouse pool and gym is very worth the extra charge. Also there is a Palm's restaurant in the lobby, get the lobster.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eduncanz28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel Sept. 24-26 as attendee of on-site business meeting. Checked in around 11 pm Thurs night. Checkin line was short and clerk was pleasant. The $15 gym fee was waived for our group, but the clerk did not volunteer this. I was only informed upon inquiring. Room was clean, comfortable and very well-furnished. Room was generally quiet with the exception of SAturday night when the whole hotel became modestly noisy. Desk in room has multiple built-in I/O connections for computer networking and other functions which was very convenient. Continental breakfast furnished by hotel for meeting attendees was superb as it was much healthier than most hotels provide (much fresh fruit) and extremely well stocked. Many hotels place one serving of food out at 7am and don't restock the buffet but Swissotel continually restocked the food bar for the meeting. I asked for assistance from hotel employees several times and received a prompt, courteous and helpful reply every time. The "Magnificent Mile" was a short walk from the hotel. Also, the subway back to O'Hare is a short walk and much cheaper than the airport shuttle van ($2.25 vs $25). A very nice hotel overall! Would definitely recommend as this is probably the nicest hotel I ever stayed at for a business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “strange things to cheap out on”
Reviews.Author: agnesofdog
Reviews.Content: typical hotel in downtown area. the idea of paying 259 plus huge taxes for a room and then being b illed 10/day for wifi, and extra for using pool and/or fitness center really pisses me off. I canstay at comfort inn for less than 100 b ucks and have all that stuff included plus free breakfast--yes, it's not the same chi chi la la stuff, but gotta tell say that most people who can afford these rates in would imagine are used to fairly soft 2ply toilet paper--this stuff is sandpaper like you'd get in a european airport--there are two full time pople in the lobby to help you push the elevator button for your floor, and of course you are instructed when you check in on going to the elevator and pushing the button for your floor--about as useful as the flight attendant demonstrating how to buckle your seat belt

Reviews.Title: “From the front desk personnel, parking attendants, room service and concierge the experience was welcoming and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Dottann
Reviews.Content: Everyone of these services went out of their way to assist us in some capacity. Please extend our appreciation to your outstanding staff. I want you to know how much we enjoyed your hotel, your personnel and the ambiance created there and that we plan to come again.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great, but...”
Reviews.Author: Spacrawler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels in Chicago, especially on N Michigan Ave, I was not sure what to expect at the Swissotel. Well, the property could not be better located - right over the Chicago River, views of Navy Pier, and blessed quiet on the higher floors (we were on the 37th). The really high end properties on N Michigan are lovely, but noise is a huge factor as are the crowds. So big thumbs up for the location. Otherwise... nothing very special. The hotel appears to be a great value online with very attractive room rates. We paid ~$200 with breakfast, but literally everything else is a charge. Pool? Check. Parking? $52 worth of check. Morning coffee? $4 or close to it at the bar. The breakfast buffet cost us about $6 each, which was fair, but it would be a total ripoff for the $26 normally charged. In room internet charge? Check. The rooms are perfectly acceptable and they were clean. The a/c worked great, maybe too great as there was no way I could see to turn off the fan. The bathroom space is tight but the shower is big and the tub was a welcome addition. I probably would not stay here again because I love the super-luxe Chicago properties too much, but I would recommend it if you can manage to keep all the extra charges to a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Broken Lifts, Broken Toilet and no curtains!”
Reviews.Author: tree888
Reviews.Content: What on earth is going on with this hotel? I have stayed in many Swissotels and have never been disappointed. This place is really tired. My room didn't smell great (perhaps a smoker previously?) and struck me as more 3 star quality. Three main issues: 1) The curtains don't close as they are designed as window dressings and not actual curtains. This would be OK but the hotel is surrounded by skyscrapers therefore, when the light is on, the offices and apartments opposite are probably able to see everything that's going on, even behind the thin net curtains. This is just weird. Anyone with a sense of personal modesty may want to stay somewhere else. 2) The room had a toilet that constantly filled up during the night on a loud drip by drip basis thus providing pretty effective water torture for a traveller with jet lag. 3) The lifts/elevators are malfunctioning. They are the new type where you type in your floor and it tells you which lift to get into. Unfortunately they are mis-programmed. I selected floor 6 and was deposited at floor 37 with another lady trying to get to 4th Floor. We eventually got into another lift which deposited us at floor 21 and we then waited 10 minutes for another lift that took us to the correct floor. These issues are pretty fundamental and demonstrate a loss of client understanding on the part of the general management. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/rate does not mean good solution”
Reviews.Author: derrita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel Chicago from Sept 17th through Sept 19th with my husband and my baby. We chose this hotel because of its view on Navy Pier and of course its competitive rate comprate to other 5 star hotels in the same area. Our room was charming and spacious, view on Lake Michigan was great. The staff was friendly and helpful since we had a 10-month old baby. They provided a crib as planned. We were not pleased to pay extra USD 10.- for the wireless connection. My husband and I had our own laptops and each IP needed to pay this 10.- which we found really not cool. The connection on top of this was not fast. As for the parking, I think they have the most expensive rate in town. 52 dollars per day was outrageous. As for the food, try to find something else outside. The pizza and the burger were average.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a beautiful and classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Phillipioberio
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived to the time we checked out the service was exceptional - front desk, doormen, concierge, chambermaids, porters all terrific, first class and always smiling. The fruited ice water in the lobby always refreshing. The room spacious and perfectly clean and luxurious - the views of the lake, Navy Pier and the river were spectacular. The location was an additional bonus - close to the Navy Pier, magnificent Mile, Hancock Building and hundreds of restaurants. Museums easy to get to by bus or taxi. The Swisshotel made our anniversary one we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Much worse than expected”
Reviews.Author: mihai123
Reviews.Content: Ugh. The hotel is in serious need of updating, it's celebrating 30 years and cracks are showing all over the place from the dated lobby and elevators to old carpets, furniture, bathrooms. Expected a modern hotel, this definately was not it - although it came with a hefty rate. Probably most dissappointing was the level of customer service. We had requested high floor room prior to check in, requested this again at check in and very nicely explained we were on a special weekend celebrating anniversary. The guy at front desk must have had a bad week because we got a room next to the elevators and across from the service room on a lower floor. Thanks for your help buddy. We could have complained but chose not to -we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The concierges need to attend mood modification classes they were all grumpy and seemed annoyed to be answering any questions, why is this not apparent to management? Spend 5 minutes observing their interaction with guests and you know you have problems. Not impressed, no way coming back here, would look for W, Hard Rock or Monacco at this price range and for a more modern vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Worldreamer
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was an excellent base for our 3 day stay in Chicago, good facilities, helpful and friendly staff and convenient for exploring downtown. We were able to check in 3 hours early and our large, comfortable room was on the 16th floor with a lovely view over Navy Pier and the lake. It was quiet with a huge very comforable bed, plenty of storage space and a large bathroom with lots of vanity unit space, bath and separate shower. The mini bar seemed expensive so we did not use it. The hotel restaurants did seem a bit expensive for our budget but this did not matter at all. The concierge directed us to a grocery store near the hotel which sold everything we needed for our self catering breakfast and a good Italian restaurant a few minutes walk away for an evening meal. The room had a coffee machine - but it took us an electricians visit to found out how to work it - just turn on the main switch that operates the room lamps! There is a charge for internet access but we were given this free to check in on line and print boarding passes. My only criticism is the high charge per day ( I can't remember whether it was $15 or $25) for the use of the swimming pool - which is why we did not use it. Also $9 for a small bottle of water in our room seemed excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities, and location.”
Reviews.Author: ACCOscar
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities and location: quiet, clean, efficient, great food, nice work out and pool area on top, close to Michigan Ave and the Navy Pier, good value. I canâ€™t wait to bring my wife and children here for a fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Taste of Continental Comfort in a favorite city, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: badEXPEDIA
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a favorite event, the Chicago Jazz Festival. I stayed at the Swissotel because it's the favorite of some greater Chicago-land relatives, even their 7, 10 and 12 year-old children. The hotel was a busy place for the Labor Day weekend, but the hotel was so well managed I did notice any inconvenience. The elevator system is a marvel for handling many people going in many directions in at least 40 some floors. The rooms had unexpected touches: a bath system that prevents scalding water, a a wonderful coffee brewing system plus great attentive service. The staff helped with all the questions I had giving me good recommendations and quick assistance. The hotel is a pleasant retreat and refreshment in a great city. I'l return.

Reviews.Title: “Usual high Swissotel quality”
Reviews.Author: BeanoSurrey
Reviews.Content: This was only a brief stay at the Swissotel Chicago but it has the usual high quality that I've come to expect from this chain. The location of the hotel I found to be good, just a short walk from Michigan Ave and Navy Pier with the river just in front of the hotel if you fancy taking that route to Navy Pier or along onto Lake Michigan. The hotel has a decent fitness suite and pool and breakfast was good - though pricey if you pay for it. My room was large and had all that could be expected, coffee machine, flat screen TV, etc - the hotel staff as always were very friendly and helpful. Each Swissotel I've stayed in differs slightly in the service they provide and though it may seem a little petty, all the other chains I've stayed in so far have offered complimentary bottles of water in the room - not so here and at $9 for a small bottle in the room, I felt this was a bit much and not acceptable, especially when you can walk to Walgreens and get a same size bottle for less than $2. So, there you have it, a gripe from me about Swissotel - however, I'll be back next year as for quality, they can't be beat. Let's just hope I don't have to pay $9 for water though hahahahah

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlippman
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful service, and very good food - especially if they need to accomodate special diets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Katarzynka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding anniversary. We arrived early, were greeted with a warm smile and a helping hand. The valet took our car right away and offered to help with the bags. The room was not ready since we were very early. The help at the front desk offered to do an advance check in which would save us time once our room was ready. The lady also offered to take our bags to the luggage room to hold on to so we didn't have to walk around town with our bags. We came back after being in the city for a while and our room was ready. We were given a set of keys to a room on the 34th floor. We went to the elevators which were a little unusual. The elevators don't have a up and down button, instead they have a numeric key pad where you have to key in the floor you would like the elevator to take you to. It was interesting, definetly something new. We got to our room and the cards given to us didn't work, so frustrated and tired we headed back downstairs only to wait in line again to get cards that actually worked. The help at the desk didn't show any empathy for the error, and just said that we should have called from the phone by the elevators on our floor. (who knew!!!!) After getting the cards we went back upstairs, and this time the cards worked. The room was a good size, clean, modern furniture. The room had a big closet. The bed in the room was the most comfy bed I have ever stayed in. I didn't want to go back home to my own bed. We read from previous reviews not to even check the fridge in the room, which we didn't (just in case we set off some sensors). The washroom was great, it had a seperate bath and a corner shower. The shower was amazing, it had great pressure and plenty of hot water. It was a godsend after a long day of walking around Chicago. The hotel in general is very clean, welcoming, anyone staying here would enjoy it. Plus the views are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “A la carte hotel”
Reviews.Author: erika9693
Reviews.Content: I arrived yesterday.. Told it was valet only and it was $50! Valet told me I could park around the block for $30..done. I go to check and the front desk lady was not friendly at all. She asked if I wanted to upgrade my room so that I didn't end up with a view of crap and stuck on a low level floor in a very tall building. Gee.. I guess $240 isn't enough to get a descent room. Crap. Then I go on to ask about the pool cause in their description it says pool for all guests. Nope. "would u like me to add the pool to your bill?" wait! What? to swim in the pool where I AM Paying to stay-- I have to pay$16 to use it??? WTF? Same goes for the gym. A la carte. The decor of the hotel was boring but clean. The room was fine. Nothing special. I only slept there. Do yourself a favor and bring your own shampoo and conditioner because there's is worse than washing m hair with bar soap. They had robes which was good. Also, don't lose your parking ticket if u self park or u will be charged $100. Just remember, if/when you reserve your hotel stay here, you get a room-the description online says "deluxe" - which is their ho-hum standard-everything else-gym, pool, parking, view, high floor, Internet and smiles-Will cost extra!!! I'm sorry but there are a ton of other hotels in Chicago and I will not be staying here again. It's as bad as the airlines charging per bag.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: longdistance33
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay, we had room 603 on the 6th floor with classic lake view. Rates: first night $200.00, second and third night 175.00 So here is my review for my stay. GOOD: Door men, Beds (excellent), Tub, Large Bathroom, Room decor, Carpet, separate tub and shower, bath robes, View and customer service. BAD: no microwave, people standing at elevator to help you pick your floor?? (weird to me?), Refreshments in the small fridge in room too expensive, pay to use the pool and fitness center. UGLY: Mold in shower around base and eye level ( see pictures) Over all I would rate my stay an 8 out of 10, mostly because the Mold in the shower. ** Also in Swissotel's defense I did not give them a chance to correct the mold problem. I am sure if I would have told them they would have given me a different room ASAP, the only reason I didnt say anything is because I didnt discover this till 11pm that night when I showered and was already unpacked. I would stay here again but would ask for a room on a higher floor and I would check the shower for mold as soon as I arrived. Notes: Palm resturant is attached to building, Geneva on lower level serves breakfast (for cheaper option Dunkin donuts is in building next door). Short walk or taxi ride to Navy Pier, Wrigley building, Mag mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Very Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: waynerobin
Reviews.Content: Very, very poor service. If you're looking for good service, suggest you consider other options. The management and staff of the hotel don't get the concept of good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Well located, friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: AMS2315
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Swissotel. The room was generously sized and extremely comfortable. The hotel pool (an indoor pool) was great for my five year old. The only complaint involved a shower door that didn't seal up all the way, resulting in puddles on the bathroom floor. We solved this by putting a towel down. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great service, food and location.”
Reviews.Author: LizBeth30_10
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Swissotel, Chicago and was extremely pleased with the location and room accomodations. However, it was the service that I rate very highly. While going through elevator renovations, the hotel provided extra personnel to accomodate guests and ensure there was no confusion with getting to the rooms. Front desk personnel answered questions and provided follow up service promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location...would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cmoore9680
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful - not our first choice due mainly to the room rate, but ended up calling the hotel and received a better deal than online. Included in our room rate was a continental breakfast which exceeded expectation for being 'continental'. For a small fee, you could upgrade to the full buffet, which I would highly recommend. Location was perfect for our purposes. We were within walking distance (15-20 minutes) of Navy Pier, Willis Tower, Miracle Mile, etc., as well as a short walk to the train. Room was spacious and clean with a wonderful view of Lake Michigan (we were on the 23rd floor. Don't touch any of the mini bar items, however, the hotel will charge you the instant they are picked up. The concierge deserves a raise. He was politely and so informative. Great recommendations and accurate information. The only real downside was the elevator situation, which has been mentioned in previous reviews. It's horrible. You may very well stand there for 5-10 minutes waiting for an elevator, and then hit EVERY floor on your way down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: TAM81
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel and both times we've had a great experience. The location is perfect--close to shopping, lake, Navy Pier, restaurants--most within walking distance. The check-in clerk was so accommodating and granted my request for a late check-out since i was running in a 1/2 marathon Sunday morning, and wanted to attend a concert afterwards that wasn't due to finish until the time we should have been checking out. On top of that, we were allowed to check in 3 hours early the day before and had a wonderful room with a fantastic view of the Chicago River and Navy Pier! The room itself was spacious, clean and comfortable with a nice size bath. When we called to get our car out of valet parking, it arrived within the timeframe we were quoted. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the river with great view.”
Reviews.Author: alwayslove2travel77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very elegant with decanters in the lobby filled with water and fresh lemons in one and oranges in the other which make a refreshing drink when you walk in after a hot day. The room is large and very clean with a great view. The mini bar was VERY expensive and the fact that you had to pay to use the pool was ridiculous! The maids didn't replenish the soap in the bathroom and they were a little stingy with the towels. The other surprising thing was that the Wifi was not free, you had to pay $9.95 for 24 hours! I've never had a hotel charge for internet! Other than that, it was a great location and a comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in the heart of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PJRIowa
Reviews.Content: My wife had a meeting in Chicago at the Swissotel, and my son and I accompanied her. We are frequent visitors to Chicago but this was our first time staying at this hotel. The location is excellent, within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, Millenium Park and the Loop. The rooms are modern, large and comfortable, and feature extra large bathrooms with both shower and tub. And the rooms, especially on higher floors, have fantastic views. The hotel also features a Palm restaurant; we didn't eat there but I've been to the Palm in DC and NYC and it's a great place for a (expensive) steak. While we did not personally have to pay for the room, looking at their rates I thought it was a very good value for being in the heart of downtown Chicago. The overnight parking was very pricy ($52), but they offer half-price parking if you drive a hybrid (we have a Prius). In addition, they charge extra to use the pool and fitness center, which struck me as a nickel-and-dime move by an upscale hotel. The only odd thing about the hotel were the elevators. They are installing a system where you enter the floor # you are going to, rather than just push an up/down button. They are still working out the bugs on this system; four hotel staffers were in the elevator lobby assisting guests and a traffic jam to get to your room was not uncommon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: HondaDoug
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there several times and while the prices and especially the parking keeps going up the experience seems more and more ordinary. No internet and the elevator situation is in need of attention. The Hyatt almost next door offers better value for the bargain hunter.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EVERYTHING: LOCATION,SERVICE,ATTITUDE,AMENITIES - ALL A+.”
Reviews.Author: antiqworks
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here solely because the convention we were attending headquartered here. What a lucky break! The hotel is beautiful, the service unsurpassed (four attendants in the elevator lobby area to direct you) and, amazingly for a big city, FRIENDLY. It has great dining options onsite, from casual to fancy, but is walking distance to many of Chicago's finest restaurants. It is perfectly located right at the bottom of Michigan Avenue's Miracle Mile shopping section and adjacent to River Walk. Our room had a magnificent view of the river, Navy Pier (fireworks on Saturday night) and the lake. The mattress and bedding was so comfortable (I think the best night's sleep I've had in years) that I emailed the manager of the hotel to see if I could find out the brand. He responded immediately, provided me the mattress manufacturer name and said I could buy the duvet directly from the hotel. Just another example of the above-and-beyond service we encountered in every sector at this hotel. I would typically stay at a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton in my travels but next trip I will certainly first check to see if there is a Swissotel. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Promised World on silver platter, got Berwyn on paper plate.”
Reviews.Author: Tabularasaman
Reviews.Content: I have been there many times. My Swiss company does not give me a choice. It is not the 'best' place I ever stayed, however if one has only stayed at Motel 6's and never stayed anywhere else in Chicago, it could be the best place I guess. Although you can get 4/5 star hotels at a better price, this hotel is very nice and yes..the staff and the views are great. However the same can be said for most any 4/5 star hotel in any city center anywhere. A review will sometimes get cute 'concerned' reply quips from someone saying they are management and 'oh give us another chance', or 'oops sorry'. If you have a problem at Swissotel in Chicago, their feigned concerns are only that. I had issues there recently, I did not rant and face to face the person said "ahh, sorry", did nothing, put my money in the drawer and walked....as if he/she was trained to admit nothing and try to get away with errors to save money. Like all the staff, however, he was very nice about 'ripping me off '. Is it the Swissotel training or the local employees doing their own thing? Someone, somewhere, does not care. DO NOT count on any upgrade, even if you are a member of their 'club' (during the years I have never gotten upgrades at Swissotel) and DO NOT, if you choose this hotel, eat the stuff they call breakfast at the GENEVA. It is embarrassing for any hotel over 1 star and says volumes about Swiss management... 'When a fish smells, it smells from the head to the tail'. This breakfast never changed and always cost my company over USD 30 each time. Months ago I mentioned the poor breakfast and with a cute quip was told it would be corrected, but I still had to pay for the slop even thought it was agreed there was a problem with it. If a great, fairly priced and tasty breakfast makes a difference to you, within 1/2 K you will see an breakfast buffet eatery with a larger selection of perfectly prepared, quality food for close to 1/3 the cost of Swissotel. One would think these customer service issues would have been seen and addressed in there 30 years of being in that business.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to sleep, but worst value in town”
Reviews.Author: canjar
Reviews.Content: We got a decent rate on the hotel, but we didnt realize that additional services were so expensive. $52/day for parking, 15/person for the pool (which is outrageous), and no free wireless internet. The food here is also horrible. They really should not charge extra for the pool. On principle alone, we are never staying here again, and neither should you. Do you really want to live in a world where every hotel starts nickel and diming anyone they can, just like what the airlines do?

Reviews.Title: “nice...if you've never been anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy227
Reviews.Content: Had a work thing to do in Chicago. They had everything at the Swissotel, so I stayed there to save time and money. I checked it out online, and was excited - it looked like a nice, high class place in a nice part of town. It even had good reviews - so I was looking forward to staying there. After my stay, though, I must say that the Swissotel's perception of 5-star is totally different than my perception. Let's start with the room itself. Nothing special. Our "discounted" rate was $175/night, and after taxes it was $200/night. For that, I expect more than an "okay" room and hotel facility. The conference rooms were nice, the service at the conference rooms was very good, but the room itself just did not say to me "$200/night". I can't put my finger on it, but it just didn't impress me. And there were signs of wear, which can be expected in an older (about 30 yrs) facility, but should not be so obvious in a place claiming to be 5-star. Also, some of my hand towels were stained, causing me to double check every towel I used. Next, the hotel has major elevator issues. This is the FIRST hotel I've ever been in that has DIRECTIONS posted on how to use the elevators on every floor. They had to because apparently the new elevator system they installed was designed by someone who never used an elevator. There were six elevators, and yet the wait was never less than five minutes. On the last day of our conference, many of our cohorts were late for the first meeting because it took 15 or 20 minutes to get an elevator. This was NOT acceptable. Also, another interesting quirk: Ice was only available on every other floor; and there were NO vending machines on the room levels. How is that? And anyone who has ever been in Chicago knows you need ice and soda! After that, there is the value question. I've paid more than this for rooms in Vegas, but those rooms make you feel like you spent the money. I'm still wondering where the money went in this place. The location was nice, as it was within walking distance of food and shopping, but that's about it. And if you have a car, it's $52/night to park for guests. So, overall, this place was okay, it just doesn't deserve the super high rating everyone gives it once you've been to other great hotels. And it is way overpriced. Oh, and it felt a little snooty, too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: pieeee
Reviews.Content: It's the best hotel I've ever stayed at. It was also for a cheap price. It was very expensive for everything else especially the pool. The fruity water was good. Great Location too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Everything We Expected!”
Reviews.Author: antzgirl
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Chicago for four-year anniversary and stayed in one of Swissotel's Premier Corner King rooms. We were able to stay on the 27th floor. We would def. recommend the corner rooms. The view of the city and Navy Pier/lake can't be beat! We ordered room service for dinner on our first of two nights there. Room service was great - quick and delicious. Bed was very comfy, room was clean. Only negative for some was that they were upgrading their elevator systems and as a result, we experienced some delay while waiting for and on the elevators. Nothing that bothered us though. The location of the hotel is ideal - two blocks from the Magnificent Mile bridge. Great experience. Professional staff. The atmosphere and experience was worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Epyon2000
Reviews.Content: Our trip centered around the Taste of Chicago and this hotel offered the most bang for my buck and the location was prime! We arrived at the hotel later than expected and we were greeted by warm and friendly staff. Our check-in was prompt and the services that they offered were explained. When we got to our room it was immaculate and very clean. I actually felt comfortable in the room. The room was decorated very nicely and the view from the room was amazing! I am one that has to have coffee in the morning and the Keurig coffeemaker was heaven sent. I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a central location near shopping and the many sights of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Agree, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: attyjburns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 2 days, just after July 4th. We had three rooms. One suite with attached room sleeping 7 including 3 young children and one other room next door with another son and his wife. The rooms were very clean and the bedding was very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful throughout our stay. There is an underground passage leading to Michigan Boulevard containing restaurants and stores. Nice considering the temperature. Close to Millienium Park and the Art Museum. Next to the magnificant mile. Also close to Navy Pier. Overall an excellent place for a family. Nice pool and workout area.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BoazMunk
Reviews.Content: we stayed in chicago only 24 hours and chose swisshotel-we were given a lakeview room-though we only paid for a regular room-the room is beautifull-there are windows all arround the room from which you have a wonderfull view of the lakes and of the city of chicago.the bathroom is very modern and big-everything in the room was just amazing!!it is one of the most beautiful room we stayed in-but we were not surprised as we already stayed in swisshotel in osaka -japan,and it was very beautiful too.

Reviews.Title: “NO BAD VIEWS! see Chicago from your hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Khoffman348
Reviews.Content: My birthday get-a-way included my teen-age daughter. I love the location of the hotel. It is literally "convenient to everything". The hotel is one the architechural tour as it is a triangle design so no room has a blocked view of Chicago. I can't say this about many hotels in the city! Staff was friendly but not hovering. My only complaint and this is about many upscaale hotels, I think internet access should be included....especially when traveling with teens!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: gb905
Reviews.Content: We booked the room 10 months ago with the intention of watching the 4th of July fireworks. The original reservation stated my preference for a Navy Pier view. I even called them a few times the week before our arrival to beg again. Then I look online and find that you can reserve a room with just the view I wanted. Of course it cost more money. Everything in this hotel costs more money - parking? $52/day. Club level for breakfast and/or evening snacks? Another $50/day. And a note about the club - the food was good but it's NOT open in the afternoon and ALL alcohol is an ADDITIONAL charge. Not sure I drank $200 worth of Starbucks coffee or nibbled on that many carrots to make the cost worth it. You can go in there and use the computer in the morning and in the evening, but that's it. I arranged for the club as a backup in case our view didn't allow us to see the fireworks. Turns out the view from the club isn't all that great. Our room was much better. The best place seems to have been the gym though. Did I mention that costs extra too? The front desk did throw it in for free when we got the club floor, but I think it's usually another $25/day. Are you seeing a theme here? Our room was nice. Previous commentaries were on target - it's minimalistic, the sun does stream in and immediately warm up the room. The small frig is filled with water, soda, etc. that is pressure sensitive (if it moves, you get charged). There's no space to put any food you may have and it didn't even really seem cold at all. The bed seemed to be a super-king. I titled this "A Mixed Bag" because I thought it was going to be a bit more upscale given the prices listed. Lets just say that the clientele was eclectic. Very very eclectic. It's unnerving when some guests treated the lobby area like a bus station (luggage was CVS bags that they felt compelled to root through in the foyer, another individual looked like she was "working"). Overall, I would say that the building itself is an interesting place to stay. The staff wasn't as helpful as I would've hoped, although there were some instances of kind support. The location is absolutely wonderful and the view of the fireworks from our room was spot on. I guess my review comes down to this - if you can get over paying for every little thing and you are going to spend most of your time either in your room or away from the hotel, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit of a walk to the El”
Reviews.Author: megbowes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel in mid-June, the staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean and spacious. (very comfortable beds too). We were able to get a room with a view of the lake (though I understand that all of the rooms in the hotel have great views-- which is not always true of other Chicago hotels we looked at) which was great. At the time there were some issues with the elevators (they were upgrading the system) but the staff was very responsive and was able to take care of the problem. We were about a 10 minute walk to the magnificent mile which was nice but it was also a ten to fifteen minute walk to the El, which was a little frustrating when we were going site seeing and needed to devote additional time to catch the train.javascript:checkAllPhotos();

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you only need to sleep there”
Reviews.Author: KellyBobo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for $100 / night. The room was spacious, clean and had a great view of the river. (The only problem with the room was the hot water seemed to take 5 minutes to warm up in the shower, and the hairdryer was weak). The encounters with staff were fine. The biggest downside of this hotel was that it charges big $ for any services ... $52 for parking / day, $15 per person per day to use the pool / exercise area (which is ridiculous!!), no free wireless internet ($10 / day), charges for local calls, overpriced breakfast, etc. The lobby area / bar / restaurant were plain and not very nice. We ate breakfast everyday at Corner Bakery at Michigan and Wacker which was a short walk away. Overall the hotel worked for us because we didn't need to use any services (except internet after I went into withdrawal), but if you want to use hotel services, and don't have a business account to charge everything to, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the lovely Swissotel in Dec...”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Swissotel in Dec 09 for my husbands birthday. They upgraded our room upon check in and sent birthday cake up to us! The room was clean and spacious and had good views of the park, river and lake(we had a corner room). We had breakfast included in our room price and could definatley recommend the breakfast there. The location of the hotel is great as it is only 2 blocks to Michigan avenue. Overall a good choice for a stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not worth the exorbitant price.”
Reviews.Author: world_citizen61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights to attend a meeting in Chicago. The location was convenient, being located between the shops and restaurants just north of the river and Millenium park and the museums just to the south. It was also very quiet, being tucked away at the end of a dead end street and allowing us some very good nights' sleep. The room had great views of the lake and was comfortable and clean but nothing really special. The contemporary minimalist decor definitely had a business feel to it. Also on the negative side, this hotel room cost over $400/night and they had no qualms about nickeling and diming their guests. Everything was extra and expensive including internet and health club. They did not even provide a morning newspaper. The conciarge was always busy with other guests so rather than waiting long periods, we did not utilize their services. The lobby was crowded and noisy at all times so it was not an inviting place to wait for guests. Overall, this was just an OK business hotel at an excessive price. Although we have had good experiences with Swissotels in other cities, we won't be staying at the Chicago location again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Frankfurtdb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business a nice hotel not the most modern but service ok. Great view from the window. All in all an ok hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but mold on windows”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte095
Reviews.Content: The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. We had a beautiful view from our room that overlooked the Navy Pier. It was worth the extra $25.00/night upgrade. The Navy Pier, Mich. Ave., Grant Park, and many restaurants were w/in walking distance. However, my husband and I enjoy walking...if walking is a problem, you may want to stay elsewhere or cab it everywhere. The housekeeping staff was pleasant, and our room was clean. Now for the negatives: There was mold on the corners of the large picture window, as well as the corners of the shower. This doesn't seem to me to be a housekeeping problem, but rather a management problem . I suggest management check in into this. Our refrigerator was not working and had an awful odor. It was replaced, but it took them about 4 hours to do so. We were only given two towels. I called to request extras, and they were sent up immediately. FYI: if you are a light sleeper, there may be a problem. The walls must be thin, as we could hear doors slamming, toilets flushing, and showers running. We also heard the television in the next room one evening. We were staying up late anyway, so it didn't bother us. I would stay here again; I am also going to write management about the mold. Hopefully that will be solved for future guests! I would rate the Swiss a 5, but due to the mold situation I'm rating it a 4. If we were light sleepers I would rate it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't take a room near the elevator”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom35805
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The room was large and comfortable. However, the room I had backed to the elevators, and it was very noisy, especially at night, with clanging and banging. The breakfast buffet was expensive and the dining room a bit stark, but the food was good. All in all a good hotel for the price, but pick your room carefully.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeggyOtoole
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for the Blues Festival. We had no trouble checking in. We couldn't get a King room and were upgraded to a Lake View. Room was very comfortable. All Staff, front desk. housekeeping, concierge and Bell Captain and were courteous and proactive. We were riding in the elevator with a staff member with a cart. he saw we only had one umbrella and he offered to get us another one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: IanMac14
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed on the South side of the river generally preferred to stay on the North side with the activity, but the Swissotel location near the river and the lake is ideal. Walking distance from Millennium Park, Art Institute, the Riverwalk and the EL made it easy to get everywhere. The triangle design made the views from every room and hallway beautiful. Clean, nice, great beds, good desk to work with, friendly helpful staff. I actually look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: topfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night there for a short getaway. We were told we would have a very nice view of the river, and it was fair. The hotel is triangular, and if we'd had a room on the other side we would have been looking at Navy Pier, the river and Lake Michigan. Our rooms had a view of the river and an office building, which was disappointing. Besides that the room was very well appointed, clean (only two bath towels in the bathroom, though) and well laid out. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. It's about two blocks from Michigan Avenue, so walking is a viable option. Parking is $52 per night; we arrived via a commuter train to avoid that, and it's an easy 10 minute walk from the Millennium Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: steinerMpls
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to meet with our son. Great hotel, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: janesk
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel it was advertised as Miracle Mile. Nevertheless it was a bit out of the way. Not completely, but it was a long walk to go to each location. The rooms were nice, but I was peeved when I went to the business center and I was getting charged $6 for a fraction of an hour. There wasn't complimentary internet across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Sancutary”
Reviews.Author: DianeinRiverCity
Reviews.Content: It was quite a busy Memorial Day 3-day weekend in Chicago. Paradaes, Obama was in town, etc......... I looked forward to coming back to the hotel and relaxing and unwinding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Claucat
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through Hotwire.com and and were apprehensive based on several reviews w read here about rooms not being ready and the staff being rude. We were actually extremelly pleased with everything about this hotel. When I called to ad my husband's name to the reservation ( we were meeting in Chicago and flying from different parts of the US) the person on staff was extremelly helpful. When we arrived the room was ready for us and we were very pleased with the room we received at the 31st floor with an incredible view of Michigan Lake and Navy Pier. The room is a very good size with a very comfortable bed ( we asked for a king and got it), good storage and a nice working desk with lots of plugs for all our devices. On top of the nice flat screen TV we also discovered an IPOD dock and a Keurig coffee maker so we felt like home. The bathroom had nice toiletries and a separate tub and walk-in shower. We did not use their WIFI since we carry our own wireless with us thanks to a little invention by Verizon called MIFI but the hotel has wireless through out. My only advise is to stay away from the mini-bar or their restaurants since they are very pricey. If you walk out of the hotel toward Michigan Ave and make a left on Columbus and then a right on the first street you will find a small gourmet grocery store where you can buy beverages, sandwiches and a lot more. There are several drugstores and restaurants that are walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Center to Work, Relax and Explore Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ThomasTisme
Reviews.Content: I was happy to see that we were again staying here. Many times going back to a great place you sometimes ask yourself why, because it just wasnâ€™t what you remembered. Not at the Swissotel! The second visit was as nice, if not nicer, than the first. Customer service was again, simply OUTSTANDING! Tom Maxwell

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. Amazing Location. Amazing Lake View. Amazing BEDS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TOchild
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. And I have stayed at many 4stars and several 5stars, all over North America. The beds. Unbelievable. Definitely the best I have ever had in a hotel. Perhaps the best I have ever slept on! Hotel staff: Excellent. So excellent, that we rarely had to encounter them and were able to get in and out of our room and the hotel hassle free every day and explore the beautiful city of Chicago! Cleaning staff: Did a magnificent job! The rooms were always stocked generously with towels, robes, bathroom supplies etc. I was also even surprised the staff handled our dirty laundry left on the bathroom floor and organized it into a neat little (dirty) pile. Did not have the chance to go to the lobby restaurant/bar however every night when we came home around 1am the lobby was packed with the young professional type. Loved it! One of the nights it began raining as we were heading out and the hotel was giving out Swissotel Umbrellas to patrons of their hotel. Now that's service baby!!! The rooms were simple. Classy. Elegant. Same with the bathrooms. The view was amazing! We were visiting during summer-like weather, which made the view that much better from the 30th floor. Not only would I recommend this hotel to everybody! But I will not explore other hotels in Chicago next time I return! This is MY hotel of choice in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkuhl
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Swissotel and really enjoyed the hotel. Great location, especially getting on/off Lakeshore. Rooms were clean and very nice. Hotel has a nice bar and restaurant, and is in walking distance from many great Chicago restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Silbury
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked at last minute through Expedia for visiting family. Mainly chosen for closeness to their apartment and excellent deal. Arrived about 8pm by taxi from O'Hare airport. No offer was made from hotel staff to assist with luggage even though we are both pensioners. Receptionist was not particularly welcoming. More interested in selling an upgrade to a lake view at $25 extra per night. We declined her offer and found that our room (on the 32nd floor) was huge with one of the best and cleanest bathrooms we have seen in a hotel - generous top, bath and seperate shower and lovely toiletries. In addition we could also see the lake through the surrounding buildings and Grant Park. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable we have ever come across in any hotel and with very quiet air conditioning set at a comfortable 72F we had the best sleep we have ever had in a hotel. Charges for services in the room were high - $15 for a movie, $1 just to get an outside line for a 'free'phone call. Breakfast was good but again quite expensive at about $60 for 2 people but the staff in the restaurant were all very friendly and helpful. We visit our family 3 or 4 times a year so would probably use the hotel again for convenience but only if we got the same excellent deal. For the normal price we have stayed at far superior hotels where we have been made to feel more welcome by the staff. Would only recommend to a friend or family if they could get the same good deal.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected, right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: TheJohnStar
Reviews.Content: We booked the Swissotel Chicago for a last minute weekend trip to Chicago. Two of our friends we were traveling with were airline staff and got an excellent interline rate, though the regular rates also seemed very reasonable for what they offered. Two of us had been to Chicago before and were pretty familiar with the city, two of us were first-timers. Mainly, we were interested in shopping which made this location pretty convenient. First of all, we should mention transportation from the airport. We flew into Midway, which is a bit closer to downtown. It is connected on the Orange Line and provides above-ground rail transportation frequently right into the downtown "loop" very frequently. The service was only a few dollars and we opted for the 3-day metro pass and more than got our money's worth. The hotel is a short 5min walk from the loop. This service is also available for those arriving into O'Hare on the blue line. The trip time is approx 30 and 40 minutes respectively. Arrival at the hotel was certainly not the warmest welcome we've received. The doormen were always friendly, and greeted you with a smily. However, I found the front desk service to be hot and cold. We arrived about 2 hours behind our 2 friends and so they had already checked in. They didn't have cell phone service since we were roaming so we had no way to know what room they were in. They told the front desk our names and when we'd be arriving so we could be issued keys and go right up. However, front desk insisted that we use the house phone to connect to the operator, who would connect us to the room, so they could tell us what room to find them in, then head up. Terrible hospitality, in my opinion. Upon arriving in our room we were VERY pleased with our accommodations! The rooms were much larger than we expected, especially for Chicago. We had everything we needed in the room: mini-bar, couch, huge desk, iPod alarm (lovely feature), plenty of closet space, a nice view, comfortable beds and a very large and well equipped bathroom. The bathroom featured a tub as well as a proper shower and the ample counter space and lighting made getting ready in the morning a breeze! We went to use the concierge one morning to book tickets for Second City. First of all, I highly recommend the show! I'd never been but we had a great time and the price was very reasonable. We found the concierge hard to track down and we were sent to the 40th floor Swiss Executive Lounge. We didn't even know this lounge existed! Apparently you pay a daily fee and have full access which includes breakfast, evening h'ordeurves and desserts. As well there is plenty of seating, a large TV and a beautiful view out to the water. We were quick to add on this lounge access! Unfortunately I don't remember the exact price, it was either $50 or $25 daily. In our opinion, well worth the price! I suggest at least going up and having a tour and adding it for any full days, we obviously didn't want to pay full price on departure day for just a quick breakfast. Another case of poor communication with the hotel though was that they failed to tell us that the lounge would be closed half way through our stay for scheduled renovations. Would have been great to know when we paid for it, also so we weren't fumbling to try and get in looking like crazy people. In lieu of a refund they said we could use the main restaurant (in the basement) for breakfast, which we found acceptable since we needed to eat quickly. However, they didn't live up to this and still billed us and additional $64 for two people's mediocre buffet breakfast! Unacceptable and utterly disappointed about that. On the note of charges, though the pool may be beautiful, you better be ready to pay! They charge you per PERSON, per DAY to use the pool. In all my travels and work in the industry (I'm a former travel agent) I've never had a charge like this! Because of that, we didn't use the pool once, though I would have loved to. Also, internet was somewhere around $10 per day. Not ideal, but a lot of hotels still charge. Worth noting was that whenever we called downstairs for information such as directions or restaurant suggestions, they were always spot on! Made planning things on-the-go so much easier! We were also very proud to see the hotel participating in Earth Hour. They left voicemails asking guests to participate, and if interested join them in the lobby. They dimmed the lights and lit candles throughout the lobby and were having a social at the lobby bar. We were very impressed by this! Overall, very happy with the Swissotel brand and would quickly return. Found them comparable to the French styled Sofitel brand, that we very much enjoy. So just be aware of some of the fees, be patient with the front desk, and enjoy the accommodations and the lovely city! PS if you're looking for a unique way to tour the city, we highly recommend a Segway tour. We thought it sounded odd too, but had the time of our lives. Steve's Segway Tours was exceptional and if you do a tour, try something new and exciting like this!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: ckd1216
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference and found the room to be large and comfy with a great view and good amenities - shower and tub, flatscreen TV, comfortable bed, robes, clean and tastefully finished. Fast elevators, clean restrooms, met my expectations as a business hotel. Having The Palm Restaurant on-site is a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Love Swissotel. Great location for theater and lakefront activities.”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Bijou
Reviews.Content: An umbrella in the closet is a very nice touch. The beds were extremely comfortable! Love the ipod doc. The view of the lake from our room was beautiful. Didn't use the pool, but it was nice to know we could. The entire staff was impressive... front desk representative, concierge and bellman. Chris also liked the convenient way to hookup his Video, digital camera and/or computer (with a video out RGB or S-video cable) to the TV - instead of having to go behind the TV as it was located in a lower panel on the side. We're seasoned travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of the $15 per day charge for use of the pool and fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: lynnk49t
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance of the Magnificant Mile and the amazing Millenium Park. The staff were superb and were more than happy to offer advice and book leisure activities for us. My biggest disappointment was the $15 per day charge for the swimming pool and fitness centre which I thought was a little excessive but no problem for anyone who doesn't want to use these facilities. The rooms are pretty standard and are clean and well presented. The beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was good and very attentive to detail. The bars and restaurants are pleasant and quite reasonably priced as hotels go. The Palm had a great offer on bar food in the early evening and after 9pm and the quality and presentation of the food was excellent. (Not sure if that runs all year round) However there are also lots of good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Huge Inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: ErinR1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through priceline for $90 per night + taxes and fees. I was extremely happy with this price, as I have stayed at this hotel before and remembered it to be very nice. I was really happy with the quality of the hotel. Our room was clean, spacious, and very modern. Overall, The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very central location, a short distance to Navy Pier, the Magnificient Mile, and several rail system stops (the El). I would have rated this hotel very highly and been incredibly happy with our stay EXCEPT for one huge inconvenience. We checked in around midnight and were told that the hotel had been overbooked due to their contract with British Airways and poor weather in Europe resulting in the grounding of many European flights.I understand that this situation was out of the hotel's control. They offered to move us to another nearby hotel for the night, and Swissotel would take care of the cost for that night. As much as I would have rather just stayed there and paid for all 3 nights, I realized that there was nothing that could be done and this seemed like adequate compensation. I was under the impression that i would be refunded the cost of one nights stay. This was not the case. When I inquired about the refund upon checkout, the clerk informed me that the hotel had merely covered the cost of the other hotel. I said that I did not feel that this was adequate compensation for having to move to another hotel after midnight then packing up and checking out of the other hotel less than 12 hours later. I had already paid to stay at the Swissotel, so them paying for the other hotel did nothing for me. She only said that she was sorry to hear that. I emailed the hotel upon my return home, but I have yet to receive a response from anyone at the Swissotel Chicago. I would be extremely upset had I paid full price for this room. Overall, this hotel is very nice, and the staff is friendly and helpful; however, this situation was a very inconvenient start to our trip. A simple response to my email would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed.... Will not stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Chris416
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say that it all started out very well... the check in was great and was happy to pay for an upgrade that would give us a great veiw of the pier on the 40th floor. I found that the service in this hotel was either really good or really bad. The room was nice, and it was clean. They do like to charge you for everything. So your hotwire deal really adds up quickly at checkout. It was my birthday so I did not mind, what I did mind was making two phone calls home to toronto, and no one answering or the call going to voice mail and I was charged $25.72, when I talked to the Front Desk Supervisor, she would not budge on giving me a break. I even told her that I would not stay at the hotel again, she welcomed me to write a letter, so this is just one of the letters that I writting. Ill stay at the James next time, service is more consistent there.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: HarrisonFam2010
Reviews.Content: It's been a few years since we've been to Chicago for the weekend. We typically stay at Swissotel, and we were pleasantly surprised at all of the renovations that have taken place- both in the rooms and in the lobby/bar areas. We stayed in a suite, and it was beautifully decorated and had a brand new bathroom, hardwood floors in the entry and the office, and an absolutely FANTASTIC view of the city, lakeftont, and the river! The bedroom is extremely comfortable with white, down duvets and down pillows. I always sleep very well there. As wonderful as the rooms are, the service is top notch at the Swissotel. The staff is clearly very well trained and shows a genuine appreciation for the guests that stay there. I'd definitely recommend Swissotel when traveling to Chicago. It's centrally located near Michigan Avenue and all of the benefits that that brings.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: justice13
Reviews.Content: i attended a conference at the Swissotel and had an excellent experience--all the hotel employees were both personable and professional,the room was spacious, comfortable, and had a nice view of the lake --the fitness center was clean, well maintained, and had good equipment--all of the meals i had there were very good --service from the staff was excellent, from front desk, meal servers, housekeeping,fitness staff,etc--also had a nice follow-up note from Mr.Hawkins ,the head of front office operations i would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jobager
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few walking minutes away and in the center of Magnificent Mile - Navy Pier and Millenium Park (where "The Bean" is located). A liitle bit datet but very clean, spacious (for a city hotel) rooms with large LCD screen, very nice and large bathroom and comfortable beds. Instead of booking a standard room in one of the "stylish" hotels you will get a room in this hotel with a gorgeous lakeview (check roomtype while booking or ask at checkin for upgrades) for the same price. Tip: Parking in the Millenium Garage is only 24$ for 24h and only a few steps away from the hotel. Use the garage "Monroe Street" (itÂ´s a complex of 4 garages) and the exit "Randolph Street".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel- NO complaints”
Reviews.Author: dcfryling
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend getaway. Booked a breathtaking Lake Michigan view room. Navy Pier view at night was awesome. Beds were THE most comfortable we have ever had. Room was clean, quiet too. Would stay there again. No problems. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: barbie58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our "40" anniversary at theSwissotel which was very nice. Lake and river view room, champagne, breakfast for two and half off parking was the "deal of the day" from Fox Chicago. We had massages before we checked in, which I recommend, however, take your own slippers they don't provide them. Make sure you "sign up for the health club" at the front desk when you check in. Otherwise you won't be able to open the doors with your room key and you will have to wait for someone from "security" to come up and let you in. The pool and Jacuzzi are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good...But...”
Reviews.Author: BRockBoston
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but they nickle and dime you for everything unlike other higher-end properties. There are extra charges for everything, including $15 a day to use the fitness center. What's that about? That usually comes with the services of a nicer hotel in a major city. The extra charges come shortly after you wake up with an average $30 breakfast buffet and $4 for Starbucks coffee in the lobby bar. Do yourself a favor and walk down the street to Starbucks. Even better, stay at the Fairmont, around the corner, or the Intercontinental, with it's great pool included, down the street across from Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: babeen
Reviews.Content: Could not get a room at Hyatt, so booked at this hotel instead. I was plesantly surprised at how great this hotel was. Very responsive staff, absolutely meticulous housekeeping, and great attention to detail. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I can tell you that we have not had this service and friendliness at other establishments. We will choose Swissotel hot”
Reviews.Author: casey840
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try the Chicago Swissotel this past weekend and were very happy we did. We have stayed at many hotels and resorts and have not seen the service and friendliness offered at Swissotel hotel at any other venue. 1. We arrived early and were hoping to store our luggage but were told our room was ready and not a problem to check in early. 2. The check in person was courteous and wanted to know if there was anything we needed and what time would we like the Champaign to be delivered to the room that evening. She provided her name and asked that we contact her personally if we needed anything. 3. We requested extra towels and, upon return for dinner, there was a thank you note for the tip we left in the room for house service! 4. The champaign was on ice and waiting 5. The following morning we went to breakfast in the Geneva Room. What a wonderful experience. The staff was helpful and attentive, the breakfast was great. There was not only a brunch buffet, we were advised if there were anything else we would like, we only needed to ask. The server asked if we would like coffee to take back to our room. The food was hot and delicious. 6. Our bill was in our room that morning....no coupons or credits; the bill was accurate and had everything the hotel offered under the romance package. 7. They retrieved our car in less than ten minutes and there were two bottled waters in the car for our trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Actually a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I was expecting something better but after staying at the Fairmont the past few years for my annual convention, I can say that the Swiss does not compare. The staff are courteous but they lack that "extra" that a seasoned traveler who knows many Fairmonts, 4 Seasons, Ritzs, and the like would expect. The level of service, the ambiance, the amenities reminded me more of a standard Hyatt or Westin. The specifics: 1. Glasses not replaced in the bathroom (this was a five day stay) 2. Even though the green card was placed on the bed to have the linens changed, they were not changed. 3. Eating choices - if you do not want to go out for dinner, your only choice is the Palm (another surprising disappointment), or very expensive room service. 4. The corner suites are interestingly shaped but cause a cramped location in the bedroom area. 5. The business work area is not as good as many of the newer Marriott's -- the desk area required going under the desk to get power; the ethernet cord on the desk was not connected and required an engineer to come to the room with another longer cord and after much manipulation, having to hook it up into the wall. (There is a Bose CD player - why don't they put more emphasis on the computer space? -- And shockingly, there is no desk lamp (type in the dark) 6. Parking valets are slow to respond; at least for us, they were not helpful in getting the luggage in. They brought it in and left it at the desk; then the desk person did not offer to get a person to take the luggage upstairs. 7. The bar is fair, not great wine choices; the food very slow to come (even for a bar) 8. I did not feel the concierge were that helpful - not much better than "here is a map, try this; no favorite locations" etc. 9. Yes, parking is $52 per night - but it is roughly the same at the next door Hyatt and Fairmont. Parking downtown Chicago is NOT cheap Once again, if I stay at a Hyatt or a Westin, I know what to expect -- but I do not expect to find this at a Swissotel. Next year, I will return to the Fairmont just around the corner for my annual national meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms near elevator on upper floors”
Reviews.Author: zmark
Reviews.Content: Just home from a business trip and 3 nights at the Swissotel. The room on the 38th floor was lovely with a "city view" where I could see the lake between the buildings. The 2 full beds were in a spacious room, and the bath was large with separate tub and shower. The problem with the room is at night you can hear the elevator cables running through the stations.
