Every time an elevator moved I could hear it. Turned the AC fan on high which helped some. Avoid rooms that end in xx18 and xx19 right by the elevators. Breakfast is very expensive in the Geneva room...$26 Swiss buffet. Valet parking is $52 per night. Internet access is $9.98 per day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel make my conference experience like a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: emily_seiler
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was modern, clean and well appointed. The views from the upper floors were spectacular. We enjoyed a room upgrade making our business trip really special. The service and amenities were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Lake view???”
Reviews.Author: fabiokato
Reviews.Content: Booked online and paid extra for a room with "lake view". Yes, my room did have a view to the lake, but I wouldn't have paid any extra if they had told me that I would only be able to see the lake in between buildings and from a 2000ft distance. Also, beware of the extra costs: parking costs $52 per night, breakfast for 2 at least $60, and so on. Not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jjsaluki
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. We got a package with tickets for the Adler Planetarium, which was a good deal. The room was neither large nor small, was clean, had a great view, but no free wi-fi ($9.95 if you wanted to pay). I liked the bedside ipod radio which I used to recharge my ipod touch. The 42nd floor pool was okay, the fitness center around the pool looked adequate with reasonably good equipment. You have to walk an extra block or two to get to anything from the Swisshotel, but this can be a plus if you like a slightly slower atmosphere. Room service provided a good meal at a premium price which is to be expected. The breakfast buffet in the Geneva room was hit and miss, some nice things, some mediocre things, nothing bad. All and all good value, but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience & Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Business_Pleasure_10
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Swissotel was excellent! Even though I was on a business trip, my husband and kids accompanied me. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly...willing to assist us with all of our questions. Housekeeping really went above and beyond in keeping our suite clean and maintaining flexibility with our schedule. Our suite had 2 bathrooms, a business area, living room with pull-out bed, & separate master bedrm w/ a King bed. It was a corner suite on the 31st flr w/ amazing panoramic views! Amenties included 24 hr gym, and indoor pool which was great for my kids. The location was in an odd spot on Wacker, which made it difficult when using taxis, however only 3 blocks from Michigan Ave, 2 blocks from grocery store, and 1 block from a drugstore. Liked Best: Quality/Cleanliness of rooms & Helpful Staff Liked Least: Odd location on Wacker St.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rooms and Service- Be Aware of Extra Costs”
Reviews.Author: Tiredoffees
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous with a great view. The staff are friendly, helpful, and attentive. The food is high quality. Just beware of the extra costs. Parking is $52 per day, the fitness center/pool/sauna costs $15 per person per day, internet service costs $9.95 per day, and the breakfast buffet costs $21 per person. Make sure to include these costs in your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome view, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: parHatboro_PA
Reviews.Content: The view and location were excellent and you couldn't ask for more friendly and accommodating staff, including at the Palm Restaurant in the lobby. Will definitely go back for the summer view!

Reviews.Title: “great accommodations wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: billwestroxbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Everything was perfect, as it has been the 2 or 3 times I've stayed here; and on a frigid night in March they forgave the health club fee, which is one I find particularly irksome. I'd always recommend it highly, and check the deal here first when i come to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nucklehe8d
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived at the hotel early Saturday morning (before10:00 a.m.) on Feb. 13th to attend a wedding. Upon communicating to the front desk personnel, I was slightly thrown aback by their overall excellent customer service. They answered many of my questions and a few that they couldn't immediately answer but searched until they satisfied my inquiries. I can't recall the young ladies name who assisted me but she gave me a "warm and fuzzy" feeling - really displaying a welcoming demeanor as if to say she is glad my daughter and I would be staying at their (Swissotel) hotel. The room was just magnificent! The linen and comforter on the beds were very comfortable which gave my daughter and I a pleasant night's sleep! Also, when we checked out VERY early - Mon. morning - BEFORE 5:00 a.m., the young lady who assisted me displayed a very charming disposition as well. Unfortunately, I can't recall her name either. And, the young man (doorman?) who was readily available during THAT time and who also summoned a cab for my daughter and I - I think his name is ?Clarence? Calvin? or a name that begins with the letter "C" - he was extremely charming and helpful as well. What a very fine team the Swissotel has assembled at THIS location. If I have to fly into downtown Chicago again, I would definitely choose the Swissotel! Not only because of the excellent customer service we experienced, but for the overall location and price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and amenaties”
Reviews.Author: DocKansasCity
Reviews.Content: For my annual visit to Chicago with my wife we stayed at the Swissotel for 4 days. Ask for a room up high (floor 35 to 40). We splurged an extra $25 for the lake view and it was worth it - larger room and terrific view. The gym on floor 42 is outstanding - takes up the entire floor with a large enough pool and hot tub - all with magnificent views. We had a problem with our door which the staff fixed quickly so that in no way did it interfere with our time there. The quality of the amnities (TV shampoo shower bath etc.) were outstanding. I have no compliants whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating with outstanding rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: pal205
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times before, but this needed to be special for our son, soon to be deployed to Afghanistan and his wife and 20 month old daughter;and our younger son. Everything couldn't have been more perfect with an outstanding view of the fireworks over Navy Pier. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Service is gracious and helpful. You can't go wrong choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Fatguyonalittle
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Swissotel Chicago. The highlight was when we called the front desk about rowdy neighbors and asked if we could be moved and the front desk accommodated us without hesitation. The breakfast had a European Flair to it which was nice. Swissotel is now at the top of our Chicago hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and views”
Reviews.Author: rdavis103
Reviews.Content: Try the Muesli for breakfast, healthy and tasty. Great location downtown, but off the beaten path too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: eriksc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swissotel for one night for a conference in the hotel. Room was fine, great bed, good service throughout my stay. All in all a pleasant experience. Conference facilities were also fine.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service from a freindly staff!”
Reviews.Author: fishforfun2008
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice, and the accomodations were very comfortable. The staff willl go the extra mile in helping your stay be comfortable. Not knowing the area very well, the concierge was very helpfull in helping us "see" a few things. The spa and pool area are wonderfull. Again the spa staff are very accomodating. We had massages done and they are worth their weight in gold! The food at the Palm restraunt downstairs was wonderful, and a little pricey, but worth it. Breakfast was also a trewat, there were many varieties of food. I would stay again, and will definately reccomend to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 'local getaway!'”
Reviews.Author: jms010103
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay, from December 30 â€“ January 1, and regardless of the undoubtedly full hotel, we were treated as if we were the only ones there. Everyone from the doormen, to the front desk attendants, to the housekeeping personnel, the bartenders, and even members of the staff who saw us in the hallways and elevators, were MORE than courteous, helpful, and truly a pleasure to deal with. We received inaccurate information about using the mini-bar as a refrigerator when we first checked in, and instead of holding us accountable for charges caused by the sensors being triggered, we were provided with a complimentary refrigerator for the last night of our stay (without us even asking!), and without any questions or delay, had the erroneous charges removed. We live only about 8 miles away from your hotel, and had no particular reason to choose the Swissotel over the myriad other choices we had downtown, but after experiencing their incredible service, and beautiful, clean, facility, we are anxious to return for our next â€˜local getaway.â€™

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DCJack
Reviews.Content: Great location and fabulous people make this a great place to stay - a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: jpbchicag0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights over our 5 year anniversary. We stayed in a standard room one night and a "corner king" the next. Both rooms were great and the corner king is certainly worth the upgrade. The service was outstanding, especially the concierge desk. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “proposed NYE”
Reviews.Author: jcashfanChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed NYE and without asking the staff at the front desk upgraded our room to a corner suite and sent up champane and chocolate strawberrys, We started with drinks and some bar food for happy hour, half price from 4:30 to 6:30 great deal and the shrimp & oysters were fantastic. Dinner was steak & lobster which was included in our NYE package. Not a big lobster eater so I don't have anything to conpare it to but the steak was prepared perfectly. Watch the fireworks from our room on the 26th floor drinking champane cocktails and eating deserts. Breakfest was outstanding and the pool on the 42 floor was relaxing. The only negitive was the room heat was uneven and the floors in the bathroom were cold, O.K. it was 0 degrees NYE and I would recommend parking at 303 E Wacker Garage and save yourself $22.00 aday which is what we did. overall 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: step_ott
Reviews.Content: All hotels in Chicago were offering great rates for this time, but I chose the Swissotel for its location and views. The location was good - close to the loop and shopping but requiring a few blocks walk to get to either. Access to the underground Pedway is closed after 21:00, and all day Sunday. We requested and got a high room and got a view over the river and some of the Magnificent Mile, but most of the view was a neighbouring office building. It was a good view for the cheapest room. The room size and furnishings were all much better than similar hotels (Hilton and Fairmont). Buffet breakfast was included, and it was excellent - everything cooked very well, large variety (changed a little each day), and great service. The hotel service was all fast and friendly, (there was never a wait at the front desk and telephone calls were always answered promptly by a human). The only problems that occurred were due to their computer system, I suspect. The first day we were there the room didn't get made up, and they seemed to be surprised that I was in the room. On the other days strange breakfast charges appeared on the bill. After I contacted someone, all these problems were taken care of in a friendly and trusting way, although the staff all seemed to find their computers difficult and confusing. I was careful of items that weren't included in the price such as internet, long distance, food - they all seemed to be expensive. I would certainly return, and maybe even pay extra for a better room.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED It!”
Reviews.Author: latereviewer
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Kids suite was nicely decorated in aquarium for the kids plus the Shedd aquarium tickets. We had the executive suite attached for parent privacy. The view was BREATHTAKING. The beds were so comfortable My 3 and 2 year old went right to sleep as soon as their little heads hit the pillow. We felt like millionaires for the weekend. The executive suite is set up like an apartment. HUGE, SPACIOUS, and LUXURIOUS. The staff was very catering. Valet is 52 a day with in and out privileges, worth it because to have a warm car waiting for you @ every outing was awesome. We enjoyed the hotel so much that other than our outings to NAVY PIER and SHEDD AQUARIUM we would have preferred to stay in .But with room service food being so pricey we got out and experienced some Chicago restaurants. The POOL was FUN, my kids loved it. I have traveled before and 4 star is mandatory for me and my family. I must say this hotel doesnt disappoint! I will now make SWISS a December tradition for my family

Reviews.Title: “No one does it better!”
Reviews.Author: JAG1972
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the United States for business and pleasure and honestly...this hotel does everything right! The customer service is BY FAR the best anywhere! Rooms and views are great! They actually pay attention to the details! I actually look forward to work assignments that take me to Chicago so I can stay here. They ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, room and employees”
Reviews.Author: kathismom
Reviews.Content: First time to Chicago and stayed here. Upgraded myself to a corner room and had an amazing view. The lake is so big you could think it was an ocean. Easy to get to from Midway on the L. Front desk staff was superb. Downside was only that I was there such a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: carolo22CL
Reviews.Content: The views are fabulous, the staff was very helpful, and wonderful breakfast included with stay. Will definitely recommend to others and we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Moe078
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Swissotel numerous times. We have eaten in their Palm Restaurant and the food and serivce were excellent. From the front desk to the maid service we have always experienced superior service. I have also dealt with the conference planning staff and the events that we had scheduled at the Swissotel were excellent. The pre-planning, food and post-event staff are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay could not have been more pleasant!!”
Reviews.Author: MRDJOT
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not have been more pleasant!! We arrived quite early and anticipated not being able to check in to our room, but to leave our bags - much to our surprise and delight we were assigned a room immediately (without asking) and she accommodated our request for a room near the elevator. We were very satisfied with our entire experience and look forward to our next visit. The staff was very pleasant, rooms were very clean, updated and nicely appointed. Sheets, pillows and blankets were yummy. Our view of Navy Pier was most enjoyable - especially at night with the ferris wheel lights. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Biogeog
Reviews.Content: We spent the Thanksgiving weekend at the hotel and got a very good price (much lower than the normal rate). The room was very nice as was the pool and exercise room. The parking was expensive, but they give 50% discount for hybrid cars (yea!) so it was reasonable. There aren't many places in the immediate vicinity to eat, but nothing is a very far walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, and even more so - disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LATESHO
Reviews.Content: The staff at Swissotel were not particularly nice. They weren't overtly rude, but they also never went out of their way to address me as a guest. Each time I waited at the counter for staff (checkin and checkout - they did not put my bill under my door) for several minutes and then was waved to the desk upon my turn with no hello or anything, or apology for waiting in line. When I told them they needed more desk workers, my statement was not even acknowledged. Mediocre room and service for a very extravagant price. Also, views were good, but there are many hotels located closer to trains, Michigan Ave, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Swissotel is one of our favorite hotels in Chicago and the corner rooms have the most fantastic views in the city.”
Reviews.Author: prez2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Swissotel many times. The accomodations and support services are phenomenal. All staff members are very courteous and go the extra mile in meeting your needs during your stay. I would encourage everyone to make the Swissotel your lodging destination next time you go to Chicago. You won't regret it and will return for future trips to the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but 15 minute walk to trains”
Reviews.Author: imasportsluvr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked this hotel through Hotwire. The staff was great and put us on the 30th floor with a view of the lake. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. My only negative is that it's about a 15 minute walk to the trains which would be inconvenient on a rainy or cold day.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel provides everything you cold want to make you feel like an important and valued guest”
Reviews.Author: casadega
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Chicago and want to have a great hotel stay with no worries, this is your place. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the town and will go out of your way to be helpful. While my boyfriend andI were trying to get to the Pedway, one of the hotel managers stopped what he was doing and lead us to where we were going. after a long and exhausting drive from Tennessee, the beds at the Swiss were incredibly welcoming too. My boyfriend is currently trying to find out how they make their beds so comfortable and where he can get one of their comforters because it felt so amazing. Getting little toblerone (one of my favorites) chocolates on your pillow everynight is a nice touch that adds some elegance to your evening no matter why your staying there. The rooms look like they were just remodled and upgraded, there was an HD TV and a nice iHome docking station to put my iPod so I could set the alarm to wake up with my music instead of the radio. The whole decor was really to my taste, and of course it helped that it was impeccibly clean the whole time. While I was out exploring chicago, the blanket that I'd brought from home and left in a chair was even folded neatly at the foot of the bed when I came back. I'm a little bathroom phobic and these were really nice, super clean, with beautiful (very new looking) tile. I'm really into showers and so i liked the big showerheads that give you the rainfall style shower. I didn't try out the tub though. Also, i know there's a 24 hour exercise/fitness facility upstairs. I walked through it to go use the pool and jacuzzi (talk about a pool with a view, try the 42nd floor! that was a fun place to swim). It looked like it had a lot of weights and machines to choose from but I never got to use any of them. We were staying to go to SOFA (the Sculptural Objects & Functional Art exposition) at Navy Pier. Having a great hotel in close proximity to Navy Pier, in a central location downtown, with a gerat view of Lake Michigan was important. (well the great view wasn't important, but it was a very nice bonus). The bar in the hotel lobby has a very comfrotable feel, even though stylistically its very classy. We saw several groups of people sitting around chatting with tables pulled together or by the fireplace, and both bartenders were very friendly and helpful answering questions about chicago. Our whole stay it felt like the staff went out of their way to make sure we had the best visit possible. Breakfast in the Geneva downstairs was great as well. I love fresh fruit but generally you only get apples and a banana, so seeing fresh raspberries, blueberries and strawberries (among other breakfast fruit staples) was surprising. They had a great selection of pastries, cereals, yogurt and breakfast meats. there were so many different things for breakfast (plus you could order off the menu) it would take too long to go into them, but I was happy to get such a variety of options. I wish I could mention every good thing about our stay...there were just so many little things that made it add up to a great trip. The only downside was that we had to leave. We're already planning a return trip to the Swiss where we can stay for at least a week to see parts of Chicago we missed and because we had such a great experience it really made us want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, staff and location, but extras overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jruez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a deal off hotwire for a 4 star near michigan and it ended up being this hotel. The hotel staff was very nice, from the moment we drove up. We were put on the 41st floor (of 43) and had a nice view. We were not sure what to expect since we used Hotwire and got a great rate, so we were very pleased. The location is perfect. A couple blocks from Michigan, so a walk or a short $5 taxi ride takes you to any shop you would like. We went to the Shedd Aquarium for around $6-7. We also found that if you take the escalator down under the hotel, there is a dunkin donuts and many other shops/restaurants to eat. They are open during the week, but most were closed on saturday. Room service was expensive in the hotel. I just remember $29 for eggs benedict. Don't quote me on that exact prices, but it is pretty close. Even with the amount we saved on the room, we could not justify spending the amount they listed for room service. We found a great place for breakfast a few block away called South Water Kitchen - great meals and we spent about $35 between us. We paid for parking at the hotel. It is as expensive as everyone says - $52 per day - but we felt with what we saved, it wasn't too bad. I would rather not have taken a car at all, but needed it for a day of work. I will save my money next time on the car and parking and use Go Airport Express to/from the airport or a cab, then use cabs or walk to get around the city. Also, I would have liked to use the Fitness center, but it was $15 per day. I would have probably done it for $5, but would rather it have been free. We did go and check it out. It was totally empty. Nice, but totally empty. I wonder if a lot of people pay to use it. Positive - Great room, comfortable bed Very friendly staff, help you in any way they can Internet was $9.95 per day - not too bad Although we didn't eat there, they have a Palm Restaurant off the main lobby. Close to everything - underground eating, Michigan avenue shops - walking or short cab Negatives- Room service expensive - ridiculously expensive Parking expensive - $52 per day Fitness center cost $15 per day

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: I wish I had reviewed the Swissotel Chicago when it was more fresh in my mind! I really enjoyed this hotel for business travel. The good: -Rooms: Recently rennovated. Large, really comfortable bed. Spacious bathroom with nice ammenities. Every room as a view of the river - really lovely. -Location: Just a couple blocks off of Michigan Ave. for shopping and restaurants. -Meeting Space: I attended an event at the hotel. They just added a brand new Conference Center in addition to their existing meeting space, which I did not experience. It's beautiful. Great views, really convenient space for any event. The okay: -Staff: They were fine. Nice, but not overly welcoming. A "hello" or "welcome back" when you walk through the lobby would go a long way. The bad: -Business Center: This was closed when I was staying at the Swissotel. Very tough for a hotel catering to business travelers. I hope they get it up and running soon! I went over to their sister hotel, the Fairmont Chicago, to use their business center. They were very kind. I would definitely return to the Swissotel when on business in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “They charge for wireless and it doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: healthynut
Reviews.Content: This hotel nickel and dimes you for everything -- $15 to use the gym, $11 for wireless internet. I wouldn't mind the charges if I had known about them in advance or if they had just folded it in to my bill and I would have paid a little more... It's just irritating to arrive at the front desk and be told you have to fork over extra money for what should be basic hotel functions AND THE WORST PART IS THE WIRELESS DOESN;T WORK except in the lobby. In the room, it only works occasionally (just enough to frustrate you) so you have to use your computer downstairs in the noisy lobby. This is a serious minus for a business hotel--wireless is a non-negotiable for me. I won't be staying here again until I hear that they have upgraded this service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great everything!”
Reviews.Author: Wendyg88
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Swissotel Chicago for business and must say it exceeded my expectations. The staff was terrific both with my room and with the business aspects of our event. My room was fantastic with beautiful views of the city, large flat screen tv, and a very comfortable king size bed. The food for our event was delicious. The onsite restaurant was pretty good but a bit overpriced. It was a bit confusing getting to some of our event room since some were in the original side of the building and some were in the newer addition. All in all though it was a great place to stay if you want to be near the heart of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: wenditoburrito
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel the weekend of Oct. 10th. The hotel is in a great location sort of in the middle between Millennium Park/Art Institute and the shops on Michigan Avenue. We were able to walk everywhere and even to the train stop, which is maybe 7 blocks away. At night, it was too cold to walk, so we took cabs, even to places only 1 mile away. The hotel was simple, clean and didn't try to be too trendy or over the top, with mostly business travelers. The double room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allischu2
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The front desk personnel were friendly and very efficient upon check in, the room had a fabulous view of Navy Pier & the lake. The room was very plush, it had a wonderful bathroom. It also had the most comfortable bed/linens I've ever experienced in a hotel. It's a perfect location for shopping. We did not experience any noise coming from other rooms, pretty quiet. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: xxcaroxx
Reviews.Content: You are walking distance to both Grant and Millennium park and Magnificent Mile. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and nice. This hotel was truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kkgirl
Reviews.Content: huband & I stayed at this hotel during his conference. everything was very comfortable and our room had a good view. the rooftop pool was very cool too!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own conditioner”
Reviews.Author: JP&mom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay for a business conference. I was disappointed in the hotel for several reasons, a couple of which were probably unique to my stay and thus irrelevant to others considering the hotel (some indifferent staff, multiple interruptions from engineering trying to install hi-def on the TV, mini-bar charges resulting from the engineering guys moving the refrigerator and jostling the mini-bar sensors, a damp comforter cover on the bed after I checked in). Generally applicable comments: the standard rooms are small, the lobby bar is very small (not amenable to a lot of people having a post-meeting drink). Compare the large and lively lobby bars at the Marriott or Westin North River. The bathroom mirrors are not well placed for applying make-up, a minimum number of towels are supplied, the shampoo was not refilled without my express request, and no conditioner was supplied -- bring your own conditioner! I might have felt less critical if I were not paying $279 (before taxes) for a "conference rate" standard room. I wish that I had done what others at my conference did: stay across the street at the Hyatt for half the cost. The Westin North River remains my favorite Chicago hotel. Lastly, why does Trip Advisor allow the hotel to post the same "thank for your comment" response to all reviews of this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith200
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel Aug '09. Very efficient. Nice rooms with good views. Good location. Clean. Would stay again. Keith + Kate Marsden

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Excellant room,very comfortable far superior to your usual large American hotel chains.Nice views and good location in the city.Good breakfast buffet.Pool and gym average but acceptable.Dated lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: missybrown
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night visit at the Swissotel. The staff from front desk to concierge to housekeeping could not have been more professional and obliging. We were offered an upgrade to a corner room on a high floor (which was so not expected-as we were on a $99 TravelZoo special). This rate also included free access to the pooland gym. The room was an ample size and extremely immaculate,with plenty of toiletries and bathrobes. We had a terriffic view of Navy Pier and contrary to other reviewers were able to see the fireworks just fine. The food in the lounge was great and very fresh---salads, sandwiches etc. The location was terriffic-so close to "The Mile", Millenium Park, Navy Pier and the EL stop to Wrigley. We were traveling with a 13 year old and he was impressed as well. Theresa in the gift shop went so far as to get my son a sweatshirt in his size from another gift shop location at the Hyatt . The service truly was above and beyond. We will definitely stay at the Swissotel on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zorrosam
Reviews.Content: In the center of Chicago, one of the nearest place of all the most important places of the city. With 10 min of walking you can stay in michigan avenue, navy pier, in the loop ... millenium park, sears tower and much more. Good price and the highest quality that you can find. book it for a very confortable vacation in this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bellled
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend and really enjoyed the hote. We had a king bedroom with a lake view on the 10th floor. They view was amazing and I would only stay there again if I had that same view. The room was really big and the bed was quite comfortable. Flat screen TV was also very nice. The bathroom was nice but could've been a little bigger. There was a full size tub and separate shower which was kinda odd. The bar was nice but ridicoulius drink prices, although they had free trail mix! The concierge wasn't very friendly and rather dissappointing. I wouldn't ask this particular person for a recommednation again. He wasn't rude just kinda blah and didn't really care. Only complaint was our room was 1001 which shares a wall with the elevators. It was nice being near the elevator but the wall was thin and you can hear the muffled sounds of them going by. It didn't wake you up or really distract you since it was muffled. But I would prefer to not hear it at all. The hotel was really nice, great location, and I would stay there again in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: running64
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week end stay at the Swissotel. I read reviews on Trip Advisor before booking the 99.00 room and most of the reviews were positive. We found the location the room and every employee extremly nice. I asked for a nice view since my daughter had not been there previously was offered one at an additional charge said no thank you and the desk clerk said you will have a view and what a wonderful view we had. The lake and the city.I have visited many large cities and stayed in very exclusive hotels. The resturants, parking etc are alway expensive. Someone on trip Advisor compained about the parking charges, hey it was on the hotel web-site. If you can book on the web, read everything. As far as food, walk a few blocks toward Michigan Ave turn left or right and there are plently of less expensive places to eat. Great city, but yes it is expensive. I would definitly stay at ths hotel again. Drinks in the bar were about average price (high) for the city. The Palm resturant in the hotel had some specials Sunday night, we ate there and the food service,etc were outstanding (portions are large and we shared since we are not big eaters. Trip Advisor never lets me down.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ultimatespeedracer
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with all the amenities. Everyone was helpful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. The bed was "just like home". We would definitely stay again. A nice touch was the water bottles left in our car for us to enjoy on our way home. It was little touches like this that make this hotel one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Christo_Texas
Reviews.Content: Spacey, quiet with a sense of luxury. I would definitely choose it again and I highly recommend it. However parking should be cheaper (I find the 52$ a lot), breakfast needs some refining (it is good quality but limited in variety) and front desk needs more employees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: nri123
Reviews.Content: 1. Navy Pier view was visible from the corridor near the lift on 31st floor. 2. I needed to charge my phone battery which was dying and they provided with some left over chargers which returned back before we checked out. 3. Very near downtown and Millenium park and we walked all the way to Sears Tower (Less than 1 mile walk). 4. Is also near to Navy Pier although its not the hotels fault we didnt ask them the directions. They do have a map of the loop + all nearby attractions with clearly marked details. 5. Room was very neat and hey EXCELLENT BOLD TASTE COFFEE. 6. Took the charge of the minibar which we had used to keep my 2 year old sons food. 7. We didnt use the parking or the gym or the pool and they have technology to remember the guests name when you call the concierge or the guest service they will address you by name. 8. My son loved the Chicago river view from our 31st floor , rooms where neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: negalloc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property at a travelzoo rate of $99, which is an incredible value for this property. Overall an excellent hotel, charming modern rooms, would stay again with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Opeyo
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Chicago was located near all of the top attractions, i.e. the Magnificent Mile, the Navy Pier and Chicago River. For a good price, we received a double bed, large spacious room with view of the city and the Chicago River. However, Geneva Restaurant in the basement was over priced. For example, the breakfast buffet was $26 and hot chocolate cost $6. There was a $15 daily fee for using the gym. The equipment in the business center was outdated. The bellhop staff were not very resourceful. On another recent trip to Chicago, I stayed at the downtown W Hotel near the Art Institute. The rooms were small and much more expensive. Therefore, I would definitely recommend the Swissotel over the W Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiKidOhio
Reviews.Content: Most comfortable beds. Beautiful, sparkling clean room. Great service. We got a super price so took advantage of a $40 per night upgrade for our 3 nights stay and got the most spectacular corner panoramic view that we hated to leave the room. Lake Michigan, The Wrigley Building, Navy Pier all at a glance and fireworks at night. Wonderful stay. We'll do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: MommySquared
Reviews.Content: My family booked the Staycation package with Nicole, the Director of Marketing. From start to finish our 4 day/3 night trip was excellent. I love the VIK desk (as did my 2 and 4 year old) and the view of Navy Pier from our 31st floor window was superb. Not to mention the Air and Water Show was taking place so we saw some great air tricks. The only damper on our trip was my son hit his lip on the windowsill in the room (very 4 year old level) and busted his lip open. It bled forever! Tramatic! Despite that we enjoyed our mini trip and loved the staff. Everyone was super friendly and the package was fabulous & it is easy to walk everywhere or take a water taxi. We hope to return... minus the injury!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AEKBS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip in August, 2009, and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Previous reviews have mentioned the elevator noise--yes, you can hear the elevators, but it's not so loud as to be a real bother. The bed was comfortable; the room was clean; the view was fantastic; and the staff was both helpful and friendly. The fitness center has good equipment, and room service arrives even faster than they predict in their estimates. The internet service is reliable and fast, and the desk in the room is large. There is a highly-ranked restaurant in the hotel, but there are also many other eateries nearby, at almost every price range, if you choose to eat elsewhere. What more can you ask of a business hotel? The architecture of the hotel is unusual--it is a triangular-shaped building, and is featured in the City of Chicago's architectural boat tours along the river. The hotel is close to Michigan Avenue and the Navy Pier and Grant Park, etc., so it's conveniently located within walking distance to many things you'll want to see/do in Chicago. I stayed here for a week, and every single employee I encountered was friendly. I'd happily stay here again. Having said that, don't expect much in the way of spa amenities or leisure activities--this is a business hotel, not a resort. If you need a place to sleep and prepare for work, this hotel is great. If you are hoping for a resort experience, in which you need not leave your hotel, then you might be better off staying at an actual resort.

Reviews.Title: “I read too many reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bigshooter5360
Reviews.Content: Although I was not lucky enough to find any deals(I never am; I paid full price), our stay at the Swissotel could not have gone much better. We bought the Shedd aquarium package and upgraded to a corner room with a view of the river on one side and Navy Pier on the other. AWESOME VIEW! My wifes trips to the spa and all other plans we made went without a hitch. The room was large and spotless. The Shedd package could have been a little simpler(charge you at the restaurant for breakfast and is credited back at the front desk ) but they gave us what was promised. A couple of things to watch out for are we settled for a room on the & 7th floor and even at midnight the street noise was unbearable(including the hotel taxi whistles every 5 minutes) and make sure you skip the valet parking. There are two parking decks one directly behind the hotel and one within a block where you can park at half the price(if you count tips).

Reviews.Title: “Plenty within walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: Sisaggie
Reviews.Content: We went there for our first anniversary having never been to Chicago before, and were pleased with the value, the cleanliness and the location. The room felt just a little squished, and I think our room had a slightly broken vent that made a mildly annoying whistling noise, and it appeared like someone had pried open the vent before in a vain attempt to fix it. Nonetheless the bathroom was luxurious with a separate shower and bath, and we loved wearing the plush bathrobes that they provided. It was within convenient walking distance of many of the popular sites in downtown Chicago and also within 5-10 minute walk of bus or the "L". I would certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: I never seem to be away from the Swissotel Chicago lately! Work keeps bringing me back here, which is absolutely fine by me; I know exactly what to expect, and equally, know that it will be of a high standard. The hotel is not smack-bang on the Magnificent Mile, so if a super-central location - i.e. one right in the middle of the hustle and bustle - is important to you, then you may wish to try the Marriott or the Intercontinental. However, the Swissotel is so close to all that, but is also nicely removed from it; located closer to Navy Pier, it is quieter and a lot calmer, but still offers easy access to the shopping and attractions of the city. A pleasant stroll along the river brings you out at the end of the Magnificent Mile, where it is also possible to catch a boat trip or join one of the 'hop on, hop off' bus/trolley tours. I've olny ever stayed in the 'standard' rooms in this property, all of which are spacious and airy, and function well for both business or leisure travellers. There is always a generously-sized workdesk, which would easily accommodate two working on their laptops, (though there is only one chair provided). I have generally had two telephones in the room, (one on the workdesk and another on the coffee table beside the lounge chair), but on this occasion, I only have the one. Not a major issue at all, but worth noting. Similarly, the size of the bathroom on this visit is smaller than usual - but it still has the separate walk-in shower as well as a bath, which is very much appreciated! Rooms all appear to either look out onto the river and the bustle of Chicago or, on the other side, will face Navy Pier, (an especially great view during the summer months when there are regular firework displays). The technology in the room is good and up-to-date; a large plasma TV, (I think...I'm not especially up on these things!), is complemented by a handy clock/radio on the nightstand which also allows you to charge your ipod and indeed play music from the ipod through the speakers, which makes a nice touch. On the negative side, the minibar is one of those nasty move-anything-and-you'll-pay-through-the-nose ones, which I have come to hate with a vengeance! I have in the past called Guest Services for the loan of a mini-fridge which was previously installed in the room with no problem; this time round, I was told there was a flat US$50 fee for this, irrespective of the duration of the stay. Well I'd appreciate this being mentioned in the in-room literature, and don't exactly understand such a hefty charge, (it's not like I'm going to run off with the thing!), especially when I'd be paying the same for less than 24 hours useage as a traveller spending a week here...(needless to say, I didn't pay!) Also worth mentioning is that this can be quite a 'conference' destination which can make things very busy if you are staying during one of these events; service can be slow and erratic, and the wait for elevators can be long and frustrating! The breakfast buffet in the Geneva restaurant is a highlight and a good start to the day. There is a definite continental twist to the spread on offer, with a lovely birchermusli and lots of cold cuts to accompany the usual American-style fayre. The serving times are generously extended over the weekend so breakfast can quite easily become a leisurely brunch, and it's worth taking your time over the whole thing if you're not in a rush! An excellent choice when staying in Chicago, but I would recommend trying to get a room on a higher floor if possible to maximise your enjoyment of the views!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing not to like”
Reviews.Author: mangomojito
Reviews.Content: I think my title says it all. While there was nothing that I absolutely fell in love with at this hotel, there was also nothing not to like either. We managed to secure an unbelievable deal very last minute for the Swissotel. It wasn't my first choice to be honest, but it more than lived up to my expectations and superceded what I needed to get out of it. The location is almost unbeatable for the price. And it does earn cred for being the only triangular shape hotel building in Chicago. It sits right above the river and depending where your room is you'll get unparallelled views of the architecture, two bodies of water and the beautifully lit Navy Pier at night. We faced the Wrigley building on the 29th floor. It was a bit unnerving to also be facing a busy office building across the street from us especially when it came to changing or just relaxing. But we really did spend very little time in our rooms.When it comes to the rooms, its your standard run of the mill hotel room. Clean, a bit on the small side. We had two doubles and I have to say the room felt a bit cramped. One of the beds were almost up against the wall. Yes, while the best thing going for this hotel is the location they do have some negatives too. It's not the hippest or most trendy place. If you're single you're probably not going to have a kickin time here. I saw that it was mostly families, older couples or suited people coming in for conventions. The staff is friendly enough and check in, check out went smoothly without incident. The rooms were cleaned spic and span every day. The beds were comfortable but it was too soft/plush for me, but that's a matter of personal preference. The mini bar is super annoying as they charge you for just moving things out of place, but it is also a no brainer to rectify the situation at check out. They are probably so used to these types of complaints, they didn't give us a hard time at all. All in all, I was within a 5-10 min walk to most of the major destinations in downtown. The loop, the red and blue line, the El, millennium park, grant park, lake shore, the boat tours, steps from Michigan Ave and Magnificient Mile, Navy Pier. The convenience factor is unbeatable. There are tons of restaurants within a few block radius. We never ate anything onsite so I can't vouch for the food options immediately avialable. Another thing that was annoying was the fact that they charge for internet, the gym and the pool. But I guess they have to make money somehow since they practically give their rooms away. It's really a great value for the money and I wouldnt mind to stay here again if I was visiting the city again. And that's saying a lot!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: KYBetsy
Reviews.Content: After I booked this hotel, I was a little worried by some of the reviews on here, so I went in with low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. While I agree that the Swissotel is not a super memorable hotel for a 4 star place, it is what it is...basically, a business hotel. Our rate was $209 for a recently renovated queen/queen room on a high floor. We had a wonderful view of the river and the Wrigley building. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was huge (but I think this was because we were in a handicapped accessible room). It was very quiet, even though the hotel was full. The only place I could hear other people was in the bathroom, for some reason. The front desk was very nice about letting us check-in at 12 noon and then storing our bags with the bellman. The desk clerk told us that most days we would have been able to have a room at noon, but that the hotel had been sold out the night before and there were many people still checking out at noon. I had read about the expensive valet parking, so we pulled in, dropped off our bags, and then moved our car to a less expensive garage, saving us $22! All in all, we had a good experience and, while it might not be my first choice, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impersonal and not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: txorig
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the week of July 9-14, 2009. Below is my response to the automated message sent by the hotel thanking me for patronage and asking for any feedback. The management response : "Thank you and your feedback is very helpful! I will be sure to pass along to our management team for review and corrective action. Thank you again and have a great week." =========== Hello, We did enjoy Chicago and may visit again. I was visiting on business so I am not sure I would stay at your hotel again. Your prices are prohibitive for a personal visit, and I was actually a little surprised at all the extra charges. My husband and I travel extensively and this was our first Swissotel. We were so disappointed to find every amenity was an extra charge. $11.00 for a bottle of water, a gym use charge, and the wireless was charged per laptop! That was truly a first for us. Many families now have multiple laptops and this will be one of my main warnings in my reviews. We stay in Klimpton Hotels, Omniâ€™s, Sofitelâ€™s as well as Hiltonâ€™s and Marriottâ€™s and I believe all of them offer complimentary wireless (though some require a free signup for their member services). Even if they donâ€™t offer it in the room, the lobby has complimentary wireless. You can see this is critical for us, and I suspect, for many who travel on a regular basis. The room was nice and large and I assume I was given a handicap room (though we do not have disabilities) because of the conference rate. A heads up by the front desk about this would have been nice, though I suspect this explains the reason the room was so spacious. The tub though did look a little hospital like with the bars and the drippy faucet staining the porcelain. We should have reported the drip, but we were kidding that we might get charged for it :) Some of the concierge staff were abit chilly at times, but the housekeeping service staff were extremely friendly and cheerful. Too bad on several days, they were not able to service the room until late afternoon. Another surprise when we wanted to take at nap at 4:30pm and the room was still not cleaned. We did appreciate the promptness of any requests we made (e.g. wakeup calls, non-allergen pillows, shampoo) That said, we were again surprised that we had to request shampoo! On the second day we finally realized, nope, it wasnâ€™t a mistake, they just donâ€™t provide it. However, as we didnâ€™t bring any extra in our packing, we called and, as noted, it was promptly delivered. I appreciate your follow-up email and hope this feedback is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for the price”
Reviews.Author: artlover1765
Reviews.Content: Pros: very comfortable beds, nice rooms, excellent views Cons: They nickel-and-dime you to death! Parking for hotel guests is $52! That's crazy. There is a $15 fee to use the pool, sauna or fitness center. An order of bacon for breakfast is $9. The mini bar is unheated and a small bottle of water costs $9. There is no mini fridge in the room and the little extras like shampoo bottles and hand soap are miniscule and there are few of them. The tv channels available are fewer than I get at home with basic cable. And there were only two people at the front desk checking in guests. One of them was ignoring guests while she typed on her computer, so there was effectively only one person checking guests in - and this was on a Saturday! He was not particularly gracious. Both of the them seemed slightly annoyed at having to do their job. This is supposed to be an upscale hotel but it is a poor value for the money and definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Location and View”
Reviews.Author: CG_1211
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Chicago over 4th of July weekend. What a great place to stayâ€”especially if you are partaking in the cityâ€™s festivities. A very short walk brought me to Grant Park where they had fireworks on the 3rd. And afterwards, since the hotel is just slightly off the main drag of Michigan Ave, I was able to retreat quickly back to my room and enjoy the peace and quiet rather than all the noise from everyone walking around. And the view from my roomâ€”spectacular! I couldnâ€™t have asked for a more idyllic picture of Chicago right outside my window. The room was quite spacious and very clean. The bed was so comfortable I felt like I was sleeping at home. The hotel was a bit busy during this weekend, but the staff did a great job of helping me with whatever I needed. I would definitely recommend Swissotel as the place to stay when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: wycowboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice clean and quiet location for us. We were not right smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle which was o.k. for us. We had about a 20 minute walk to Navy Pier and Millenium Park. We had several meals at Fox Obel which is over the River and down about 2 blocks on your right. Their meals were fresh and delicious. The Hotel staff were professional, but the fornt desk was somewhat slow at check in. The Lobby bar does not serve food very late at night and we couldn't find any vending machines for soda or snacks, so stop at a nearby market before going in for the night. We did not even crack open the mini bar because the prices were outragous. We had a view of lake Michigan and the Chicago River. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. We upgraded to a suite so the room was spacious. We did not hear much traffic from the street below. We booked this room through hotwire and got a good price. Park at one of the pay to park areas on the street or one of the public parking lots as the hotel parking is $ 52/day.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding lake and river views but a bit off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Chudwad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit off the beaten track. It's on Wacker Dive between Columbus and Lake Shore Drive. My daughter and I stayed on the 16th floor. It was the July fourth weekend so the hotel was packed. The wait time for the elevators was a bit lengthy. We also had to wait about ten minutes for the baggage clerk to return from wherever it is he was. While we heard nothing from the people in the next room, we heard the elevators constanly until about midnight. It was quiet until about 5:00 A.M, but then the elevators began again in earnest. We did pay for an upgraded room so we had a spectacular view of Lake Michigan, the Chicago River, and Navy Pier. The hotel is within walking distance of Navy Pier but we took a cab to get to the John Hancock building. Also, the 42nd floor has some unexpected autographed jerseys and photos of some famous Chicago athletes. The king size bed was extremely comfortable, and so were the feather pillows and down comforters. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very spacious and well stocked with toilletrees. The concierge was friendly and helpful. We ordered room service for breakfast and were not disappointed. Though it was pretty costly, it was definitely worth it. We had the best scrambled eggs ever, some outstanding bacon, and they actually brought us a toaster so that we could toast our bread in our room. The OJ was freshly squeezed. The potatoes were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, but....”
Reviews.Author: BaseballGrrrl
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I will say that I am grateful my father and I did not share some of the horror stories some people had. My father and I were in town for four days from Los Angeles to catch a game at Wrigley Stadium, and the front desk and bar staff were all very friendly and accommodating, providing recommendations to us about the attractions, and transportation services. While we had to dispute some charges on the last day (they charged us for a meal that should have been complimentary and for moving items in the mini-refrigerator to store our own water), they were more than happy to remove the charges and apologized for the inconvenience. The hotel is across the street from the Chicago River and various boat tours, and is about a 15minute walk from Navy Pier. All of the trains, buses, shopping areas, bars, etc. are within walking distance from the hotel or a very short taxi ride away. Also, Giordano's Pizza is five minutes away from the hotel. HIGHLY recommend this fantastic pizza!! Some of the drawbacks were the thin walls and not being able to rest comfortably when others were using the shower in your room or in another room, a very slippery shower after it was cleaned and no vending machines. Also, there were limited television channels and the charges for internet were ridiculous(I stood at a dingy hotel in NY and they had wireless internet service), but one should not go on vacation to surf the net or watch television anyway. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Can't beat the price and convenience!!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: dbsweet
Reviews.Content: My college roommate and I try to meet up once or twice a year for a trip and decided to hit Chicago over the July 4th weekend. I found a $99 rate at the Swissotel through Travelzoo so that made booking accomodations an easy choice. The location was super convenient for us...a quick walk to Grant Park for Taste of Chicago and the fireworks, the Art Institute, and nearby L stations to get us everywhere else as we were without a car (for which I was grateful based on the hotel's parking fees). Our room had two full beds which were very comfortable and we liked that we had a shower stall separate from the bath. Everything was very clean in our room...housekeeping took good care of us. The hotel was packed and we did hear quite a bit of noise from other guests but only when they were passing through the hallways...no big deal. What was a problem was the crazy wait time for the elevators. People were lined up halfway through the lobby a few times when we were passing through...luckily we were always on our way out when the lines were that bad so we didn't have to wait too long. Overall, I think the Swissotel is a perfectly nice facility and I feel like we got a good deal but I would never consider paying full price to stay there as you can get the same amenities and service at lower rates elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: lovinSC
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were offered an upgrade for a room with a view. Since it cost more we declined and had a room on the 16th floor on the side facing away from the river. Our view was just wonderful. It overlooked a park and the new Aqua building. We could also see the marina and the Natural History Museum. The room was very comfortable. We enjoyed the single-serving coffee/tea appliance. We were charged for mini-bar items even though we had only opened the refrigerator to put our own water bottles in to be chilled, so be sure to check your bill before checking out if you do this. The hotel took the false charges off immediately when we mentioned it. The Geneva restaurant had delicious breakfasts. Location was convenient for picking up bus and boat tours and walking to the Navy Pier and the Mag Mile. We were disappointed that the internet service was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you can get a deal!”
Reviews.Author: lilaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel from July 1 â€“ 5, 2009. We got a superb rate by taking advantage of the hotelâ€™s price match/beat policy and a rate found on Orbitz.com . Our four night stay ended up costing $320 US including taxes. Check-in was smooth. I had called ahead to request a high floor and a view of Grant Park. I had hoped that we could see some of the fireworks on July 3rd from our room (30th floor). I asked the check-in clerk if this would be possible and he said that even from the high floors, there would be obstructed views. The room itself was nice but not spotless. There was garbage under the desk, the capsule in the coffee maker from the previous user was still in the coffee maker, and our bed sheet had a hole in it (about 1â€� long). Oddly, we werenâ€™t given any shampoo either â€“ just conditioner. There was a container on the bathroom counter meant for cotton balls, swabs, etc. and it was empty for the duration of our stay. Not a huge deal since we use our own toiletries but I expected more for a hotel of this calibre. Surprisingly, we saw the July 3rd fireworks quite clearly from our room â€“ beats having to fight the crowds on street level. And we were able to watch the fireworks over Navy Pier on both Wednesday and Saturday from the window right outside the elevators on our floor. HD TV is a nice touch but analog channels was a bit odd. I needed ice every night to store some drinks we bought at the CVS next door; the hotel ice machines are not on all floors. And no machine had ice on July 4th! Apparently, the hotel was charging $5 for in-room ice delivery that night. (PULEEZE!) From a location perspective, the hotel wasnâ€™t all that centrally located to the Loop or Mag Mile or the train stations. We took the bus (#6 â€“ right @ the corner of Wacker and Columbus) a lot since this was very efficient. There are very little amenities near the hotel â€“ except for the newly opened CVS next door and the Bockwinkels near the Fairmont (on Stetson). It was frustrating to spend a day shopping on Mag Mile, then come back to the hotel to dump off bags, have a shower, and then head back out again to Mag Mile for dinner. The concierge and service line were both just okay. No greeting when you called them (Westin, Hilton, Marriott all greet you by your name when you call) and the service was fine but indifferent. No maps/tourist booklets were readily available. I would give another Swissotel a try in another location but if I returned to Chicago, I would stay elsewhere as location is really important for us. But, for the price we paid, there is very little to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location - Don't Expect 5 Star Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Tempel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights July 5 & 6 for $139 with breakfast included. Hotel was nice and clean but didn't have the 5 star feel to it. The room was comfortable but small and the double beds were comfortable but only a full size, not queen. The bathroom was updated and nice. We had a great view of the city and the Chicago river. Extra $15 to use the pool/workout room each day. We used it one day but the charge never appeared on our bill. They had free Starbucks coffee in the lobby starting in the afternoon. Easy walk to Navy Pier and all the good shopping. Concierge was always a hit or miss in the lobby. We dumped our rental car and walked everywhere. Don't bother with The Palm Restuarant. WAY Over-rated and expensive. We enjoyed our lunch at Smith and Wolensky much better. Try the Big Bowl restaurant on E. Ohio St. for a very good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. We were there from 07/03 thru 07/07. It was very busy for the 4th of July weekend (family with 7 kids in next room, Yikes!) and very quiet on Sunday and Monday. The cost is about the same as the Hyatt Regency, one block west, but a much, much better value than the Hyatt. The room was clean at all times. The pictures I've attached are from my cell so they are a little blurry but you'll get the idea. To nitpick, the number of TV channels isn't great and the hallways had debris on the carpet for a few days that should've been cleaned earlier but these are minor items. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. This is a very good value in a great downtown location. Stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't trust them”
Reviews.Author: greenirish
Reviews.Content: We booked a July 4th stay to watch the fireworks. When I called I told the person at the hotel we were staying there to WATCH THE FIREWORKS. Instead of telling me the fireworks would be at Grant park on that night only and would not be viewable from the hotel at all, he said that an act of god might prevent fireworks viewing. Now to me an act of god is bad weather, not 5 tall buildings blocking the view. I felt misled and cheated. I brought my 80 year old mother there to see Chicagos fireworks and instead saw nothing. The Swissotel really misled me. Instead of a future customer they have a disapointed former guest who will not be back. We spend alot of time in Chicago on weekend trips. It will never be at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Much to be desired ...”
Reviews.Author: dmb861
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Chicago from June 11th-14th for a long weekend to catch a play and a Cubs game. Had a great time in Chicago, but felt the Swissotel left much to be desired. The Pros: great location, great views (we woke up and fell asleep to views of the ferris wheel at Navy Pier each day), comfortable bed. The Cons: If you drive, do not park at the Swissotel â€“ it is $50.00/day. Park at the East Monroe garage at Millenium Park, it is a 5 minute walk and $23.00/day. The Swissotel also charges $9.95/day for internet access. Not wireless internet, wired internet. Seems if the motel in the â€˜burbs can offer free wi-fi the Swissotel can. The worst part was our room â€“ it smelled terribly of smoke. I spoke with the front desk upon check-in to determine how long the hotel had been smoke free, the young lady who admitted she was new said she did not know and found the answer from a colleague. Turns out it had only been a year but it smelled as though it may have only been a week. The woman on the phone said she would send someone up to check it out and no one showed. We waited 2 hours while getting ready and ended up leaving without a follow up from the hotel. After some talking with my wife she reminded me the room was for sleeping and we would not be there for extended periods of time while awake. This is true, but it should not smell like a bar each time I return to the hotel. We were 2 rooms away from the elevators but could hear them clearly. The thermostat seemed broken - the fan would not stay on for periods longer than 10 minutes no matter how high or low you set the temperature. Other Cons: The HD TV is nice, HD channels would be too. The shower leaked everywhere in the bathroom, I needed my towel from the day before. The iron left black streaks on my white shirt â€“ fortunately I always iron shirts inside out. The elevators are also very very slow.

Reviews.Title: “A No-Service Operation”
Reviews.Author: carwat
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Swissotel in Chicago for a daughter's graduation. I've stayed in other Swissotels and assumed that this one would be of the same level. I was wrong. The normal and expected amenities such as robes, magnifying mirrors, a morning newspaper and decent toiletries were all missing. Instead we were offered a rude and incompetant staff, amateur and slow valet, over-priced internet, garage and fitness room access charges and an inept business office. Don't think we'll be staying at a Swissotel ever again! The "nickel and diming" business is bad enough in a top tier hotel but this Swissotel feels more like a $350/night Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ljsamson
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel at the mouth of the Chicago river and Lake Michigan. Building is shaped like a triangle and only has about 17 rooms on a floor, so very quiet and no hall noise. Service was excellent (when you called the front desk they addressed you by your name) and housing came as soon as asked. Room was larger than standard, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a tub and separate shower enclosure. Close to the center of the city and an easy walk to the loop, Michigan Avenue and Grant park and the museums. Booked our stay through hotwire and saved about 50% off the rack rate on a weekend when there was a conference with 15,000 MD's in the city center. Only peeve was we were told at check-in that the pool/health club was an extra $15/day per person, and while I like to swim and workout, there is enough to see and do in chicago that I didn't miss it. Also valet parking is $50 a day and you don't need a car if you are there

Reviews.Title: “Suite View!”
Reviews.Author: city44
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel has everything going for it and should be ranked higher. LOCATION Perfect. Itâ€™s right by the Chicago River and itâ€™s proximity to Lake Shore Drive, makes for a quicker cab ride to the Airport or north to Wrigley Field. There are few buildings between the Swissotel and Lake Michigan, making for gorgeous views, yet you are in the heart of it all. The Michigan Avenue bridge is only two blocks away. Grant Park and Navy Pier are also a short walk. ROOMS If you can swing it, get a corner suite. Because the building is a triangular shape, you get a sweeping view that is absolutely stunning. A lot of windows, but nice light-tight drapes for a good nite sleep. Tasteful modern decor and roomy. The bathroom and bedroom are separated by a good distance. The beds are heavenly. VIEWS From a corner suite, you can see the Navy Pier, Millenium Fountainâ€™s hourly water arch across the Chicago River, Lake Michigan & the Harbor, Buckingham Fountain and part of Millenium Park. We were lucky enough to see the 9:30pm fireworks show from our window that are set from Navy Pier on the weekend. STAFF Has that midwestern charm. The bell hops and front desk personnel are very helpful and friendly. I did not hear a peep out of housekeeping who were respectful. MISC. Every third floor has an ice machine. The 9th and 12th Floors for example have ice. The location of the machine is in an isolated room, Iâ€™m assuming to drown out the noise. It was a little creepy at night. Guys wonâ€™t care, women may feel a little ill at ease, but could certainly call room service. The staff is quite accommodating. In the lobby the hotel offers complimentary water, which may not sound like much, but the ice cold jugs have freshly cut fruit in them such as melon or strawberries. The restaurant in the hotel is â€œThe Palmâ€� which has several locations nationwide and serves up a good steak. If you take a river architecture cruise, the guides will point out the Swissotel as one of architect Harry Weeseâ€™s triangle obsessed marvels. I was very impressed with this hotel and its staff. Iâ€™m looking forward to more visits in the future and I highly recommend the Swissotel to anyone traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, clean hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: edandhy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in late April 2009. I liked the view from the hotel (river view from the room, but a fabulous lake view from the elevator area). The hotel is shaped like a triangle from the sky, and this strange shape combined with the location of the elevator shafts made many rooms quite noisy. One of my colleagues had to ask to get his room moved at 2 am due to the noise of moving elevators. The beds were comfortable, and I liked having iHome to plug my ipod. While the LCD TV was nice, free channels did not contain any HD broadcast, and we all know how painful it is to watch SD broadcaston a HDTV. They also charge to use the fitness center, which seems quite outrageous. I also paid for the wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional View and Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: AdvisoryBusiness
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently, due to business travel. They have demonstrated a wonderful ability to deliver consistent service and go above and beyond. The views are remarkable! The management is amazing and looks to make any/all accommodations and truly create a 'home away from home'. Also, enjoy their in room amenities, workout room, pool, and lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, nice location, one of our best stays in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Claven123
Reviews.Content: We booked this via travelzoo and got an amazing rate. We came to Chicago for my graduation. The view from the pool area is to die for, almost 180 degrees of the city from the 42 floor. The view from the rooms is of the river and city, Lake Michigan or of Millennium Park. The rooms were great, the staff was excellent. The gentleman who was the doorman is very much in charge and does an awesome job. I only had one minor complaint and that was the hot tub was not working and was out of order. Normally I would not say anything about this, but here you have to pay extra to us the pool, and work out area. I donâ€™t think it would be easy to walk to Navy Pier, but it could be done. Very close to everything, or the front staff will hail a cab for you.

Reviews.Title: “I think they're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Capfan
Reviews.Content: For a four or five star hotel, was not overly impressed. Room had coffee but no coffee machine...phone call fixed that. Shower leaked at the base like the Lincoln tunnel and followed the hose on the way down...shooting out the side of the bathtub onto the floor...lot of rejigging after learning the lesson of not putting clothes on the floor. Inner shower was yicky yellow vinyl thing and was hard to close as the rings that supported it were too small for pole. Most frustrating thing was replenishing of supplies. Shampoo(actually nothing was labelled shampoo, only body-wash) was only changed when completely emptied. Creamer/sugar for coffee was only changed when both had been used. Towels were left hanging in washroom after they had been used. Add to this expensive internet ($10 a day) outrageous parking rates (we didn't use..$50 a day) and there isn't a lot that will draw me back. Great location, but everything is expensive and " a la carte" including pool, fitness. For me, if you're going to gouge me for things that are free at most places, it's unlikely I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mom2twns06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came up for the weekend and had a great time. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and the staff was wonderful. The room was nice and clean as well and we will definetly return if the price is right (88.00 on hotwire.com). The only complaint I would have is that the room walls were not very insulated and we could hear the overly loud people in the room next door. However I called the front desk to complain and they sent security right up and we didn't hear anything the rest of the night. This is close to many of the great attractions and was within walking distance of everything. Great views to boot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice refurbishment but bring your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: thewaterbabe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Swissotel for several years whilst on business in Chicago - staying there on average 3 to 4 times a year. The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping and local bars/restaurants on the golden mile, and views from most rooms very good. The hotel has recently undergone a refurbishment to both bedrooms and lobby area. The bedrooms have been modernised and feature a large flat-screen tv, however I couldn't get mine to work....it turned out the wrong remote had been supplied!! This problem was subsequently rectified and the remote replaced. Ordering soup on room service will set you back around $20 +, with the tray charge, service charge and taxes making up the bulk of it. With the refurbishment of the lobby, the hotel have done away with the lobby gift shop. As I arrived very late in the evening after a long journey, I was tempted by the mini-bar and had a chocolate bar (snickers) which came to $5.22!!! For the location and comfort of the new rooms, this is the perfect hotel, however come armed with your credit card as they appear to be funding the refurbishment through room service and mini bar charges, not to mention the room rates.....

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: DaveK55ars
Reviews.Content: We found a promotional deal so our rate was fantastic. The location and the room were perfect for my wife and I. Some nice extras and the staff was very professional and most helpful. Great pool and gym, though it was extra, because of our rate I assume. Great views to the river and the lake. Can't comment on the restaurants, but there is plenty within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and competent”
Reviews.Author: Floridafree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for the first time Apr 20 â€“ 22 to attend the Tripp Lite conference in Chicago, along with 2 of my customers from Florida. The several staff folks with whom I interacted were all lovely, including day & night front desk, concierge, doorman, bartenders and restaurant servers. They each deserve extra points for expressing the old-fashioned courtesy â€œItâ€™s my pleasureâ€� instead of the ever-popular & somewhat puzzling â€œNo problemâ€�. We appreciated the elegant service and manner of the staff. Just a few examples: The deskman went out of his way to change the effective date on a courtesy breakfast voucher to accommodate my agenda. Instead of directing me to an "office room" where I could print my boading pass, the concerierge executed the process with a flouish within 60 seconds, expressing pleasure for being able to do so. Where other hotel staff have sometimes acted "put out" for being asked to board our luggage after checkout while we amused ourselves until flight time, Swissotel staff were charming and kind about taking it off our hands. Excellent experience. I recommend Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with rooms and view!”
Reviews.Author: thmai
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were amazed by the breathtaking view of Lake Michigan! We are from Texas so the view of the city was very important to us. We had no problems at this hotel... rooms, service, location were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago is the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: wheatie52
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Chicago for business and theSwissotel is my favorite place to stay. It is within walking distance from most of the major attractions and shopping in Chicago. The staff is always cheerful and helpful upon arrival and during my stay. They respond quickly to any questions or requests. They have just recently upgraded the hotel rooms and they are wonderful.
