They have incredible views of the lake and the river. It is especially wonderful to be there on an evening when they do fireworks on the lake and you can enjoy them from your room. The rooms are bright and airy with wonderful beds and bedding. The health club has also been newly upgraded. I would recommend this hotel highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, accomodations and people”
Reviews.Author: Gators80
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is little different than the standard big name chain hotels! You will find the Swiss in Chicago a friendly place with great views of Navy Pier, Lake Michigan and the city. The staff is more than accomadating and will take care of any need you might have. When visiting Chicago give the Swiss a chance to take care of you and they will!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: doshisha
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, except for one thing: I came back with 30 bed bug bites on my left leg. Stayed in room 1601 (I think -- might have been 1602), in April 2009. I have no idea if the problem extends beyond one room or not. But be careful in any case -- bed bugs are a growing problem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Porkchop107
Reviews.Content: Very pretty rooms with an European flair. We had a great view of the river, and could walk to everything. We said 'wow' when we opened up the curtains. The prices in the restaurant were extremely high however.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful lake views, clean, classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: capsichilli
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 5-10 minute walk from the Magnificent Mile and offered superb lake views. We stayed in a standard room which was clean and well-stocked. The concierge was very helpful and directed us to all the tourist sites we wanted to visit. We were able to get a good deal on the hotel so it was worth the money but if we had to pay full price, we would have wanted to stay somewhere closer to the Magnificent Mile as Chicago winters can be bitterly cold as we witnessed firsthand!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views; Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: lucychitown
Reviews.Content: Planned a girls weekend at Swissotel, Chicago. Could not have been more perfect! Great views, location, top notch service. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Would go back for another girls weekend, romantic getaway or with the kids--can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: JessGrace
Reviews.Content: We were able to get an excellent rate for this hotel, only $95 per night through a winter promotion, which was well worth it. One thing that really impressed us was the excellent housekeeping service. We stayed 3 nights and each day they cleaned our room they went above and beyond anything we had previously experienced: lining up our shoes, hanging all our coats, & more. Room was very nice, updated and modern with artwork from Chicago and a great view. Only thing that I would like to see changed is the elimination of the $15 per night fee to use the spa and fitness center, as I feel this should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: saturncmc
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and although it was a business trip, I had some time to walk around. The hotel was terrific. I had a room on the 28th floor with a spectacular view of the lake and the navy pier. It was even prettier at night when it was lit up. The bed was a king size and very comfortable. The flat screen TV and coffee maker were great too. The bathroom was very modern with a glass enclosed shower seperate from the tub. The location of this hotel was good because Michigan Ave was a shor t walking distance away and there are great shops and restaurants there. We had dinner on the top (95th floor) of the John Hancock building in the Signature Room. The food was delicious and the view was fabulous. I would definitely go back to Chicago to spend some time on my own. I understand they have great Italian restaurants and many great pizzerias.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotels are not fancy”
Reviews.Author: tedselker
Reviews.Content: Why is it that a $69 motel serves free breakfasts, turns on the TV when you push power on the remote and has free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “The Bed saved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: beansinc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Travelzoo.com for a great rate, 109.00 total. I always research reviews on TripAdvisor before I book and overall the ratings for this hotel were wonderful. Therefore, I was quite confident about the quality of the hotel when I decided to book. When we finally arrived there was only two people checking in guests. When we finally got to the room, although clean, nothing worked e.g. telephone, coffee maker or television. The housekeeper left the wrong television remote and we had to call from the bathroom to send up a new one. When we showered (didn't use the bathtub because it was quite dirty looking) the water leaked onto the floor near the toliet were my husband slipped an nearly broke his face!! Overall the stay was not what I expected. Also, the cost of parking was outrageous and they charge you for opening/storing items in the refridgerator. However, the bed, WAS AMAZING!!! Very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Review”
Reviews.Author: Safariman_62
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Swissotel. Very nice hotel in nice area of Chicago. It is handy if sightseeing the Navy Pier, Soldier Field, Shedd Aquarium, etc. My room was very clean, very comfortable, awesome view, bed was terrific. 32" flat screen tv, totally awesome!! Things you need to know are as such. Mini bar prices and all restaurants in hotel are very expensive. So if you are on a budget, go down the block a little ways and eat at Subway, Houlihans, etc. Parking is 49.00 a night, I parked nearby for 32.00 a day. Check in was not exactly fast, only 2 attendants. It was Saturday night, Feb 14th, Valentine's Day, I would have thought there would have been more people on front desk duty. The workout room was awesome, pool was nice, shower area was tremendous. This area of hotel could not have been better. The views around the hotel are wonderful, especially at night. I would definitely stay here anytime I would be in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: PaytonsMom
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for Valentines day. He was sweet enough to book the Romance in the City package. Beware if you book this. To start, he booked the package well in advance, and a couple of days before Valentines they raised the price. We checked in and got to our room, my husband noticed the champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were not in the room. So he called to the front desk and said we did not get the package because did not pay their new rate. My husband was smart enough to have a print out of what he paid for, stating it was the Romance in the City package. So the front desk apologized and said they would honor it. We did get the champagne and strawberries. We called at night to find out how to get the breakfast offer. The person at the front desk said for room service to fill out the menu or go to the Palm restaurant and they would bill it to our room. Well I called back to the frontdesk because we did not have a menu and no one answered, I called 3 times, and I know it was not busy because it was almost 3 in the morning. So my husband called back around 7:30 and they said we needed a voucher and mentioned nothing of room service, we did get the voucher and enjoyed a very good breakfast buffet in their 2nd restaurant, not the Palm like we were told When we were checking out we asked why we got charged for the pool when it states the package comes with it and it says in their books in the room that its free. The frontdesk agent said the policy changed as of January 2009. And the did not even offer to refund us. It was a beautiful room on the 25th floor and overall it was a very enjoyable and romantic weekend, the pool and fitness center was great and the views are amazing!! But if you book a package, beware!! They will rip you off!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View”
Reviews.Author: RoundThree
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice and quiet, gorgeous views, great location. If you get a lake view room, Navy Pier is lit up at night and fabulous. The view from the 42nd floor (health club/pool) is remarkable! First night I was there the internet would not work in my room, but the hotel engineer went out of his way to fix the problem, kept me updated on his progress, and when he found it could not be fixed, he made arrangements to get me moved into another room. He gets an excellent rating. Housekeeping on my floor gets a poor rating. Mine was an extended stay, and while the room was clean, I had to chase down the maid to get simple toiletries and coffee refills, every single day. When I finally called the front desk and complained, the week-end maid made sure everything got refilled, but when the weekday maid came back, it was the same thing all over again. Melted soap left in the shower and not replaced, empty shampoo and conditioner bottles put back in the shower, and forget about getting any more body lotion from the weekday maid. Not sure why hotels don't seem to understand that their guests opinion of the hotel is influenced more by housekeeping services than it is by how ornate the lobby decor is. Two other things. Website advertises that hotel has a pool, but does not inform you they charge an extra $16.20/day just to use it. The hotel is connected underground to the Hyatt Regency, and these underground ped-ways will also take you to Michigan Ave. Very nice if you are staying in the winter, although the doors back into the Swissotel lock at 5:00 p.m. so you have to face that Lake Michigan wind at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great views!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea58
Reviews.Content: Spent the night for Valentine's day....loved the hotel, great room on 34th floor with an outstanding city/lake view. Lots of places to eat within walking distance. Small complaint--my husband didn't think the concierge was very friendly....although he did provide him with the information that he requested. We walked out the door at 6:30 p.m. and enjoyed the great firework display that Chicago is doing on Saturdays in February. Would love to go back when it is warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Humshee
Reviews.Content: Again I had the pleasure of staying at the Swissotel Chicago. Again, everything was perfect. Efficient & polite staff, exceptionally clean room. And that bed .... HEAVEN! It's worth staying there for the comfort of the bed alone. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “anytime again”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: a great hotel, we used the CTA the 2 days we were in Chicago and it is great, that the Line 6 stops nearly in front of the hotel. So we did not need any taxi and traveled from Midway to the city and to Ohare for 9$ and we used the buses alot (freezing cold). The hotel itself is great, very clean rooms, realy on of the best bathrooms i ever had. Staff very friendly, they even found me out were i can get Timerland shoes.... and she was right i got them in one place she told me... thats service...I also was having a look to the gym room and the swimming pool area, did not use it and I do not know if it would have been included in the room price....but realy a nice view makes running easyer....

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rosenberger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for a long weekend in early December and found an amazing deal at Swissotel, as part of their winter getaway specials. The hotel itself was excellent - a very comfortable lobby, incredibly helpful front desk personnel, and an amazing room. We were on the 35th story, looking toward Millennium Park, and we could see the Field Museum and Soldier's Field in the distance, as well as the edge of Lake Michigan (I believe this was called a "city view"). The room was immaculate, with an incredibly comfortable bed (with down comforter, of course, thanks to the European chain) and a beautiful remodeled bathroom. The location was nice- it was a very nice area and not in the middle of busy downtown, but only two blocks from Michigan Avenue. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago, especially if they are having another great discount.

Reviews.Title: “Very Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: evonut
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful and friendly staff, great location, fantastic view. The bathroom was drenched in marble (as one should expect), the towels were top notch, the robes were a pleasure to wear and the bed was extremely comfortable. HOWEVER...parking was $49 a night! This is ridiculously high for downtown Chicago. Though I live in Seattle now, I moved from Chicago just 8 months ago, so I know what parking should be for a day. $49 is about $20 too much. We parked about half a mile away and paid $25 a day. Additionally, if you wanted a refrigerator, they charged $50. A hotel of this caliber should simply provide the refrigerator at no additional cost. Beyond these two oddities, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: courtko2006
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and friendly staff! We had a great room on the 10th floor that had a view of the Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile; was perfect for the festival of lights parade and fireworks. Great location for shopping and dining; everything is in walking distance. The room was great and exceeded our expectations. VERY clean!! Separate shower and tub, hair dryer, iron and even robes. Valet parking was convenient and they charge $50 per 24 hours. We were told that valet was the only option however there are other parking garages close by, but we didn't want to have to tote our luggage a city block. Workout rooms were awesome...plenty of machines and a great view of the city. Pool was nice and the water was warm. Locker rooms were clean and had a sauna. Gift shop was even great. Very nice cashier and prices were quite inexpensive. Beware that the elevator line gets quite long during busy periods even though there are 6 lifts, but lines do move quickly.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fly747
Reviews.Content: Hotel 5 minutes walk from the start of the magnificent mile shopping street so a really good location. Our room, on the 35th floor, looked out onto the Lake and Navy pier.Rooms large with a huge flat screen T.V, big comfy bed, bath and a seperate shower cubicle in the bathroom with lots of towels, dressing gown,hair dryer, good supply of soap/shampoo etc.Coffee machine which was high tech,(it took a while to figure out how to use it) with individual coffee capsules (like an espresso machine).We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was a bit disappointing though, cold plates to put your hot breakfast on!!, staff very slow to offer coffee & clear tables, and the cream on our table was off so had to ask for replacement, but in a nice tranquil setting with a good selection of fruits, cereals, pastries. Room service was extortionate though, very very expensive, so we didnt bother, as food outlets a few minutes walk away.There is a gym, although i didn't use, but i think they charge for it too.Busy bar just off the lobby.I did have problems a couple of times with my keycard which wouldn't let me in the room, but hey, that can happen anywhere! Overall, lovely hotel, fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AcadiaGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel after finding an excellent fall rate on TravelZoo, and we're glad we did. The location is central to Millenium Park, Magnificent Mile, and the Loop, and has excellent views of the lake and Navy Pier. This is an excellent place to stay for travelers wishing to spend a lot of time walking around downtown Chicago and visiting the city. (You will need to walk a number of blocks to get to a subway station, but nothing unusual. Taxis also wait outside the hotel.) Our two double beds were very comfortable. Roomy bathroom with no cleanliness issues. Hotel staff were excellent in providing us assistance when needed. We were two young people visiting as tourists, and didn't get the snooty vibe that a few other reviewers say they experienced. I would definitely return -- in particular if we were offered the promotion again. Use caution when attempting to email the hotel -- the web form didn't work and when I emailed the manager after the stay to let him know, I never heard back. The constant threat of additional fees (the minibar, which use automatic sensors to charge when something's been removed; Internet; health club; parking; $24 for continental breakfast; etc.) could also be improved, but we didn't find any undue charges on our bill. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. We also appreciated the relatively late check-out time (noon).

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: marmtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old son and I stayed here while visiting family in Chicago, and it got rave reviews from all. Comfy beds, amazing view (even in our budget priced room, we saw the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue), and nice in-room amenities made the visit. We loved the Keurig coffeemaker, the iPod dock, the easily-accessible jack to plug in our DVD player, the sparkly clean bedding, the plush robes. Another nice amenity for us the kids' table for young ones to wait while parents check in. Great staff -we needed extra towels one morning and someone arrived within 5 minutes. There was a great pool that we didn't even get to enjoy. Maybe next time. It's convenient to museums, shopping, and great restaurants. We enjoyed West Egg Cafe on Fairbanks for two breakfasts and recommend that as well. All in all, highly recommended and much enjoyed. Special thanks to the Trip Advisor members who recommended the on street parking (just east of the hotel, and free overnight), and Bockwinkels grocery store on Columbus for snacks and drinks. We got a tremendous rate from TravelZoo, which made it all the better. Valet parking is a breathtaking $49 a night but we managed to avoid that with the street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: dubsyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellently located to Magnificent Mile (5 mins walk), Navy Pier & Theatre district (15 mins walk). Rooms are good quality and clean, what you would expect from a four star business hotel. Gym is very well equipped (for a fee). Front Desk Staff were shockingly bad. Very unwelcoming and seemed like they did not want to be there. Concierge staff were snooty and were not very helpful. We were overcharged by $27 on a couple club sandwiches and drinks we ordered from room service. I would only stay at this hotel again if the room rate was really low.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking - Breautiful - Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MoKanTraveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a great experience. The rooms are large, the view was wonderful overlooking Navy Pier. The bar had great drink selections, but was very expensive. Same for the restaurant onsite. There were nearby restaurants you could go to to save some money. The bedding & bath towels were wonderful. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever been in. The talking elevator was fun (a womans voice called out the floor numbers). The staff was very friendly. The room was very quiet, making it very easy to sleep. No meals were included. The pool was free to use, however the exercise room did have a fee. There were plenty of towels available for use at the pool. You could always find a taxi - they would wait outside the hotel ready for you! I would recommend this as a perfect location - inbetween great hot spots with a wonderful view and a very luxious feel.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act!!”
Reviews.Author: Trainiac
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Swiss. The staff was helpful and very polite and friendly. The room was great with a beautiful view of the lake and Navy Pier. Our train back to N.Y. was canceled due to flooding of tracks so we called the hotel from Union station and they gave us a room at a discounted price. I would book Swiss again and highly recommend it. Class act!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: Lainba
Reviews.Content: Despite having a prepaid reservation, when I arrived with my 3 young children at the hotel at night, I was informed that the hotel was oversold and that we would be accomodated in a Hospitality Suite. Basically, this was a meeting room with rollaway beds and a bathroom. the next day we were upgraded to a suite. The suite had beautiful views but a broken light bulb with dangerous glass sticking out, and a fold out bed that literally sagged so much it touched the floor! I was sent an apology letter by the assistant manager, asking that I contact him in case of any problems, I left messages for him and the other manager to no avail. The day I checked out, it took them 45 minutes to locate where they had stored our luggage. Yvonne the concierge is a true professional and the highlight of the hotel. The rest of the staff are slow, and unresponisive. The rooms are very nice , the location is excellent, but the service is Terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Classiest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: starbright31
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for a really sweet deal that was running towards July-August- I would've been staying in a hostel during Lollapalooza weekend, constantly worrying if my stuff was gonna get jacked. This hotel is top-notch, probably the classiest hotel I've ever stayed in. There was a bit of construction going on in the front of the hotel, but it didn't detract from how nice it looked inside. The staff was very pleasant and easy to talk to for any questions. The rooms are spacious and pristine with pillow-top beds that made it almost impossible to get up in the morning because it was so comfortable. The bathroom was big too and I liked the separate shower and tub. I also had a gorgeous view of the city from my window. There's a Palm Restaurant that's in the first floor lobby that's excellent there. They had fantastic service there- pricey, but so worth it. It's not too far to walk to other restaurants nearby if you don't feel like having steak. I'd say the only downside of this hotel is the lack of free wi-fi. And the gym and pool closes too early. If I'm lucky enough to be in Chicago again and find an excellent price to stay here, I'll gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but beware of all of the Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: e-lolly
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went on a last minute trip to Chicago and stayed at the Swissotel. Our room was average and clean, we did have a view of the lake. What was a little surprising was everything was an extra charge. To use the gym or pool was a $15 a day charge, to print our boarding passes was a $6 dollar charge and internet service was a $9 a day charge. We did borrow the umbrella that the hotel leaves in the room for guests to use, and returned it, yet I was charged $20 for the umbrella, which I am still disputing with the hotel. Our room never got cool, we called down to the front desk twice to have our room checked, no one ever came. The concierge was Swiss and had a very difficult time understanding that I wanted directions to a bakery that sold cupcakes, it was like a ridiculous game of charades. Our vacation was wonderful our accommodations where less than wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: ruth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms on the 22 floor in August with our two teenage daughters.The view from the rooms was fantastic, My daughters are allergic to feathers and all trace of them were removed from the room as soon as we advised housekeeping.The rooms were spotlessly clean and serviced each day. We purchased a 7day travel card from the cultural center and used them to hop on and off the buses.The number 6 bus stopped right outside the Hotel and we were soon taking it just a few blocks after a long day, much to the amusement of the drivers. The Hotel is located in the middle between Magnificent mile and Grant park making it an ideal location. Breakfast every day was taken everyday at the corner bakery a 5 minute walk away. We did not want to leave but when it was time to go the Hotel arranged a large SUV to take us and our many purchases to the airport. This Hotel was really good and we hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, BUT”
Reviews.Author: dsj5777
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire. Overall the location, the room size and comfort were above average. The bed was not as comfortable as the Milwaukee Hilton we stayed with 2 weeks prior . So why the neutral? (1) Long lines several times to check in and (2) to go up elevator - maintenance issue (note we had a major maintenance issue last stay here - elevators didnt work for several hours). Additionally (3) shower pressure lacking, (4) double charged on internet and not refunded - a fairly confusing log in screen, and (5) nickle and diming with parking/bell hops/etc. The last item - why is it that the expensive hotels charge for internet and I can go to some cheap motel and get it for free?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Quiltmaker10
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband to a Leadership Symposium August 25th through August 28th. Our room with a luxurious kingsized bed was on the 30th floor and had a great city view. From our room we saw glimpses of sailboats on Lake Michigan between the buildings. At the end of our hallway we looked down on the river and could watch the tour boats and see Navy Pier in the distance. That first night we walked down to Navy Pier and when we got back to our room and sank into the bed, I quipped to my husband that I just might spend the rest of our stay in bed...it was so comfortable! While he was in meetings for the next three days, I walked to the Art Institute of Chicago and also walked up and down the Magnificent Mile. I felt completely safe and enjoyed the energy of the city sights and sounds. I brought what I thought was good footwear but had to buy some walking shoes on the third day. My thanks to others who reviewed this hotel as I studied their advice and found inexpensive places to eat...the Corner Bakery and Cafe being one of them. I enjoyed exploring the Pedway that connects to this hotel and found spots for breakfast and lunch. The second night my husband and I walked to Gino's for deep dish pizza...yummy. Our final night we took an architectural river tour with Wendella boats whose dock was a short walk away. I have no complaints about Swissotel...thanks to other reviewers, I knew not to open the refrigerator. There is a gift shop where you can buy cold drinks and snacks. Housekeeping did not come until after our second night but that was because I took a nap and didn't want to be disturbed. They came the next day as I was returning from my long walk and everything was spotless. Every member of the staff was courteous and helpful. If you ask, the concierge will give you a great brochure with a very helpful map of the area. I would love, love, love to stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “what a deal and what a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: flizzer
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fab stay from the chilled fruited water in the lobby, to the great views, incredible bed, huge well appointed area, and great location!! I had a view of the lake and the surrounding buildings....i could see all the way to the museaum!!The pool/health club area is free and also boasts incredible views. The cozy robes were an elegant touch. Surrounded by construction but i didn't hear a thing....the lobby was quite noisy in the am so maybe request a high room if you worry about that. It truely is "where the river meets the lake" ...and for 109 a nite i was in awe!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location great views bad ac”
Reviews.Author: Karen012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the clerk upgraded our room to the 39th floor with an amazing view. The room itself was fine the beds comfortable. The pool was very nice and that view incredible.Talking with some folks at the pool they concurred that the concierge was snotty. He was a younger man who seemed very inconvenienced but my questions. Our problem with the hotel was the ac. I called twice and they finally sent someone up who said he could not find a problem but adjusted the vents. When we got back to room that night still warm. We called and no one ever showed up and too tired to wait plus it was the last night. It was a great location to the park and the view was awesome especially during the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose this hotel again, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SPayneRochester
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in August, an amazing deal through Travelzoo (talked to others at this hotel that booked at the "employee" rate, and we got it for less). Check in was smooth, I arrived in Chicago early in the day and called to see about early check in, no problems, was given a room immediately upon arrival. The room was spacious, incredibly clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The mini bar was well stocked, but pricey. Maid service was excellent. The seperate shower/bathtub was a nice touch, however the toilet was loose and wiggly, and didn't flush well. The only thing I would change about the room is that there is no mirror above or near the dressing table, which makes it hard for two or more people to share a mirror/electrical outlets in one bathroom. Easy walk to Michigan Ave, River Walk, great views of Navy Pier. The only employee who didn't impress me was the woman working in the gift shop. Long story short, she was rude and inattentive. We didn't have a chance to enjoy any of the lounges or restaurants, but they looked well attended. Bell Service was helpful in arranging a van cab to take us to the airport. I will be visiting Chicago frequently this coming year, and will most definately book this hotel again if they offer the same rate. We took the advice of others on tripadvisor, and signed up for their Swiss Club Gold Card in order to use the pool at no charge. However, when we went to the pool, we were never asked to show a card, so I'm not sure who was being charged? The hot tub was hot the first night, lukewarm the second, and people were actually teaching their children how to swim in the hot tub, not very relaxing getting splashed over and over, and actually quite rude, but not the hotels fault at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanPeters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for two nights. Our lakeview room on the 22nd floor had a wonderful view and was very clean and most comfortable. We thought the location was very convenient as we like to walk and we were just a block away from both the boat and trolley tours. No problem with check-in or out, and the staff was most accomodating. A fine hotel and Chicago is a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: TripseekerTO
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first trip to Chicago. I also found the great deal on Travelzoo.com and paid a little extra for the "corner room". Check in - perfect, attentive and helpful. Maid service, perfect no complaints. Room, lots of space not cramped at all. Ipod docking station was a great addition, LCD TV was great. Concierge's at the Swissotel were AMAZING...they looked after sporting tickets for me, made great recommendations and all in all did a great job!! Thanks Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Pelle311
Reviews.Content: I visit Chicago on an annual basis and have for many years -- going back to the 1980s. Through Travelzoo.com, I became aware of a discounted room rate and jumped at the offer of about $150 night including taxes. This year, for the second consecutive year, I attended the Air and Water Show. Newspaper accounts say that over three million people visited that weekend. The Blue Angels were terrific. The wait to check in was long. There were two people working behind the reservation desk late morning. After about 15-to-20 minutes in line, I was told my reservation was not on file. I then gave the confirmation number and hotel print out to the person at the front desk and after a few more minutes, I was finally checked in. A minor inconvenience but I sensed another person was having a similar experience based on conversation to which I overheard. The room was exceptional. It was bright and appealing. The room was also promptly cleaned. Great view including part of Lake Michigan. There are new high-rises and the like being built all around Chicago and one near the Swissotel. I awoke one morning to an inspiring sunrise, a red/orange ball that was sparkling. The bed was one of the best I have encountered in any hotel. The comforter was incredibly soft while the bed and the mattress pad were ideal. The room had plenty of space, certainly bigger than other hotels I have visited in recent years. My room had an LG 37-inch LCD TV that was fantastic. I'm not much of a TV viewer but I did catch some of the 2008 Olympic events at odd hours and the clarity of images displayed were exceptional. I stayed on the 35th floor and still the elevators were quick if not immediate. I visited the pool area briefly, but didn't stay since the weather was close to perfect during my stay and opted to see the city as often as possible. My opinion on the location is neutral. If you have a vehicle, this hotel is exceptional because it is somewhat removed from Michigan Ave and the usual congestion associated with hotels on (or just off) major streets. This hotel is located on Wacker off Michigan and the isolation has its benefits but as an avid walker, I prefer a stay around the John Hancock Building. The Hyatt was within steps of the Swissotel and what looked like an office building in between the two major hotel properties. Steps away, is a Houlihans bar/restaurant with outdoor seating. Additionally, there seemed to be an increase of homeless people near the area, though not in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. In fact, on consecutive nights I had the same woman follow me for about a dozen or so steps. This was after midnight on each occasion. A friend, who stayed at the nearby Hard Rock Hotel, had somewhat similar experiences. About a 3-to-5 minute walk away is a Giordano's Restaurant -- famous for deep dish pizza. It was perfect for late night dining. The lobby of the hotel was cozy and as a pleasant touch there were two glass dispensers offering a mix of ice water and diced fresh fruit added for flavor. A Palm Restaurant is located in the lobby, too. Late at night, there was a bowl of fruit near the reservation desk. A daily Wall Street Journal was dropped at the door of each guest's room, another nice touch. There was also a handful of copies of the Chicago Tribune adjacent to the reservation desk. I would stay here again and certainly for the price offered. The weather was ideal, the hotel peaceful and the positives far outweighed the few negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: MsMissislippi
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Chicago and my 2nd stay at Swissotel. I found an excellent deal through travelzoo.com and booked immediatelly paying the extra fee for the lakeview. The check-in was very smooth and the rep was very attentive. We were on the 33rd floor with a gorgeous view of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. The rooms are very nice, well-appointed, with comfortable beds. Housekeeping did a good job. The only caution is to consider the distance from the Metros. It's a bit of a walk, but not too bad if you're forewarned. The buses are very convenient and run to Michigan which can link you to anywhere. When we travel we really don't spend much time in the room or the hotel, so I can't judge every aspect, but I definitely would stay at Swissotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SMFToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in a great location. Chilled water at the entrance is a great touch. Have stayed here before, and would gladly do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Great location”
Reviews.Author: northendmoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were large and clean. The beds were unbelievably comfortable with nice linens. The bathroom was large, clean, up to date, and loaded with soft towels. And it's worth mentioning that the hotel had real, high-powered hair dryers -- not those terrible wall-mounted ones that you see in other hotels (I'm a women with thick long hair so I care about things like that). The view from my room was great. It looked out over the river. The staff was very accommodating, which you'd expect in a 4-star hotel. It was the fastest check-in I've ever experienced. Also, the concierge had great recommendations. The lounge/bar was expensive but very nice. They had a great wine list, appetizers, and friendly service. The location is fantastic. It's a very short walk to the Magnificent Mile, plenty of restaurants, the Navy Pier, the train, and there is a cab stand right in front and a Dunkin Donuts next door. A cab from Midway Airport was $35. A cab from Wrigley was $13. My only complaint about the hotel is that the mini bar has a weight sensor. So if you move around bottles in the fridge so that you can store your own food/personal items, the sensor will send a signal to the hotel and you will be charged. Or that's at least what the front desk told me. Considering how much this hotel costs, it would be nice if they provided you with a fridge large enough to store your own items in it. Through hotwire, I paid $200 per night for Thursday-Sunday. It was a great deal. I get the impression that normally it is much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: swisspix
Reviews.Content: We felt welcome from the very start with the friendly personnel and concierge. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and spacious and up-to-date. The sheets on the bed are a higher thread count and it was so inviting with the pillowtop mattress cover, yet was very supportive. The bathroom was also spacious with a separate shower and bathtub. Our room faced Lake Michigan which had views of the Navy Pier and also part of the river--wonderful! The pool and fitness club are on the 42nd floor with big windows so the view is spectacular from there. We had a tiny hiccup at first--our room wasn't getting very cool despite putting the thermostat to 60F so I contacted guest services and they sent an engineer straightaway while we were sightseeing for the day. When we came back the room was very cool. It just seemed that the vent needed to be adjusted. The location is convenient to the Magnificent Mile shopping, Navy Pier, Millennium Park and also the Loop and the Theater District. Public transportation is very handy from here as well. I would highly recommend the Swissotel Chicago to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ematl
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Swissotel with my fiance, from July 3 to July 8. Booked a package through Priceline, and would stay there again in a heartbeat. ROOM The king-sized bed was very comfortable, and all of the linens were fresh and clean. The room was spacious, not cramped at all. The bathroom was spotless--no mildew, no stains, and nicely appointed with little soaps and the usual toiletries. They were replenished daily. We didn't get a full lake view (didn't pay or ask for one, either), but the view was still nice, and we saw a lot of fireworks from our window. I should mention that, despite the obvious construction in the area, we were not disturbed by any drilling or other noises. Left the room at 10:30 or 11 a.m. every day, but did not hear noise. LOCATION The hotel was central to everything we wanted to see. Navy Pier is extremely close, Michigan Avenue is just a short walk away, and it's just a few blocks to the "EL" Red Line Station. Cabs also line the street in front of the hotel, so there's no delay in catching a ride. I felt very safe walking the area at night, as there were a lot of other people and tourists. I did see a few homeless people, but that's to be expected in any city. Police presence was high, especially at the Taste of Chicago and Navy Pier. SERVICE Everyone was efficient, no big lines for check-in or check-out. People smiled and said hello. At one point, our room key became deactivated, but that was quickly fixed. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room and bathroom spotless. VALUE The room exceeded our expectations, especially because we received a discounted rate. I imagine if I'd paid full price, I wouldn't be too happy about the $9.99 fee for 24 hours of dial-up internet, but that's becoming the norm at most hotels. Also, they charge exorbitant prices for mini-bar items and room service meals, so be prepared for that. ($6 bottled water) We purchased our water from the Walgreens down the street. Did not eat at the hotel restaurant, so I cannot vouch for that either way. BOTTOM LINE Great place to stay. Clean and comfortable with friendly service and a convenient Chicago location. I highly recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: summerrhi
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on Travelzoo for $109 a night... almost too good to be true. This hotel was awesome! Amazing views, great location and the most comfortable bed ever! If you can get the same deal, I definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms in similar hotels would usually be about $250-300.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility and Location - So-So Staff”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Swissotels before so was expecting excellent facilities in top-notch shape and very clean. I got exactly that. A beautifully decorated, well-equipped and stylish room. It does suffer, however, from a trend that I have been noticing that as rooms at business class hotels are upgraded - particularly with a patch panel for the big LCD-TV - drawer space becomes less and less. As someone who actually likes to unpack if I am staying more than one night, it has become a problem. I end up using the nightstand drawers. The V.I.K. (Very Important Kids) check-in desk next to the front desk leads me to believe that the hotel is family-friendly. The location is great - near Michigan Avenue and with a view of the lake, but just far enough from Michigan to feel like you're away from the hub of activity. My one issue was with the staff. The front desk staff were friendly and relatively efficient but utterly lacked any warmth (both check-in and check-out). Without meaning to stereotype, they were both European and I don't know if that had anything to do with it. The doorman was another story. He seemed friendly enough and appeared to be a local. I arrived late and just wanted a light meal. He suggested The Palm in the hotel lobby but I told him I wanted something lighter and more casual. He then suggested Houlihans. Now I don't mean to sound like a snob, but when you're in one of the great cities in the world, staying at what is supposed to be a high-end hotel, to have the doorman recommend Houlihans is like asking what is a good car to buy and being told to consider a Yugo. Meeting facilities were well-equipped , and the banquet department did an excellent job of catering the meals and snacks (both quality of food and service) for the meetings I was attending. Didn't get to the gym or pool. There's a fee for the gym, but not the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago for "The Taste". Hotel was beautiful. Staff was very accomodating. If you are going to stay here, be sure and get their points membership before you go. When you arrive, ask for an upgrade. They will ask for your card. I had my number put on my reservation so I didn't take my card. We were upgraded to a corner room that overlooked the river, Navy Pier and the Lake. We didn't have to leave our room for the fireworks as we could see them perfectly from our room.The bed was so so comfortable and the room was very clean. I always tip housekeeping and the staff never disappointed. The only complaint I had about the room was the shower was very very small. I could hardly turnaround in it. I will say, if you are not a walker and want to be on Michigan Ave then I wouldn't stay here. This hotel is 3 Chicago blocks (which are longer that regular blocks) from Michigan Ave. Then you have to walk Michigan for a long time to see it all. I would use the CTA if you want to stay here and do Michigan Ave.Go to Michigan and pay even more for your hotel. Right now the Swissotel is running a summer special. Our room was only $129/night. It was worth it to me to save money and walk. Besides I had already done the Michigan Ave thing! If you are into public transportation. From Midway airport, take the orange line to State and Lake. You are appoximately 4 or 5 blocks from the hotel. As far as CTA, the #6 bus stops accross the street from the hotel and goes South on Michigan. Also, if you plan on using public transportation, get the visitors pass. You can get a 3 day pass for only $12 and it gives you unlimited train and buss access. You will need to transfer to get over to State street where the "real" shopping goes on (i.e.: Macy's, Filenes Basement, etc). I would recommend the "West Egg" fro breakfast (3 blocks off Michigan on Ontario) and for lunch or dinner The Grand Lux Cafe (corner of Michigan and Ontario). Also don't forget to go the "The River North" for great food. Check out the Blue Water Grill for dinner. Pricey, but very good. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I come to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel...front desk staff need customer service 101”
Reviews.Author: bellamom6
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Swissotel on June 30, 2008 without any issues. We were upgraded (with our Swiss Club Gold, get online for free use of gym/ pool otherwise $50 charge) to a corner room. We had a great view of Navy Pier and the Taste of Chicago. The front desk staff was never very helpful when we had any requests for simple things. When does the shuttle leave for O'hare? How much is the shuttle? Why is the cleaning staff telling us they are out of coffee for the rooms? Can we borrow a screwdriver to fix our daughter's Gameboy? All of these were answered by blank stares and major confusion. On July 4th, we were checking out. I needed to print out our boarding passes. The business center was closed due to the holiday. I went to the front desk to ask to have 5 minutes of access to the "Executive Level" business center to print our passes. At this point the only place open with internet access. I was told "no, it is an access only room". Huh? I explained what was going on and they could charge us whatever, we needed to print these passes. So the hunt for the key to the business office began. Now most normal people would have saved the hassle and sent us up to the Executive Floor. After 20 mins of not finding anyone with a key, guess where I ended up...the Executive Floor to print our boarding passes, totally silly. Just not a great overall feel from the front desk or the concierge. The rooms were nice, clean and updated. The beds super comfortable. BE ADVISED!!! There is major construction going on right behind the hotel at the new development AQUA. Non-stop from sun up to sun down. Drilling, pounding, ect. Did not bother us as we were pretty far away. We could really only hear in our bathroom and in lobby of hotel. However, we were never advised of this. Several other hotels also have major construction going on around them, so not a huge deal, no dust, which would have been a bummer. Overall, our room was super cheap on Expedia. Would we stay again, if we could get the same rate. Would I pay over $199 a night, most likely not. You can get better customer service elsewhere for much less. If you dont mind the attitude of dealing with a rude staff, go for it. Location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “The Swisshotel is awesome”
Reviews.Author: iluvmycharger
Reviews.Content: The Swisshotel is awesome. Very high class. It is expensive , but so is every hotel in Chicago. It is off from the dingy areas of our city , yet a long walk to Navy Pier, so you will need to pay for the cab. Note to all the Magnificent Mile is boring as can be. I live in Chicago and the hotel is a better experience than the Mile of Navy (BORING) Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is Beautiful! Swissotel - Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: flipflopgirl
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel doesn't look like much from the outside but its location is prime. I was upgraded to a Suite on the 40th floor. The view was absolutely breathtaking. Riverwalk and and the lake. An added bonus was the Executive Lounge with complimentary food throughout the day. Location is absolutely perfect! It's in walking distance of Michigan Ave and Millenium Park and close to the Navy Pier. Service with a smile always! We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Everything”
Reviews.Author: Slider54
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the hotel. The staff seemed very helpful and friendly. I agree with most of the other reviews that the room was very nice. We had a room with a river view and the view of the river and Navy Park was excellent. Periodically a water cannon would be shot across the river. In the late afternoon, you could see a rainbow when it was going off. If you have a room on the other side, you are staring into an office building. There was plenty to do within walking distance. We did a walking tour of deco buildings put on by CAF and also a boat tour. Prices in the hotel are expensive but there are plenty of restaurants close by including Morton's. A great breakfast spot is The Corner Bakery at Michigan and Wacker. The sun did shine in the room in the morning. Actually, a beautiful sunrise. Don't know if you can shut the drapes, but we are early risers anyway. Two things I didn't like was the cost of parking ($50 a day) but I guess that is the going rate. However, they did charge for the fitness center which I thought was inappropriate. So, I just ran the stairs in the stairwell instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great rate”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: When I received an email alert from a Travel Newsletter regarding a great rate at Swissotel in Chicago, I had to check it out. Booked a two night stay at the rate of $109 per night, which is outstanding in downtown Chicago, in my opinion. We had a huge corner room with a view from the 29th floor out to the lake and downtown. It also happened to be the first weekend for the 2008 Taste of Chicago, so we were a short 3 block walk from Grant Park.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Grek
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago for work & leisure a few times a year, and have been meaning to try the Swissotel. I was pretty underwhelmed overall. The room itself was mostly fine, but in general the stay was just OK. THE RESERVATION: I found a decent rate on TravelZoo and booked it directly on the Swiss website about a month before my stay. I called the day before to confirm, and no one could find any record of my reservation. I even e-mailed my confirmation to the gentleman in reservations, and all he could do (after several calls and him agreeing that their system had simply lost my info) was forward my e-mail to the reservation manager. And when I called the next morning to ensure it had been addressed--guess what--the reservation manager had no idea and I needed to start over with the explainations and fixing. All this, and I was assigned a room with a view of mostly the office building next door. I'd like to think they would have marked my reservation for a better room, given all the hassles. THE ROOM: My room was comfortable (very good bed linens and towels) and clean. There's an Ipod docking station but I never was able to make it work with my Ipod. The drapes don't block the light, however, so even with a west-facing room it was bright very early in the morning. THE DINING: I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and room service. The restaurant was steep, even for a business hotel. Oatmeal/toast/bacon took me close to $40. Room service, however, was prompt and good. I had for a surprisingly large and yummy pizza--there was easily enough for two. I chose chicken/spinach/artichoke and was tickled that I got to relax in my room with a meal ($16 for the pizza) that fit well within my expense report limits. THE ANNOYANCE: Upon checkout, I asked the concierge about how long the shuttle ride to O'Hare would take. I was shocked at the 90 minute time she quoted--after all, it was early on a Saturday--but she was insisted that was the travel time so I scheduled myself accordingly. As it turned out, it was just under 45 minutes, and I had lots of time to kill at the airport. THE LOCATION: Overall, the location is just OK--it's walkable to Mag Mile, State Street (just under a mile), theatre district, Navy Pier (again, just under a mile), a nearby movie theater, and restaurants. But unlike other comparable hotels, there aren't delightful restaurants and great shops just outside the door--you'd better wear comfortable shoes at all times. IN SUM: It was missing the amenities I've come to enoy and expect--turndown, free internet, high quality toiletries--from hotels in this price range. It may be fine for corporate gatherings, but for the independent business traveler or the family on a leisure trip, you can do better. If you just need a place to crash, the Swiss is fine. But if you want to enjoy the hotel and the city, I'd suggest the Omni or the a boutique spot like Monaco or Amalfi for a more enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Take your confirmation number, watch your credit card bill!”
Reviews.Author: ponchogrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. When I tried to check in, they told me I didn't have a reservation. I knew I did, and had printed out the confirmation #, but had left it in our car, which was valet parked at a different hotel. They checked me in, but I asked them to make sure I wasn't charged for a one night no show, on the reservation they couldn't find. They said again that they didn't have any other reservation for me, so I accepted their word. The room was nice, spacious, my girls loved it. The beds were super comfy, and the girls loved the separate shower and tub. The water in the shower took a while to get warm, but it was worth it once it did. We came back in late from a graduation, and asked at the front desk if they had any delivery menus. The clerk acted like he didn't know what we were talking about, then finally gave us one menu for a pizza place. The elevator was non existent when we were trying to go down to check out. When we got to the elevator, another family said they had been waiting 15 mins, and we waited about 10 more. Then I pressed the up button, and one came right away. I said we'll just ride it up, then down, and the other family got on too. We did that, and after only one stop we were down in a jiffy. Several weeks later I checked my credit card statement, and surprise! I had been charged for 2 nights on one credit card (correct) and one night on the credit card that I had used to guarantee the reservation that they couldn't find! To their credit, when I called, they took my information and called me back and said they would credit back that night's charge, but they couldn't/wouldn't explain how the mixup happened. With all the nice hotel choices out there, I don't think I will be back to the Swissotel. The bed was comfy, but the negatives outweighed the positives in this case for me.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming stay”
Reviews.Author: Nsomerset
Reviews.Content: stayed at swissotel for 5 nights - just myself and two children (aged 4 and 6) all the staff could not have been more welcoming, the room service was prompt and efficient and not overly expensive. I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to access all tourist attractions as its very well situated and easily walkable for little legs!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed, hated the elevator!”
Reviews.Author: JBalzli
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with some amazing views of the lake and the river. Of course, with the building boom in Chicago, you also get a view into several construction sites, quite fascinating. The room has all you would expect from a business hotel; and the bed is to die for!!! But I don't believe it's worth the regularly advertized price... so be sure to hold out for discount rates. While we were there the elevators kept malfunctioning, often leaving people stranded on their floor during the moring check-out rush. I was also disappointed that their shower product bottles were not recyclable, indicating a serious lack of basic corporate environmental responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: girlluxe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the rooms. I expected a very institutional business hotel. The room was well equipped for business travelers. It was also very clean and well appointed. Furniture was sleek and high quality for a hotel. I ate at the Palm, which was excellent. The view from my room was perfect â€“ Lake Michigan, the Chicago River and Navy Pier. At night, I could see all the lights from Navy Pier and the Ferris Wheel as well as the lights of the city and the boats. Because it is a little farther east of the Loop and Michigan Avenue (but closer to the lake), it was a little quieter and cheaper than other hotels that are located on or right off Michigan Avenue. I have also stayed at the Fairmont and the Sheraton nearby, and I think the Swiss is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: LA_Gals
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, though I stayed at the Sheraton across the street and that hotel is a little bit more convenient. It is difficult to get across the street because of the river. We had a great price (Travezoo) so it was good for that price. We had a standard room, non smoking though it felt like someone smoked in the room regardless. The accomodations were good, a little bit still shabby considered it was recently remodeled. The bar downstairs was a bit overpriced even for a hotel with not a lot of selection. Did not eat at the restaurant, with so many choices, why eat at the hotel. The concierge was not that helpful. The one lady we spoke to seem bothered that we were asking a question.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbwt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Swissotel Chicago for business and had an overall enjoyable experience. I stayed in an Executive room and really appreciated the large desk space and free internet. The room was two rooms from the elevators and I could still hear them but it wasn't too bad. If you are sensitive to noise make sure to ask for a room well away from the elevators. The lake views are incredible and the location is good. If I were here for leisure I would probably choose a smaller, more intimate hotel but for business this was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: twanny1976
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel at $109 per night through Travelzoo. Was very happy with location. It is 5min from Downtown and 5 min from the Mile. The hotel and rooms were very clean. The only prob was that the first room the internet was not working and it took them a few hours to finally decide it doesn't work and get us to change room. in the 2nd room the safe deposit does not woork. Otherwise very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, a few more months”
Reviews.Author: caravaca
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed three nights in a Swissotel Executive Room during a recent Chicago vacation. We have mostly very positive things to say, and would probably stay there again if we ever go to Chicago. At least if we can find as good a deal as we did this time. I would like to point out some things you should be aware of: 1) There's a lot of construction work around the Swissotel. The hotel seems to be 100 % soundproof, so that's no problems. But within a year or so the magnificent lake view will probably be only a memory of the past. The same goes for the view of the park area to the south. 2) Make sure that you don't get a room right next to the elevators, since these make a lot of sound, speedy as they are. We first got room 3301, but had to change. No problems at all at the front desk - they seemed to be used to it. The original room had a lakefront view which was stunning. The second room overlooked the city and river, with a good look of the Wrigley Building. Not as exciting, but still very good. Beware of office workers who probably can see right into your room from a 100 feet distance. 3) We had an Executive Room which granted us access to the 42nd floor Executive Lounge with day-round complimentary beverage service (non-alcoholic), an evening serving of hors d'ouvres (sorry for the spelling) and pastries, and free Internet Access. Also a great view. The Executive status did not grant us free access to the gym, which came for a cost of $15. The pool and sauna was free for all guests. 4) The restaurant and bar service on the ground floor was OK, but during our stay, the lobby was always really full of other guests. Maybe since the hotel had a really good spring offer, which attracted more private guests compared to the usual business people. 5) The Executive room was smaller than expected, probably a standard room, although on high floors. I would probably choose a corner room next time, which looks larger on their website. The King bed was excellent, LCD-TV really nice, and the room came with a stereo with iPod docking station as well as a really good coffee brewer. Nice! The bathroom featured both a tub and a shower and was in perfect condition. The last remark in fact goes for the whole room, the cleaning service was perfect and the room recently renovated. 6) Make sure to sign up for the Club Swiss Gold bonus program before your stay for better front desk service and it will strengthen your chances of a free upgrade. All in all, Swissotel Chicago was a great experience, which I definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, Loved the Swissotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SgtDonut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here I think 5 years ago and I remember it very well! The rooms were very clean, the service was polite and helpful, and it's near the heart of Chicago! Just walk a few minutes and there's plenty to see. There was construction at the time and there's construction now, but I didn't mind it at all. In fact, I liked watching. If you can't stand construction, then get a room on the other side. It'll be quieter. Plus the view was lovely! Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: kmh2008
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent the weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Swissotel. Thanks to TravelZoo I was able to find an amazing deal - lakeside rooms for $129/night as part of a spring promotion. We took the train from O'Hare and had approximately a half-mile walk from the nearest station - it's a bit far if you're tired, have a lot of bags, or if the weather's bad. We didn't mind and were pleased with the hotel's location in general - very walkable to the major sights. Once we got there we checked in quickly and were pleased with our double room on the 10th floor overlooking the Chicago River, Lake Michigan, and Navy Pier. The room was very well appointed and clearly had been recently renovated. Great beds. The bathroom was large and modern, but the corner shower was a bit cramped and water invariably leaked onto the floor each time. A hassle...not a deal-breaker. The hotel lounge was a great place to grab a bite and a drink. Look for a coupon for a free appetizer on the bottom of the breakfast order door hanger in your room - it'll save you up to $20 on the very expensive (but delicious) appetizer selections at the lounge. We were able to get tickets for a special exhibit at the Art Institute through the Concierge - it saved us from waiting in a very long line at the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location”
Reviews.Author: farealtor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday. We could not have been more pleased with the service, location, as well as the room and its view. All the staff we encountered, from doorman to desk lady who checked us in, to check out, was professional and courteous. Our room had a fantastic view of Navy Pier and looked as if recently updated. From this location we walked to Michgan Avenue, restaurants, and stores. Our room was next to the elevator and there was a slight hum at times, but it was not a hindrance, especially with the special rates that come available from time to time and which we took advantage of. We would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!! Great windows!”
Reviews.Author: krwshl
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on a Thursday night and had a very relaxing stay. Everything in the room was top notch, very elegant! The bed was extremely hard to get out of. We asked for a corner room and they had one availible ... wow it has windows everywhere in it. Even the bathroom had spectacular views. Especially enjoyed winding down in the free to use pool and spa. I have stayed at most of the nice hotels in Chicago and I would go out of my way to stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Tacky”
Reviews.Author: jakkcmo
Reviews.Content: I'm not one of those people who writes reviews about hotels, but I was so disgruntled during our stay that I feel compelled to tell the world. The Swissotel may have impressive views and a fancy address, but that's where it ends. When we arrived at the hotel there was a line approximately 40 people deep of travelers checking in. After waiting in the line for more than 30 minutes, we finally got to our room and were disappointed to see that it didn't look anything like the photos online. It looked like it hadn't been updated since the late 1980's. Later that night while trying to go to sleep we realized that you could hear the elevators traveling up and down all night from our room. The shower head couldn't be adjusted and because of the awkward bathroom layout you could not turn the shower on or adjust the temperature without the stream of water hitting you in the face. I slipped in the bathroom as I learned the hard way that the shower also leaked. After this incident we asked management to change us to a new room and found the second room to have identical issues as the first. On top of all of this, the concierge was so unhelpful and unknowledgeable that we called the W Hotel to use their services. I will give kudos to the Swissotel lobby bar. The bartender and staff were the only bright spots in the lackluster weekend. Not what you expect from an upscale hotel and certainly not worth $300/night. I would not stay at Swissotel again if it were the only hotel available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....hold on to your wallet.”
Reviews.Author: jephster07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The check in was easy and the staff at the desk was courteous. They filled me in on all what hotel had to offer. The rooms were clean and modern. The flat screen TV was great! King size bed was very comfortable. Check out was a breeze. Now for the "hold on to the wallet" part, the restaurants on the property were outrageously expensive and the drinks found in the room refrigerator were pricey. (don't even think about buying your own to place in the fridge. Just moving the items will trigger a charge to your bill! So I did not even open the fridge) There was a charge to use the gym. Being on the far end of Wacker Drive, if you are not into walking, you have to use a cab. Other than that, Michigan Ave is only a couple blocks away. Be warned however that if you stay on the south facing side of the building, a new building is going up next door and there is construction going on. The noise was not an issue unless you like to sleep in late. I am not sure how tall this structure will be but by judging the existing high rises that are around, the view from the room will more than likely be blocked soon. The other minor issue is the adjoining room option. Better hope your neighbor does not have a screaming kid because you can sure hear it! Overall, the hotel was nice. It is not worth the regular high dollar price the hotel offers. Go through the discount travel web sites to get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Very Bad Staff”
Reviews.Author: mcfaddenkerri
Reviews.Content: Comments: My wife and I visited Chicago for our 5th wedding anniversary and we decided to stay at Swissotel because we heard great feedback from a few friends who stayed here, but we also heard some not so great things as well. I booked on travelzoo.com and got a fantastic rate of $109 a night. My total was $250.51 for a quiet room with a king bed. Upon checking in I informed Nury at the front desk of the promotional price and asked her to explain my charges to me so that I would know which card that I wanted to put it on. She said that she would, but she handed my wife a piece of paper and asked her to sign. My wife handed me the paper and I signed where it said that the rate was $109. Nury didn\'t explain anything to us, and I asked her to explaine again and she simply smiled and said have a great stay. My wife was exhausted from a 5 hour train ride so we proceeded to our room. The room was not what I\'d asked for it was a double and not a king. We changed out of our dirty clothes and made some calls to our kids and since we had reservations we left. As soon as we got back we informed the front desk attendant that we asked for a King and got a double. She gladly upgraded our room with a LakeSide view. I asked her to make sure that we had a quiet room. She smiled. When we got to the room it took the bellman 30 minutes to get our things. Not a problem but he was not very nice. My wife offered him a tip but he refused. The King room was amazing, but one issue, we have 5 kids at home and very hetic jobs and we requested twice a quiet room. She put us right next to the elevator and next to very noisey guests. I slept fine, but my wife is a light sleep and she only got 3 hours sleep Friday night. She said that there were teenagers making a lot of noise in the hallway. The next morning she went to Nury and spoke with her about it. Nury simply smiled and said that the next time my wife should call down to the front desk to complain. My wife was not pleased with the response, but nevertheless we proceeded to breakfast. I decided to check our debit card to see what our balance was. I was very upset when I learned that the Swissotel charged our card $461! After breakfast we went to the front desk and spoke with Nury and she smiled again and told us that they charged our card $75 a day for incidentals. INCIDENTALS? I asked her to explain that to me and she just kept smiling and said that it was for incidentals. My wife was very upset with Nury and her snobbish attitude so she said that we asked her to explain the charges to us the day that we checked in which was Friday, April 18th and she didn\'t explain them. We asked her twice. My wife asked her if there was a language barrier and if she didn\'t understand her when she requested an explaination. My wife was very upset so I asked her to please explain the charges and Nury simply said I already did. So to keep my wife calm I took her back to our room and called the manager. When I spoke to the manager she was just as uncaring as Nury. I explained to her that had Nury explained that they were going to hold over $200 extra dollars on my debit card I would\'ve used another credit card. I informed her that we asked Nury to explain the charges twice and she then said that we signed a paper, I told her that we read the paper and signed it, but when we asked Nury to explain the charges she should\'ve explained that they were going to charge an extra $200. Which she didn\'t. The manager didn\'t care. I am not one to complain, but you have a lovely hotel and I would reccommend your establishment however we were treated like we didn\'t matter. I checked my credit card and my money is still gone. Is it their policy to take money from your patrons? In my eyes that is a step up from stealing because we did not utilize the mini bar, room service or the business center. The staff really need to take a class in interpersonal communication. The bell man was very rude to us and the way that Nury and the manager treated us was simply uncalled for. The only person that treated us like we were paying guests was Vincent the bartender at the Lobby Lounge. The room was nice, but the service was horriable. I wouldn't stay at this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great View....”
Reviews.Author: frombctodc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, conveniently located to the magnificent mile and public transportation (bus). The room was great, with an AWESOME view of the lake and Navy Pier (the room/view is what bumps it up to 4 stars for me!). On the flip side, it was apparent that there were ongoing renovations - the room was loud at odd times (banging, etc.). Also, the houskeeping overcharged us for stuff that we never used from our minibar (to management's credit, it was quickly fixed and taken off our bill). Also, at $50 a night, parking costs are outrageous. We parked in the public lot under Millenneum Park just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Billyz11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in March 2008.This is an upscale hotel in an excellent location and hard to fault. Check-in was a breeze, numerous high speed elevators, room on the 25th floor was immaculate and very well designed, high quality bathroom with separate shower. Didn't like the fact that the room was so directly overlooked by the office block next door. I regard $49 per night for valet parking as daylight robbery and chose to self park 1 block away for $28. Room service food quality was very good but with a $7 tray charge plus 20% service, I then absolutely refuse to tip for delivery. I would stay here again but would insist on a lakeshore view room.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to 5-star rating!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendiUSMC
Reviews.Content: Despite several negative reviews, this hotel lived up to its 5-star rating. The staff was wonderful, our room was very comfortable with an amazing view of the Chicago River and Michigan Ave, Room service was superb (we were allowed to order after hours). I would stay at the Swissotel again without question. Parking was a little high compared to others in the area ($49) but we had in /out privledges, and I got the room for $70 a night on priceline.com. My husband and I were there with our 6 year old daughter, who felt like princess. Our room was excellent, very clean, nice smelling, very comfortable beds, great plasma TV, very quiet!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, with some snags”
Reviews.Author: MinibarRaider
Reviews.Content: Booked a two-night stay on Priceline, expecting the Hyatt but received the Swissotel. I stay in hotels all the time, so I was excited to try a new one. The location is not as good as a lot of other hotels, but it's not awful. At check-in the clerk noticed I had booked on Priceline, confirmed the number of nights, and then wordlessly made keys to my room. Not an auspicious start, considering other hotels at least pretend to care by discussing my smoking and bed preferences and giving me a brief rundown on the hotel amenities and restaurants (he didn't). I ended up with a double on the 7th floor - I would've preferred a King since I was alone, but it was one of the renovated rooms so I decided to keep it. The room was fine - neutral modern decor in varying shades of beige, flatscreen TV, and a nice view of the city. The bathroom was spacious, with a separate shower and tub. The bed was comfortable, but would have liked a firmer pillow. There were a number of details that made my stay not-so-great: 1. No soap for the sink or shower! They brought some up right away, but it really set the tone for the rest of the stay. 2. Wireless internet was not working. Had to call tech-support on my cell since toll-free calls are charged by the hotel. Tech-support (IBAHN) called the front desk to have an ethernet cable sent to my room. An hour later, I had to call again because I still had not received the cable. Wired internet was good, and you can roam with Boingo or T-Mobile accounts. 3. My room was never made-up. I left the hotel for 4 hours in the afternoon with the do-not-disturb sign removed, but it was not serviced when I returned. Of course, by then there was no point in calling housekeeping because I didn't want to wait in the lobby while they tidied up. 4. Construction noise on the second morning was super-annoying, as if they were putting together furniture with a hammer in the next room, with periodic drill usage thrown in for good measure. 5. Had a $21.98 minibar charge on my invoice before check-out when I hadn't used anything, or even picked anything up off the sensors since none of the contents were very exciting. They removed the charge, but had no explanation for why it happened. (FYI: there is a market one block south of the Hyatt that has wine/beer and food for reasonable prices until 2am, and a Dominick's (Safeway) grocery store across the river open til 1am.) Overall, the hotel is a comfortable business hotel, but could stand to improve its service.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingrocks
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. clean. we had a decent view from the 21st floor. Good location, within walking distance to the mag mile. Had an appetizer at the Lobby Lounge, and the food came from the Palm Restaurant. Good food. $10 glass of wine was nothing too exciting. The pool was great, on the 42nd floor. Nice view of Navy Pier. Noone was in the pool but us, so that was very nice. Can valet park for $30/day or so. Street parking is limited to none. When I inquired about public/street parking upon check in, I was told "we valet park here, ma'am". The bartender at the Lobby was not rude, but was not pleasant either. Could have had a bit nicer service. There was a lot of construction going on down the hall during the day. It was very noisy, but no issues whatsoever in the evenings or at night. Our air conditioner made a continuous clicking noise. Wasn't irritating enough to make a complaint. Overall this hotel was good. Great deal for the price we paid on priceline. Would stay here again for the price but would not pay the price as seen on other websites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, dated.”
Reviews.Author: DanCRNA
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend here via priceline for $77 per night (plus $49 per night parking fee.) Our initial room was not what we requested (and confirmed via the front desk after the priceline reservation.)
