Although it was a very modern room with large flat screen TV and office-likeappearance, the two small beds were not the King we were promised. After a five minute hassle with the front desk we were moved to the room we were promised, only it wasn't nearly as nice as the first room. Our room was dated with an old TV that probably came from a garage sale and a matching "stereo" system equally antiquated. Aside from this lack of modern convenience, the room was clean although devoid of view. Our experience inllustrated the inconsistentcies that plague this chain, which should be able to do better for its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, polite, comfy”
Reviews.Author: deeindiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swissotel while he attended a company convention. We read the mixed reviews on this site and were a bit concerned about what we might find. We were honestly very pleased. The hotel is located about 4 blocks from Michigan Ave. On a nice day, it would've been a lovely walk to the Magnificent Mile. But Chicago was having the worst blizzard since 1998, so I took a cab. It cost $5 from the hotel to the Water Tower. Before I left, I asked the concierge for shopping info: the polite gentleman gave me a map, pointed out well known stores, and gave me a 10% discount coupon to Macy's and Bloomingdales. Our room was on the 32nd floor with a closeup view of a construction site and a frozen Lake Michigan in the distance. We weren't interested in a view. But we noticed gorgeous views of Navy Pier and the Wrigley Building from many of the hallway windows, so you might be able to request a room-with-a-view if it was important to you. The construction outside could not be heard at all from our room. The room was not "grand", but very nice: puffy white bedspreads, lots of pillows, comfortable double beds, a desk with wireless access (cost was $9 per 24 hours), decent TV, well-stocked minibar, in-room movies. The bathroom was roomy, with both a tub and separate shower (the plumbing was a little noisy). We were very comfortable. After shopping in the blizzard, I tried to order a late lunch at the lobby cafe -- but even though the desk clerk said it was open there was no one around. It was cozy sitting by the fireplace, but after 15 minutes I got tired and left. I ended up ordering room service. It was delivered within 15 minutes: a fabulous herb-filled tuna salad wrap and gorgeous fruit (huge portions that I could've easily shared). Hubby's conference met that evening on the top floor with a panoramic view of the skyline -- very lovely in a blizzard! The hotel buffet had fabulous food. The waite staff was annoying: talking loudly among themselves, taking away plates while you were still nibbling, bringing the wrong drinks, etc. The next night we had a late supper in The Palm Restaurant on the main floor. The atmosphere was low key - like a private club. The staff was unbelievably friendly and efficient. When our waiter found out we were on a low-carb diet, instead of bringing a bread bowl he presented a plate of their famous pickles and radishes and told us the story of how that used to be The Palm's signature appetizer in the good-old-days. The steaks were out-of-this-world. A business woman dining alone told us that she always eats there because she doesn't feel like an "odd duck" being on her own. Our meal was expensive, but worth it. Check out was a noon. We wanted to go to the art institute and were allowed to check out bags until we returned. Very handy. We had a great stay. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, near magnificiant mile”
Reviews.Author: cybertroggy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near the millenium park and the magnificiant mile. Hotel was very clean and modern and there are mainly business guests. At that time our room was towards a constructions site, but it was not noisy. Only the view wasn't that nice. Altogether a nice and modern business hotel with all kind of service, but nothing with individuality and charme.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the First time, Hated It The Second”
Reviews.Author: Ashlie410
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary, I loved it. We upgraded to a suite and everyone was so helpful and nice that I wanted to return. BIG MISTAKE!!!! I went back a few months later with my best friend. All on the way from Milwaukee I was telling her how everyone was so nice and the rooms are beautiful. We get there and they tell us they overbooked the hotel and they were moving us to a suite but that it was just like as a regular room. I get to the "ROOM" and it was horrible. It was an office space with a murphy bed, they said it was a king size bed. No my queen size bed at home was bigger than that. The shower was nasty and the door wouldnt close. The tub had a semidirt ring ughhhhhhhhh. I went downstairs to complain and some man said in a very condecending tone, "Well when you book off of Hotwire you get what we give you" Excuse me, I pay my money like everyone else. He then told me that they have no more rooms available and i was just going to have to deal with it since i was only staying a night. O really?? I called from my cell phone and asked if they had any rooms available and they said yes its blah blah blah. I went downstairs and complained some more. Is this how they treat everyone or is it because I look a lot younger than I am? I asked to speak with a manager before I lost my cool with him. They got me someone else and all they could give me was breakfast. We came down for a party and werent going to be up by breakfast time. I walked away and went to get ready for my party. It was an all white affair(everyone wears white clothing) and the iron spit black gunk on my white pants, glad I had a backup. The next morning at checkout, the woman i spoke with was very nice she apologized for the man last night comp'd me lunch and took care of my parking. It was a nice gesture but still didnt take away from them putting me in an office. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone. Hotwire refunded my stay and asked if that ever happened again to call them a.s.a.p and they would move me to a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: lady8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights the first part of December. Hotel was booked by tour bus company. I found the hotel room to be very comfortable. It took them a bit to get my luggage to my room, however there was alot of luggage and I was on one of the top floors. Loved the Aveda shampoo/conditioner/lotion etc. It was replenished everyday. I always like that. Was within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and had nice little bakery down the street. I didn't dine in the hotel, so I can't tell you about the food. Walking back to the hotel after the theatre was not a problem, felt very safe, although it was Christmas time and the streets were packed. I would go back. I rated it 3 circles because I actually didn't utilize any of their ammenities at the hotel so I really can't judge. I was gone all day shopping. But when I got back to my room it was very comfortable. Maybe though they could have more channels and a larger TV.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: girlinUS
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was greeted with ever-ready doormen to carry our little suitcases. Check-in was easy as well. Considering we booked from hotwire, we expected a not so great room (based on some previous reviews) but were pleasantly surprised at our room on the 27th floor with a king bed. Couldn't beat the price either-$89/night! We had a wonderful view of Lake Michigan and the Navy Pier. There is an indoor pool/sauna and gym on the top floor. In the lobby is The Palm restaurant. We sat at the bar only but the bartenders were wonderfully expedient with everything. There is also another lobby lounge adjacent to the restaurant which seemed just fine. Concierge was helpful in directing us to a pharmacy since the airlines took our ever dangerous toothpaste and hairgel. Back to the room...it was right next to the elevator but it didn't bother us. Only heard it a bit while awake. The only thing I can complain about is the sink faucet and shower had some dripping but it didn't bother us really...just something I noticed. I loved the pillows and the bed was comfy. Oh and the location of the hotel is not bad. About two blocks from Michigan Ave. To get to other parts of the city we did drive. We didn't take the metro so not sure if it's convenient or not. For the price we paid, it certainly was worth it. Now parking in the city and garages, that's a different story, quite pricey!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: FancyTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, Clean Bathroom, Great location and Breathtaking view! I would definitely recommend staying here. It is a short walk from here to the Magnificient Mile. I definitely recommend staying here for any trip to Chicago. I hope you enjoy this hotel as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Egram
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking Lake Michigan. We could see the ferris wheel on Navy Pier and everything looked so pretty. Even thou it was a little chilly outside, it was great to just be able to sit back and enjoy the view. We were on the 27th floor. My husband and I enjoy going to Chicago for the night especially during the holidays. The Swissotel is a favorite of ours. We had driven to the hotel, but we didn't use valet parking. We checked out a couple of parking lots that were in walking distance and ended up paying $29 for 24 hours which we didn't think was too bad. I did notice that the bottles of water that they have in the rooms sell for $6 which I think is rediculous. I also think that there is a fee to use the fitness room. Needless to say, we didn't buy the water or use the fitness room. Everyone was very friendly and we will definitely go there again. The room that we had was right next to the elevators and we were afraid that it might keep us up during the night, but it really didn't which really surprised us. The room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good location”
Reviews.Author: 0941Will
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the last week of October when my husband had a conference in the nearby Hyatt Regency. We were upgraded to a corner room with a view of Navy Pier becuase they had not noted our request for a king room. There were no king rooms available when we checked in and the woman at the front desk was not overly helpful until we produced a copy of our confirmation wtih the king bed request on it. The upgraded room was spacious, clean, and the view was outstanding. The tub and shower were a bit small, but they were tolerable. The staff at the hotel did not seem too overly helpful, but the staff at the Palms was absolutely excellent, as was the late-night dinner we had there on our arrival night. I loved the location and the fact that you can take an underground tunnel to the Hyatt and Michigan Avenue. Overall, it was a nice stay ,and I would definately reccomend Swissotel over the Hyatt Regency for anyone who has a conference at the Hyatt ( I stayed there during a conference in May 2005--very ordinary, to say the least.)

Reviews.Title: “If you love noise this is for you.”
Reviews.Author: Turner_traveler
Reviews.Content: Very Very noisy - Constant water running through pipes. It was terrible!! There are much better hotels to stay at in Chicago. Thier parking rate is obnoxious ($42.00 a night) and way too far out to walk to much. If you must stay here, try to park for free on dead end street (feed meter on weekdays) and take the stairs down to the next street level and you will find a Jewel grocery store for sodas/snacks. (A can of soda at the hotel was $4.50 plus 18% restocking fee!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall, a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: stb71
Reviews.Content: We were awarded this hotel on a Priceline bid and got a room with a city view on the 21st floor. Some of my friends have stayed at Swissotel with mixed reviews. We were happy with the hotel and found it to be very comfortable and well appointed. We wanted a hotel that would be close to Michigan Ave and Millenium Park and it was perfect in that regard. The staff was very friendly and helpful too. Here's a rundown of our "pros" and "cons" overall. Pros: very nice pool and spa on the 42nd floor, rooms and lobby were clean, easy walk to Michigan Ave through via the lower level walkway to the Illinois State center, beds were comfortable. Cons: no free internet access ($9.95/day) is a major no no these days. Slight mold found in shower. Fan for room heating/air was noisy at times - it literally sounded like a woodpecker at 2am one night. No room fridge except the well-stocked but highly monitored fridge loaded with snacks and booze. Ice machines are not on every floor, so to keep your own beverage cold you may need to go quite a way to get ice. When you do find the ice, it is in a service area often cluttered with maid carts. There is no vending in this building either, but you can get snacks at the gift shop. You're better off going down to the Dunkin Donuts near the walkway to the Illinois Center, it's a quick walk. Also, there is a condo tower being built on the North side of the building. Construction could be noisy at lower levels, but personally I was fascinated to have such a good view of the construction activity, cranes, etc. Guys will like it but I could see it being a problem if you're trying to work quietly or have a sleeping baby. Overall, it is a nice hotel but I would be hesitant to pay what the going rate seems to be. See if you can get a special deal through priceline, hotwire, or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: Bensen4
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I didn't pay full price for our room...I booked a two night stay (Sun & Mon) and paid $85 a night on Priceline. Go for it if you don't mind an average room. I have stayed in nicer places for less than what the room would normally have cost. It is at a dead end, but is still within a reasonable distance from MI Ave. So you have to walk a couple blocks....it's exercise. The staff was nice, but no smiling faces or hellos as you passed by. The fridge in the room...don't even touch it. You'll get charged for moving ANYTHING. The prices are ridiculous anyway. The parking...here's the secret....if you plan on walking everywhere, park in the garage underneath the building next door. You have to enter it from Randolph. Park close to the elevator and go to the Lobby. It will bring you to the lobby of the building and the exit is just a few steps and it's a few steps to the hotel. It's $29 a day. But remember, no in and out. I won't be staying at the Swissotel again. It's a 4 star but I can't figure out where.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: the swissotel is a cracking hotel just off the magnificent mile and on lake michigan, and the views are superb. the hotel is very clean, well presented and the staff were quick and efficient. they had an excellent christmas tree in reception, once of the nicest i had seen in a hotel, and a house made out of chocolate for the kids. would recommend this hotel and stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sore Feet - bad location”
Reviews.Author: thriftytracy
Reviews.Content: I rely heavily on what other people say about a hotel, thus, I'm writing this review. My hotel stay came about through a priceline bid. We paid $147 (without taxes) per night; Saturday arrival, Sunday departure. Our goal was to Christmas shop; first weekend of December stay. First and foremost, the location is terrible. "Close to" means quite a hike. Just to get to Michigan Avenue was several blocks. Then, you are at the END of Michigan Avenue. To get to the good stores you have another hike. To get to State Street to see the original Macy's and more shopping, it was an even further hike. I'm 37 years old and when I crawled into bed that evening I ached all over, but mostly my feet were killing me. My friend felt the same way; the next day our hips ached from all the walking. (By the end of the day we did start paying for taxi rides; we were miserable.) Secondly, the hotel is rated a four star and I didn't get why. It was simply a very average room. And, by the way, if you move anything in the refrigerator, you will be charged for it. The products have sensors on them. We put a piece of cheesecake in the refrigerator and had to move the items around to make it fit. The next morning we had over $60 in minibar charges that we had to dispute. Not much of a dispute; they took them off the bill without questioning us...but it was still ridiculous. Food is beyond expensive. Two decaf coffees, one bagel with cream cheese, and a small blueberry muffin at the "bar" in the lobby cost $18. Staff was very, very professional; however, where is the smile? Where is the kindness? Even asking the concierge was like talking to a drill sargeant. I just want nice! I did ask for a room upgrade...a "lake view." I was told it was $30 more. I declined. My friend's room was also handicap. Her toilet was very high...and she's short. It was very awkward for her. Then, the toilet seat cover didn't fit the toilet bowl shape. Also awkward. Just would have been nice if she had been told so she had the option of declining such a room. Our biggest problem with this hotel truly came down to the location. We agreed that we would not stay at the Swissotel again. Our feet couldn't take it again. Don't forget a swimsuit if you stay, you'll need it for the hottub on the 42nd floor. Your body will ache from walking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago frequently and have stayed in many of the hotels downtown. We were excited to try the Swissotel, but left disappointed. The actual hotel and rooms were very nice with amazing views, the staff was extremely rude. The man that checked us in was on the phone and did not acknowledge us until he was done with his phone call. He then did not say more than five words, which were "I need a credit card". The lobby bar had fireplaces and was very cozy. The hotel information said it closed at 2am so we came back to hotel at 1230am for a "night cap", that was last call. That was fine for us, but the bar was full and many people were coming back from their night wanting a "night cap" but did not make last call. Our night ended listening to many unhappy people complaining and receiving no sympathy from the employees. There are many places to stay in the area that are just as nice or nicer, no need to stay at the Swissotel again. Definitely don't stay if you're looking for a romantic weekend away, the employees will ruin your experience from the second you walk in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Parking=$49/ night!”
Reviews.Author: travel46
Reviews.Content: Folks, this place has seen its better days. My husband and I have been traveling to Chicago for more than 20 years and have stayed at the Swissotel many times. It used to be such a lovely hotel but it is really worn out now and it just seems to get worse every year. Fixtures in the bathrooms are rusted, furniture is old and banged up, the beds are uncomfortable, the pillows worn out, etc. And, they have raised the parking rates to $49 per day! We'll never go back. Such a shame...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but there's better”
Reviews.Author: coconutkt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for a business trip and if you have something at the Gleacher Center ( a popular meeting space ) it's a perfect location. The rooms are spacious and have nice views, I was NOT impressed with the mattress and every, little, tiny thing costs money. Local calls even cost money so forget ordering take out. The staff is very pleasant and are truly an international group. I would not stay there again because the price was, in my opinion, not worth what you got. I stayed at another hotel that was closer to Michigan Avenue, and for MUCH less than the Swissotel was charging, I had a full kitchen, free hot breakfast AND hot dinner, free internet, a bedroom and living room, and more convenience to night life. The Swissotel is not far from Michigan Avenue, easy walking distance, but its somewhat secluded as far as the hotels go. Not bad, depending on if you've got lots of money to spend. They even sell Audis on the premises!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Telodigoluego
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Very well equiped, the rooms are spacious and very comfortable with every thing you need. From almost every room you have a view to the river and to part of Michigan Ave. The location is very good, within walking distance to restaurants, and fine stores on Michigan Avenue. It is also somewhat close to the park, Navy Pier and the Museum of Natural Science. Service is excellent, the personnel strive to make you feel better. The concierge is very savy and can direct you to the best restaurants and help you with the reservations. The hotel is very quiet and very business oriented. But it would be a very good hotel for a family vacation on Chicago. This was my second option, since the other hotel was totally booked, I decided to stay at this hotel and I am very satisfied with the experience. I surely recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference October 9-13, 2007. We had a group rate of $239 but found out the room really went for $500! We flew in at 5:30 am and the hotel let us check in early at 9 - we were exhausted so this was welcome. We upgraded to a window room - room 804. This is a fabulous room with great views of the Chicago River, Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. Hotel is in a great location - we walked to restraunts, museums, parks etc... the Mag MIle is very close as well. The bed, as noted in earlier posts, is not what I would expect from a hotel as nice as this. But it was still comfortable. The staff have impeccable manners! I think this is what you pay for - parking is $49/day, the gym is $12/day, the restraunt is very pricey etc... But the staff treat you like royalty. One very simple, but very appreciated touch was the water service in the front lobby. It was ice cold and filled with citrus - very refreshing after walking the city, even on cold days.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Swiss Standards”
Reviews.Author: ML2
Reviews.Content: One would think that a hotel called "Swissotel" would pride itself on cleanliness. However, the hotel does not provide toothbrushes if you forget yours (they were out, or so they claimed), and they don't offer mouthwash either (enjoy your hike to Walgreens if you need forgotten bathroom items). Overall, this hotel from top to bottom - service, furnishings, beds, appeal - is akin to a mediocre Holiday Inn. Most Embassy Suites and/or Hampton Inns are nicer and friendlier...and much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A fine choice, but beware of minibar”
Reviews.Author: UChicago74
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is a moderately sized 43 floor hotel that caters to business travelers. It is superbly located downtown on the South bank of the Chicago River, and overlooks Lake Michigan. It offers a good alternative to some of the larger, chain hotels nearby, such as the Hyatt, by being smaller, less hectic, and perhaps more personal. My room was clean, well decorated, and quite large, though not particularly luxurious. It had the usual amenities, making for a pleasant stay. Additional pluses are an indoor pool and gym on the 42nd floor, with some spectacular views, and internet connection at a reasonable price ($10/d). For the price I paid ($230 per night + plus usual fees - a convention rate) it seemed like a good value. There were a few glitches along the way. My first room had a loose window, producing an amazing howl, so I moved nearby. The bathroom was fine, though strangely, had only one small bar of soap. Most annoying was the minibar. As noted in other reviews, it has an automatic sensor, so that if you simply move an item, you are charged for it. Given the inflated price of items, plus sales tax and 19% restocking fee, moving a jar of cashews can be an expensive experience. Overall, I liked this hotel quite a bit and would probably return. The fabulous location and someone more personal scale of the place is a plus. However, if the rack rate is much higher, I would also look more closely at the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: ForneyNan
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 9/13/07. Daniella was very friendly and courteous. We booked from TravelZoo for a $109 per nite rate for two nites. We got in our room facing the Chicago River and the city(there was nothing wrong with this room) but made the mistake of seeing the Navy Pier view while waiting for the elevator. We went back and paid the extra $30 per nite for that view and was never sorry that we did. Our room was very comfortable, the bed was GREAT as were the the amenities. We parked in Systems Parking at the Millenium parking garage. It was $28 per day, but that was better than $49 at the hotel. We found everyone to be very friendly and helpful. People on the street asked if we needed directions and a very nice young man pointed us to Houlihan's. We ate on the patio and people watched and enjoyed it very much. We took the Chicago Trolley Tour and really liked it. The concierge at the hotel gave us directions to catch the trolley, also to Giordano's which is also walking distance. Please do not miss this restaurant if you're in the Chicago area. My husband and I are both seniors but had no problem with the walking involved. We loved Chicago and the Swissotel and would not hesitate to return. The only negative was noise(running water and etc.) from other rooms but not nearly bad enough for us not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the right price. Too many negatives at full price.”
Reviews.Author: dweebe
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Chicago is a decent choice for the business or leisure traveler. However the number of small negatives makes you think about staying other places. We managed to catch a $169/night rate on a summer weekend which isn't bad for the hotel location with a great view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. We even got upgraded to one of the corner rooms (room numbered x04) which also looked west toward Michigan Ave and the Wrigley building. At night it was cool just to turn off the lights and watch the city from your room. There are a few things to keep in mind and annoyances that affected our stay. 1.Most expensive hotel parking in Chicago at $49/night. During our weekend I checked other hotels in the area and they varied from $35 to $45. a.You can save money with a little work if staying over during the weekend. Upper Wacker dead-ends right by the hotel and thereâ€™s some street parking in the u-turn area. Theyâ€™re got $3/hour metered parking (2 hour max) along this stretch 9am to 8pm Monday to Saturday. If youâ€™re willing to take the time and energy you can save money by plugging the meters. Plus since we didnâ€™t park all day and drove to some events where public transport/taxis werenâ€™t an option. So we saved money by paying for only the early morning and evening. Plus like I said Sundays are free. 2.Noise is an issue. a.Thereâ€™s a condo building being built next door so youâ€™ll be greeted at 7am by the noise of heavy equipment construction. This will surely get worse as right now (August 07) theyâ€™re only on the foundation: as the building rises the noise will get worse as they get closer to guest rooms. b.CTA and tour buses idle in front of the hotel on the part of Upper Wacker that dead-ends by the hotel. If youâ€™re a light sleeper I would highly consider getting a higher floor city view room. Iâ€™m a deep sleeper and even had some troubles. 3.While the sheets/blankets were nice, the bedding and pillow were sub-par. The mattress in our room needs to be replaced ASAP. 4.High speed internet is $10/day. The WiFi signals werenâ€™t the best, but at least there was a wired Ethernet connection as a backup. 5.Furniture looks like newer patterns, but the wood is beat up badly. 6.Shower stall is very small: almost reminds you of a old style phone booth. Iâ€™m 6â€™ 3â€� and 200lbs so Iâ€™m a tall but normal build guy. The shower head was fine height but I kept bumping my knees, elbows, shoulders and head when trying to take a shower. Someone of a heavy build, pregnant or older age would have a real problem and be stuck taking a bath. 7.The gym on one of the top floors has a lot of great equipment and even better views. Full slate of cardio, cable machines and free weights that would rival a normal gym. However at $12/day per person we skipped it and took a long walk along the lake. 8.The lobby isnâ€™t the best design and can easily get very clogged when the traffic level gets high. One time I had to say â€œexcuse meâ€� to six different people to get from the front door to the elevators. 9.Not enough storage. Beyond the closet there wasnâ€™t any other place in our room to put our luggage/clothes. No drawers or similar place to keep stuff out of the open. It wasnâ€™t all bad. 1.The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. 2.The rooms were very clean. 3.Heating/AC control worked very well. 4.Large selection of TV channels. Also one last note: the door handles only work upwards. Was tough for me since my office is the opposite. While at the price we paid I could overlook a lot of these issues. But if I paid the $300+/night most websites were charging, I would check other hotels out.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice”
Reviews.Author: HondaCivicMan
Reviews.Content: Reading the mixed reviews before going to the Swissotel in Chicago made me hesitate. While I can't speak against those other poor reviews I can only base my review on my direct (and therefore limited) experience. We stayed there on Aug 20-23, 38th floor, Room 3817. We had it on a discount deal. The place was clean and quiet, as we requested a high floor and a quiet room. Our room was a south facing room, directly in front of a shorter office building with construction going on right beneath us, and a new construction to our left that did not obstruct us so was ok. Between buildings on the right, we could see parts of Millennium Park and between buildings on the left, we could see the Marina. Personally, we liked this view, particularly at night, as we are from Washington, DC and don't have tall buildings and the goings-on around them. Construction noise was minimal from this height, and I've been in som noisy hotels; it wasn't much more noise than any hotel located in a big city. The bed was clean, well made, and comfy (to us), which was a bit harder than ours at home. The carpet was very clean and looked new or refurbished. The bathroom was decent with an open design and bright lights; it seemed bigger than average and looks like a retro-1930's fashion/art deco without being garish or gaudy at all. There were some small water stains on the tile in the shower, but by gosh, you'd need to look pretty hard at it to know. The tv, btw, had some volume control issues but that was minor. The a/c was a big refresher from the hot humid days we stayed during the big rain storms that week. I think the Swissotel is a reliable choice. I kept thinking whether this is a 4-star. It's not a 3-star. I'd say 3.5 star. For the price, it is a deal either way you look at it. However, with the much more expensive competitors right next door, I think its a decent place for the more budget minded business or tourist traveller, though it doesn't seem directly aimed at the family travellers. They are right next door to KPMG and do a lot of convention business but it wasn't as fancy nor terrible as some seem to have written. I'll have to upload a few photos soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bbgamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a special birthday weekend for my wife from Aug 25 to 29. I had called ahead to ask for a nice room and to order flowers for my wife. Jaymes Ballard, the Concierge, made arrange for flowers, early check-in and we had a great room. Our room was the 33rd floor with a view facing the city. Room was large, everything looked like new, great bed, large bathroom with separate shower, great ammenities. A beautiful bouquet of flowers arrived upon our arrival. The hotel is about 10 mins from everything, not close but not far from anything. Has a great restaurant, 2 patios outside where I had a cigar. A really nice pool and hot tub on the 42nd floor. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and thanks to Jaymes for making our trip very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: Mirror74
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Chicago is good hotel, very nice, very helpful and nice staff. But one of the 500 best hotels in the world, as they proclaim themselves, has too many deficiencies for the price you pay and to be REALLY in the top 500. First of all, the prices are just too ridiculous, for instance 1l of bottled water in your room is 6USD, the items in you minibar are also too pricey. Second, the minibar has sensors, and these sensors are not working very well, so prepare yourself you a shock when paying your room bill (I had six items on my bill, but havenâ€™t at all used the minibar). Third, TV programs are the disgrace. You only have 28 programs, at least half of those are not working at all, and the rest are not working very well, constantly keep rustling. Such hotel should offer impeccable TV with vast array of program choices. And fourth, gym is not included in your room price; only the pool, and the pool is not very clean (I found hair floating in it). All in all, good hotel, nice big rooms, but TOO MANY small defects, to be really in the top category.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JJSreturns
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an executive suite at the Swissotel 8/24-8/26. The suite had two bathrooms, living room, and a separate bedroom. Our suite was on the 35th floor and had a great view. The furniture was a little worn but the hotel's service and location made up for it. I would definately stay here again. If you get an opportunity to see the musical "Wicked", do it, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, but......”
Reviews.Author: Hereandtheretraveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. The rooms, especially the beds, are quite comfortable. Terrific bathrooms, great views, spacious, quiet and clean. And, you can frequently get some excellent rates: I've stayed there twice over the summer, once for only $109 per night. However, a couple of watch-outs: first, the breakfast is very expensive and not very good; go to Lou Mitchell's instead for a taste of real Chicago; if you have a rental car, you are captive to their ridiculously expensive parking - $49/day - and there's really no alternative parking around; they charge a fee for using the health club which is shocking at a hotel of this caliber - it's a decent enough work out room with great views, but come on - $10.80 a pop? And, finally, they charge ridiculous fees if you're there on business, i.e., they charged me $7.50 to receive a Fed-Ex package!!! (And, they didn't even bother telling me the package was there until 12 hours after it arrived!) The front desk staff can be clueless about this stuff, too, just handing you attitude if you complain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Swissotel--”
Reviews.Author: Kar7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Chicago recently and got a suite so our toddler could stay in a crib in a separate room. We really enjoyed it and got tickets to see Wicked from the concierge who then sent us up a bottle of complimentary wine. We hired a babysitter through a great nanny service...the hotel was great, the service was wonderful and room service was quick. Whenever you asked for something, they were there within minutes. The suite was big and nice, but I will say the only negative, it looked a little worn. Other than that, I would stay there again. We were right near Millenuim Park which was just fun and beautiful. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Early check-in/$3 Boarding Pass Charge”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased when the front desk allowed me to check-in at 8:30am. But boy was I let down when I was told there was a $3 fee, per person, per boarding pass being printing. An employee said this fee started just recently. Overall, the room was nice, huge bath robes, spacious bathroom, three chairs in the room. Room service got my breakfast order wrong but they made it up the next day when I ordered a kids meal and got enough food for three people. Rooms in this hotel are noisy though...anytime anyone turns on water - above, below, or beside you - you can hear it! A cab to the State Street Macy's was $4. If you need a paper before the lobby store opens, go to the coffee bar and they will let you have one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible take a pass”
Reviews.Author: Windycity21
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed her for 3 days for business conferences. I called in a few hours before check in time to see if any rooms were available for check-in, the operator connected me to the reservations desk. The woman who answered was rude and standoffish going on and on that you could obsolutely not check in until 3:00. So I called again, this time got the front desk, they did say if a room was available before 3:00 you could check in. Got to hotel, rooms weren't ready yet. Feasible since there were 3 large groups meeting there. Finally got a corner room. Looked ok. 1. Bathroom looked like it came out of the early 1990's with round circular lightbulbs going around the mirror. Shower was very tight and small. Mold growing in between tile. Fellow coworker had leaky shower head and door. I had a leaky showerhead.Toliet made funny noises after being flushed. Took forever to find hairdryer. In case you are looking for it's in a white bag in the coat closet hanging off the bathrobe. Overall bathroom needs a complete remodel. 2. Bed-= absolutely awful. Nowadays most hotels have nice comfortable beds. Unless you like really firm beds, this bed is not for those who are used to luxury pillowtops. The mattress was old and hard. Could not fall asleep on. Actually got a backache from it for 2 days. 3. TV and Internet connection: slow, they do have wireless. Wireless is free but to activate it and link your computer to it there is an fee of $10. TV has something to be desired. Even if you are waking up in the morning or winding down in the evening, the TV connection was bad due to use of sattelite. Co-worker had a snowy picture on all channels. Not much to choose from in the channel selection. 4. Exercise room: There is an extra charge per day per person to use the gym. Pool is free. 5. Parking: Unless you can expense for business, leave the car or rental car at home or airport. Overnight parking costs $45. That is absolutely crazy. Stick to walking or taking the cab, "El" or metra if you need to get around. 6. Elevators: Slow This hotel is definitely not a top hotel. For $219 a night it is lacking in comfort and amenities. Check out different hotels in the city. This one deserves a pass! Wouldn't never stay here for casual or business again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Get the corner room”
Reviews.Author: prashpai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for a business trip the first week of Aug 2007. I arrived late the first night and got shoved into a hospitality room the first night. However, this was more than made up when after a strong talk they assigned me a corner room on the 28th floor. EXCELLENT view of the city, river and Lake Michigan. In fact, I would say the corner room of the Swissotel has a better view than any other hotel in the vicinity. The room was huge, and everything was clean and the bathroom was nice. The hotel is very convieniently located to the Magnificient Mile and Millenium Park. Would very much recommend this hotel, and would suggest trying every method possible to get a corner room in a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “First Chicago Visit”
Reviews.Author: DebBoxberger
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago and we booked the hotel through Travelzoo. We did get a good price but would have been very disappointed if we would have paid regular price. The mattresses were HORRIBLE. After walking Chicago, the bed was of no comfort. No vending machines of any kind if you wanted a soda--only minibar in room--$6.00 for water. At checkin, the staff never made eye contact and only went through the motions. Would not stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 4mykids2006
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate through Hotwire.com and was thrilled when I found out this was the hotel I picked. The hotel was very convenient to where I needed to go, and despite the weather (yes, it is windy there!) we still had a great time. I found the restaurant (The Palms) to be over rated, which was my only negative experience. It was not formal, but had formal prices, and didn't have mashed potatoes, which for me is a requirement of any great steakhouse! That's just a personal preference, but one that mattered to me! The rooms were sleek and cool - great views. Front desk was efficient and nice. Bell staff was attentive and available. Valet parking was a plus. Ordered breakfast through room service, which was great and on-time. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will hopefully stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: ac0809
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at Swissotel Chicago and loved every minute of it! It has gorgeous views of the river and lake and is close to pretty much anything. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go - Navy Pier, Sears Tower, Grant Park, Museum Campus, Hancock Center, Michigan Avenue - you name it. The service was awesome. From the moment we checked in, the staff was courteous and meet every need, including arranging for a crib for our daughter and making sure it was safely set up before leaving our room. The pool was also really nice and, since it's at the top of the hotel, offered even more gorgeous views of the city and lake. We got a great deal ($109 a night), which we booked as a special through travelzoo. The room service was a little expensive but very good. The concierge was wonderful with giving us accurate directions to attractions as well as recommendations for restaurants. I hope we can stay at the Swissotel every time we visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel was great....”
Reviews.Author: Judygolfing
Reviews.Content: My 3 nieces and I stayed here for a long weekend, we had a wonderful time. We arrived early around 8:30am and they let us into our room. This was very nice otherwise we would have had to store our luggage and register later Room was very clean as was the bathroom. With 4 women we needed extra towels, they brought them up right away and then we got a call to make sure they were delivered. Room was also quiet, construction going on behind us and we never heard anything. Beds comfy and so were the quilts... Good location for Michigan Ave. All in all a wonderful stay. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit!”
Reviews.Author: amblessed
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend in Chicago with my Mom...(Her first visit to Downtown). We had a very nice time. We were able to get in on the Swissotel deal for $109. It was a nice hotel, but glad I didn't pay full price. It really wasn't that special as far as the room went. However, the staff was very friendly and helpful. At first I was a little upset about the $45/day parking, but to me it ended up being well worth it. I pulled up to the front door and the Valet parkers were so pleasant and helpful. I didn't have to worry about finding the garage and then finding my way back to the hotel. It was especially nice because although my Mom does pretty good walking, it was nice not having to make her walk any more. It was so awesome to call down and have the car ready within about 10-15 min. To me, definitely wortht the price! The Swissotel was also very cool in that we had a great view of Navy Pier, from the hall window by the elevator. Our room looked onto the river and front entrance wihich was also pretty neat. And I loved the fitness center on the 42nd floor, so you could look out over the city and work out. Tremendous! The menu prices at Swissotel were a bit out of our range so we walked the block or two down to Houlihan's for a really nice breakfast buffet for only $10. Corner bakery was only another block further and was great for our 2nd breakfast. Although, my mom got the eggs and potatoes and her potatoes were cold. But, Southwest salad she got the nite before there was Humongous! and very good. We did use the free trolleys from Navy pier, trying to get to the Aquarium, but when we had to transfer at Union Station, the "green" trolley never showed up, and we ran out of time before our conference at the United Center that evening, that we didn't get to go to the Aquarium. So, if you want dependable transportation, don't use the trolley. We went to the Arts and craft show on Canal street between VanBuren and Jackson.....such as it was. There were 5 small booths and not much there. I wouldn't suggest that to anyone for next year. Thank you to all on this site who anwered my questions and helped me plan this trip. We both had a really nice time! I'll be coming back the first weekend in Aug. with my 17 yo daughter and another mom and daughter. I'm really looking forward to that too!

Reviews.Title: “Getting as worn down as Keith Richards.”
Reviews.Author: jkjohnson1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swissotel Jul 21-24th. We lucked out by getting our room for $109 a night. So considering the price paid, I had a great visit. If I paid rack rate, I would be livid. When I stayed at this place 3 years ago, it seemed to be much classier and elegant. Now the place is looking worn and tired. Pros: I called ahead and requested a higher room. We had a city view on the 31st floor. The views were excellent. The location away from the hustle and bustle so the area was quiter than the competition. The linens, towels and bathroom are top notch. Rooms are spotless. Bed was comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and the layout is very functional. I never heard any noise from the walls or above/below me. You could hear the neighboring doors open and close. Cons: The customer service stinks. The clerks lack any warmth or customer skills. It was just business. No smiles, no inquiries, no concern etc. The carpet has obviously been steam cleaned too many times. It was stretched out and wrinkled in many places. The furnishings had chips and peeling paint. The artwork was similar to what I had when I was a college student. Nicer prints and frames can be found at Linens and Things. To use the health club, you have to pay $10 per use. We paid $10 to use the room internet which was slower than any dial up that I have used. Turned out that fee only covered half of a day. Would I stay here again? If I got the same price, yes. Otherwise, stay somewhere else. I hear they will be remodeling this hotel next spring/summer. That should be a huge improvement. Meanwhile, it seems they are simply letting the place go. Hopefully, things will turn around because I absolutely love the location and views this place offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: atravelingbug
Reviews.Content: I recieved a great deal on the rooms here and it was wonderful. We had two rooms, one was upgraded to river view (without an additional charge) which was very nice. The other room overlooked new construction. Beds were very comfortable. Hotel and rooms were clean. Parking is pretty steep, but we didn't have a car so that wasn't a concern for us. It would have been nice not to have a fee to use the excersize facilities, but we didn't have to because we walk around the city so much. The one downside we found was that it wasn't super close to the El. It is close to Navy Pier and Millenium Park.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Expected”
Reviews.Author: theharrisons04
Reviews.Content: Was expecting big things from this hotel based on previous reviews, price and stature..... It was a good hotel, the rooms were clean and there were little things like dressing gowns that were a nice touch but other everyday things let the hotel down. The bell service at the front door was nice, opening the door of the cab when we arrived and always saying hello when we were entering or leaving the hotel but the reception and concierge service was not as polite, often making us feel like we were troubling them for recommendations or when asking about buses and maps. Our room was comfortable although the pillows were very lumpy. They did give us an extra bed for our little girl after we requested it but having stayed in the hampton inn and suites, milwaukee the days before, i have to say the service was poorer. Our room overlooked the construction but we were hardly in the room and so this didnt really matter and it is not the hotel's fault. Watch out on check out oo as they made a charge for the mini bar of $22 when we hadnt even opened it, they did remove this when we questioned it. The location is good but you could stay nearer all the restaurants for a similar price or a little more. We got a great deal from ebookers.com $200 per night but wish we had stayed with the hilton group for our stay in chicago s they seem to be more reasonably priced and more customer service based. Chicago is fantastic and i would recommend giordinos pizza (they are dotted throughout the city), we also did the chicago bus co tour, we paid fpr a 3 day pass which was worth the money because it is a hop on and off service and can be used to save your legs when you start to get tired. Watch out for shoe shine men, we saw them charging someone a fortune $20 to clean their shoes after they had started without permission so just keep walking if they approach you. Navy pier is good for the fireworks on wed and sat nights which you could see from our hotel too. Sears tower view is amazing but a little steep at $12.50 per person (no pun intended). If you love shopping look out for filennes basement, they ahve the designers at outlet prices in the city, there is one at the top end of michigan ave (mag mile) and one on state street near the body shop. Got some great bargains there! If you are travelling with children make sure you visit the children's museum (free on thurs eve 5-8pm) and the rainforest cafe where the rain forest comes to life while you eat with elephants, rhinos, frogs, crocdiles and more.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: love2travel546
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago for the first time and this hotel met my needs. I booked my room early - Travelzoo promotion for $109 per night. The room was quiet and spacious, especially the bathroom and I got a nice view of the Chicago River. The room itself had worn carpets, some scratched furniture and leaky showerhead, but the maid service was generally prompt and efficient. My room was ready no later than the late morning/ early aftermoon. You might want to request a quiet room because there is construction occurring on the south side of the hotel during normal business hours. I was fortunate not to get a room on that side. You can also pull the dark shades all the way across the window and avoid the morning sunshine. I was able to sleep late until 9-930am which was a plus for me. My room had standard cable TV channels and was cool and comfortable. I did not touch the mini-bar per previous reviews. The pillow top mattresses were comfortable enough for me. I decided to eat at the Palm hotel restaurant. We had violent thunderstorms moving through the area one night. I was delighted as the waiters were very friendly and the seafood was delicious. I paid $60 total for my meal (without dessert) but understood it was realistic given my vacation destination and location. There are plenty of restaurants and bakeries nearby to eat if you are on a budget or want a cheap breakfast. The Corner Bakery Cafe and Houlihans are a couple of nearby places on East Wacker. I attended during a part of the work week and avoided long lines. I've read some concerns about the distance to subway stations. This really wasn't a problem for me, I timed the walk generally 13-15 minutes to State Station. It wasn't too far to get anywhere really. The Navy pier was about 25-30 minutes away and the subways and buses take you so many places if you're tired of walking. Consider buying a 3 day visitors CTA pass for $12. You get unlimited subway and bus rides. The visitor center is close by on Randolph street. You can also walk down the stairs to the canal and take an architectural tour down the Chicago River which is informative and I would recommend. You can watch the Navy Pier fireworks from the hotel Wednesday and Saturday evenings weather permitting. Consider flying into Midway Airport instead of O'Hare...only a 30 minute subway ride to Randolph/Lake orange line station and vice versa and no transfers. I've heard the blue line to O'Hare can take up to 90 minutes. You can also avoid taxi fare. I didn't bring a car, so no comment on parking expenses. Overall I had a pleasant stay at the Swissotel. I had a lot of fun exploring Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Les68
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed somewhere completely different from the last review. I've stayed in a number of Chicago hotels, and this one was very nice. Our room and bathroom were both spotless. Our room was the largest room we've ever had in Chicago. We had a king bed with a desk, dresser, etc., and a very nice marble bathroom. We thought the bed was very comfortable and the linens were crisp and clean. The shower was spotless, as was the rest of the bathroom. We liked the separate shower and bathtub. Check-in and check-out were a breeze (on a Saturday and Sunday), and the staff was just fine. Not snooty at all, just adequately friendly. There is a taxi stand right outside the hotel which is a bonus. It is just at the bridge at the Chicago River, so you are not at all far from Michigan Ave. Getting to Navy Pier, however, is tricky because you have to go down a bunch of staircases and make your way through various streets to get there (it's easier from Mich. Ave). There is a public parking lot just down the street and on the left (parking at the hotel is $45 per night, which is a downer). And for breakfast there is a Corner Bakery right down the street as well. If you book here, ask for a view of Navy Pier if you can. It's a nice view. We had a view of the river, which was nice as well, but not as nice as the lake and Navy Pier. All in all I have no complaints and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GrammyBecky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for a conference July 8-13. We added a couple days to the stay after the conference so we could enjoy time with family flying in to join us. I have a little different perspective on the stay because I stayed across the street at the Fairmont on July 6 & 7 so I have a comparison. I absolutely love the look of the Swissotel. Our rooms were nice and didn't look worn or old. In fact, I have no complaints except for the building noise outside the hotel which isn't their fault. Our grandchildren enjoyed the nice indoor pool and we appreciated no extra charge for using it. My biggest complaint is I got used to the Fairmont's treatment, the staff is very well trained to meet your every need and are over accomodating. The Swissotel has very ordinary concierges that aren't overly friendly like the Fairmonts and their front desk didn't say "Welcome to Swissotel, how can I assist you, it was basically - next?" The Fairmont welcomes you, asks if they can assist you further, etc, etc. My conference rate was higher at the Swissotel than the Fairmont. The rooms were comparable but I have to admit I loved the Fairmont service, especially the bellhops and front desk. Swissotel needs some training on customer service. Often times there appears to be a manager waiting as you come through the door but never once did he say a thing so I assume the help gets their training from people like him, sad because I think the hotel architecture is fabulous. I do recommend while in Chicago go eat deep dish pizza at Giordanos and get Oprah's favorite carmelcorn at Garrett's Popcorn. All of us enjoyed the Field Museum and if you have children, take them to the Navy Pier (fireworks Wed and Sun visible from hotel) and go to the Children's Museum. It is free Thursdays from 5pm-8pm. There is a deli/store very close to the hotel called Bockwinkles. The sandwiches are great, $3.99 freshly made. We stocked up on soda, water and snacks there. I loved Chicago and plan to return again. Will I stay at Swissotel, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything.”
Reviews.Author: edub02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel the weekend of 7/6 - 7/8 for The Taste and The Color Purple. While the rooms are a bit dated, the location is great. From our room Navy Pier, Michigan Ave, and The Taste was in walking distance. Literally if you looked out my window you could see the Taste and just a few feet from my room to the elevator you saw Navy Pier. The Cadillac Palace is less than a mile away as well (This where the Color Purple is). We were also only a $5 cab ride from Rush St. The bad side is that the rooms are dated and in need of some upgrades, but for $109 a night through Travelocity it was great. The front desk was helpful with switching my room to a King Bed. Another ding against the hotel is that they charge for everything! A simply local call for 1 minute cost a $1.28. If you pick up anything in the mini bar you were charged. To use the gym area you have to pay. There is a nice restaurant (The Palms) in the hotel, but be prepared to spend about $100 for 2. Everything is a la carte. I would definitely recommend this hotel for someone just wanting location and would not be in the room alot, but if you are going to relax in your room, this is not the place for you. The walls are kind of thin and if you are one of the lucky ones you will get a great view of the construction they are doing outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jaltravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, right on the water and close enough to the Mag. Mile, Navy Pier, and Millenium Park. Also, the concierge was very good at giving us recommendations on restaurants and jazz clubs. Unfortunately the room was nothing special. I was disappointed that we were given two double beds instead of a queen or king and the view (towards construction) was lacking. Since we were staying during busy Memorial weekend all the good rooms filled up quickly. They offered to let us upgrade for $30.00 extra per night but we declined, as we weren't planning on spending our time in the room anyway. So, the hotel was fine but a little dated. As for Chicago--here are some recommendations: Volare--nice Italian restaurant off Mag. mile with traditional Italian food and a great atmosphere. Definitely make a reservation. Eno-A wine, chocolate, and cheese bar on Mag. Mile. Very romantic. We enjoyed the following sights: Lincoln park zoo (free), Buckingham Fountain, Top of hancock building (better than Sears tower), Architectural boat tour, ride on ferris wheel at Navy Pier, Art institute, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Our last stay until renovation is done”
Reviews.Author: fed4
Reviews.Content: To build on the comment of a previous reviewer, I concur that this hotel is in dire need of an update. Our family of 4 frequents Chicago and oftentime forgoes the comfort of a more spacious suite just to experience the thrill of the view of the river and Navy Pier that Swissotel's Lakeview rooms provide. We decided after this last 2 night stay (and 15 years of visits) that this would be our last until renovation. We could live with the worn furniture (desk was particularly battered) and bathroom door (and shower door!) that sealed only with great effort but the lumpy, saggy mattress and miserable pillows were more than we could bear for a $200+ daily rate (especially with all the new properties that Chicago has to offer.) Another amenity sorely lacking in this price range was a flat screen TV. Fortunately, the Swissotel will be undergoing a renovation scheduled to be completed by Summer 2008. Its spectacular view is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travelthru
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Chicago for 3 nights July 2-5 and had a great time. Rooms: We liked our room. The bathroom was big enough with adequate vanity space, with separate tub and shower. Beds were comfortable enough, although it seemed theyâ€™d put a pillow top mattress pad on top of a too old mattress. Furnishings were fine. Rooms were quiet enough. Be sure to ask for a room high up when you book your reservation; youâ€™ll probably get a good view wherever you stay, but the higher up you are, the more you can see. Location: This is a pretty good, central location, about a 5-10 minute walk off Michigan Avenue and Wacker, close to the water, just south of the Magnificent Mile. You can see downtown and/or the Navy Pier from most of the rooms. I liked it because it wasnâ€™t too close to the noise and crowdedness of Michigan Avenue. Swissotel is next door to the huge Hyatt hotel. I think itâ€™s the 3rd building in from the lake. Transportation: Well, Iâ€™d read about taking the train in and then walking to the hotel. I donâ€™t think any of the train stations are close together. Cabs are definitely the way to go. Donâ€™t rent a car unless you absolutely have to. The parking at Swissotel is about $45 and parking is hard to come by in other places if you want to get out and about. The trains are old, jerky and bumpyâ€”not like the ones in New York City or Washington, D.C. From Midway Airport, we took the Orange line in and got off at the State and Lake stop. Itâ€™s at least a 20-minute walk from there to the Swissotel (again, did I mention all the luggage?) The train stop is upstairs and there are no elevators, so we had to lug all our bags down 2 flights of stairs. Looking back, Iâ€™d save the expense and trouble and just get a cab. It was $35 one-way back to the Midway Airport from the hotel. We each bought a 3-day unlimited CTA pass for $12 each and only used the train once getting from Midway to the hotel. Staff: We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. We never saw long lines for anything. We asked for extra towels each day and they were promptly delivered within 15 minutes. The maids did a good job. Ice machine: we had to go up a floor and into a service area to find ice. They turn the machines off to save electricity, I think. You have to flip the power switch, and once I figured it out, I had all the ice I needed. Pool: We went to the hot tub a couple of times. It was nice. They have a nice workout area but you have to pay $10 a day to use it. The workout area overlooks the city and was nice and clean. Dining: We did not eat at the hotel. They have a Palm Steak house here and it was open for lunch. They seemed to have reasonable steak house lunch prices. Iâ€™ve never seen a Palm restaurant open for lunchâ€”wish we could have tried this. We went to Houlihanâ€™s down the street as several other reviews suggestedâ€”I just wasnâ€™t all that impressed. They have a $10 breakfast buffet but itâ€™s just thatâ€”a $10 breakfast buffet, similar to what you find in a nice Hampton Inn and Suites these days. They had some hot items that looked like theyâ€™d sat a little too long, cereal and some fruit stations. They had an omelet station but they couldnâ€™t find the chef so I waited 5 minutes (omelet was good). We ate at the original Billy Goat Tavern; itâ€™s on Michigan, just north of Wacker, across the bridge, maybe a 10-minute walk from the hotel. You have to take a staircase down to the lower level of the highway (kind of like an underground parking garage). They serve breakfast, lunch & dinner. Wish Iâ€™d known about the breakfast on the first day. Good hamburgers too (and I donâ€™t usually like hamburgers). Thereâ€™s also a McDonaldâ€™s close to the Billy Goat Tavern, right behind the Wrigley Building. We ate at Mike Ditkaâ€™s Steak House restaurant and it was good. We went to the Signature Room Restaurant and it was good, with the great view youâ€™d expect. We had a little bit hard of a time trying to identify the Hancock Towerâ€”it seemed kind of set back off Michigan Avenue. We ate at Giordanoâ€™s Italian and it was good. The have a lunch personal pizza and itâ€™s still too big for one person. We ate at Emerald Loop CafÃ©â€”itâ€™s down Wacker, go left on Wabash, restaurantâ€™s on the right. A nice restaurant with reasonable prices and great food. Kind of like an upscale Bennigans, but a lot better and prices arenâ€™t that much higher. Attractions: We took the Architecture Foundation river cruise. The departure is right down the street from the Swissotel, at the corner of Wacker & Michigan, downstairs, under the blue awning. The tour was well done, but donâ€™t forget a hat and some major sunscreenâ€”the best seats are up top and itâ€™s open to the elements. I went to the Art Institute of Chicago and wish I could have spent more time there. Hubby and kids went to the Museum of Science and Industry. We walked along the Navy Pier. Itâ€™s just as touristy and kid-friendly as youâ€™d expect but seemed clean and relatively safe. Went to Millennium Park (free! And not too far from Swissotelâ€”maybe 15 minutes walk) and itâ€™s a great place to visit. Ambiance of the city: We didnâ€™t find the people of Chicago to be as friendly as those in Texas. We encountered quite a few aggressive homeless people throughout all of Chicago. I didnâ€™t feel completely safe walking around the streets by myself. Overall nice experience and Iâ€™d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - great location”
Reviews.Author: FerWorld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, the staff is friendly and very service-oriented. We were in a business trip, my colleagues and I had a great time. My only complaint is the Palm restaurant, it is expensive and the food not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Like the location”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in June, but have stayed here before when on business in Chicago. Great location for business/shopping/sightseeing. In between Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile and the Loop and next to the Chicago River. Rooms very spacious and clean. Gym has a wonderful view, as it is situated on the top of the hotel. Bar next to lobby, very busy with good atmosphere. Cannot fault the hotel. Prefer it to the Westin - my previous address when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Shopping Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lariah
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and excellent service. Spotlessly clean. Good breakfast at hotel. We stay here almost every time we stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money! Nice hotel, but park elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: aliasrlm
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews here on tripadvisor unless something is really good...or really bad. After reading some of the reviews for the Swissotel, I felt compelled to share my experience. We recently stayed for a long weekend - and finding hotels to be over $180/night, I booked on Hotwire. Got Swissotel for a very good price, but was a little anxious since some of the reviews on this site complained of slow elevator service, unhelpful staff, etc. We encountered not a single problem during our three-night stay. Check-in was quick and simple, our room overlooked the river (I will post a photo so you can see), and most importantly, the room was quiet! I've stayed next door at the Hyatt Regency and was kept awake all night by loud neighbors and every single toilet flush (the walls are that thin); I would gladly choose Swissotel over the Hyatt any day of the week. The room was spacious. The bathroom was marble with a separate shower and tub. The decor was nothing exciting, to be honest, but the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location is excellent - close to Michigan Ave., Millenium Park, Navy Pier, etc. The clientele seemed upscale, the staff was friendly and I slept so soundly every night - I have absolutely nothing to complain about. (My boyfriend, though, was irritated that there was not a working ice machine on our floor - 23rd- he had to walk up a few floors, found a nonworking machine, then walked down more floors to finally find ice. To me, it's not the biggest deal in the world.) Oh, one word of warning - parking is expensive (45/night, I think), so we took the advice of other reviewers and parked elsewhere. We happened to find a parking lot on E. Randolph (for a condo building) that charged only $17/night! Our total charge was only $51, a bargain in Chicago. The walk back to the hotel was a bit tiring, but that's only because it was over 90 degrees. :) It was well worth it, especially when you consider how much money we saved. At the end of the day, we felt like we got a decent deal. If we would've paid 45/night for parking, we might've had a different opinion. If you do stay here, make sure to park elsewhere and walk the few blocks back to the hotel. You will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjgoehring
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a good location. Very nice room with the best bathroom I've experienced in a hotel. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The location is very good. Close enough to walk to everything we wanted to. Two blocks off Michigan Ave so it was quiet around the hotel. Nice architecture, fast elevators, very clean and modern. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but so much potential to be excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ascenseur
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one evening at this property and I left satisfied but convinced this could be a top-tier property with an update. It is a very clean, modern convention hotel in a great location. The interior of the guest rooms is decidedly generic, lacking the style of some of Chicago's newer hotels (Sofitel, W, Kimpton boutiques). But the rooms are large and nicely equipped with all the essentials of a business hotel. Bathroom was nice if a little bit dated, but very, very clean. It seems most of the rooms here have great views and mine was no exception. The shades were push-button which I quite enjoyed, though I'm not sure if this was because I was in a handicap-accessible room or if it is standard. The sheets and duvet were great but I was not happy with the mattress. Most of the upscale and even mid-range chains are finally updating their mattresses so I hope this property will follow suit. The bar could use a bit of an update but it works if you just want to sit in the lobby and enjoy an expectedly overpriced drink. Staff was very accommodating and always smiling and ready to assist. For $109/night (see Travelzoo web site; this continues all summer!), the hotel was absolutely fine. It could be an excellent property if the rooms were updated with new mattresses, televisions and desks. But at this point, there are many better hotels to choose from in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great view”
Reviews.Author: Worldskier1
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking this reservation I reviewed the top 20 hotels for Chicago on TA. I was looking for a nice hotel with a great view. This place was the perfect choice. We stayed in an "executive room" with a lake view. "Executive", in this case, meaning above the 34th floor. Note: given the number of skyscrappers under construction many hotel views are now blocked or soon will be. Here the lake view will remain unobstructed since this property is on the river. The Fairmont and Hyatt next door have a few rooms with a view but not many. Stayed in room 3601 for $239 Friday night and $159 Saturday night. The first night was booked through the Swissotel hotel web site for a spring special that beat Orbitz and hotel.com. After arriving we wanted to extend for saturday night but the front desk said they were sold out. Suspecting the rooms were allocated under the control of large travel agencies, I immediately called a friend and had them book me using hotels.com for Saturday. I was correct and the hotel let us stay in 3601 for the second night. Unless you bring a PC the room equipped TV/Game/Internet brower console is too old for practical use with modern web pages. Later found out there was a common workstation in the Executive Lounge (42nd floor?) Room was nice (King bed, TV, and writing desk), bathroom was excellent, and the View of Chicago River/Navy Pier/Lake was perfect. Preview the view using Google Earth for the view looking NE. There was no elevator noise problem for this room. Signature room restaurant is pricey but ideal for people unfamiliar with big cities and sky scrappers. Of course, you are paying for the view. Ask for the Southern facing view and watch the planes at Midway line up and land in the distance. The North view is good too. Not sure if the east view is good at night. Mostly dark unless the moon is out. Then it could be different. Signature Lounge, one floor up, is good for a Western facing view. There is a bar and tables that are noiser and more crowded than the resturaunt. But if you get a table you'll have fun. You're 300 yards from the Mag Mile (Michigan Ave) and everything is close if you like to walk - Grant Park, Adler, Art Institute, etc. If you don't, there are always cabs at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So so trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sa6200
Reviews.Content: Stayed over 5-12 to 5-15. Nice hotel. Decent room and a better than average bathroom than most hotels. Had noise problem with the first night and asked to change room the next night, even though we'd asked for quite room at reservation. TIP: Change room if your room numbers ends with 01 or 20. These rooms are right next to the elevators. you can hear the gears grinding and other noises. Staff were professional but not very friendly and distanced. Not too close to most of the shopping area, you will have to walk a bit or taking a taxi will cost you about $6 per trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ldawson01
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Took the train in from Detroit and brought our 12 year old daughter for a visit! The hotel is fantastic! Contemporary in its decor, the rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are very nice. Our room had the shower seperate from the bathtub and after a long day walking it was nice to soak, while the family took turns showering. What else is nice is that the hotel connects to below surface corridors to many nearby areas including the Metra! The view from our window of Navy Pier and the lake was gorgeous. The next door crane was also very interesting and luckily was not noisy at all. The crane kept my husband more fascinated than anything. We did not eat at the hotel, but we did take our breakfast at Houlihan's which was fabulous for a buffet every morning! We were also able to get there without being rain soaked, which was very nice. The only downful was the bed. Being rather used to heavenly beds and my own sumptuous bed, I was ready to go home after 2 nights. My back was killing me.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, great deal”
Reviews.Author: chiguy78
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay downtown over Good Friday and Pricelined myself into the Swissotel at only $65/night (plus tax)! For this I got a king-bedded room on the 32nd floor with a nice southerly view toward Millennium Park and Lake Shore Drive; the room was clean and spacious, bed decent and marble-clad bathroom cool. Service at the front desk was very friendly and efficient while room-service breakfasts were quite good and delivered promptly. The Swissotel makes a good base for shopping and entertainment as it's a reasonable walk from Macy's and the Magnificent Mile/River North area; numerous CTA bus routes also stop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is perfectly located on the east end of the Chicago River. Depending on your room location (the higher floors are better) the veiws could be excellant. Our room was clean, simple and updated with a very nice bathroom. Services (check-in/out, concierge, bell hop) were fine. Although we didn't use it, the pool in the top floor looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!! Great Hotel Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neon304
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked this wonderful hotel this past Friday April 6th - 7th and had an excellent time. We checked in the hotel around 3:00pm. Since we purchaed the room on Priceline I was worried that we were going to get stuck with a terrible room but I was wrong. This was my first time staying at a Swissotel and I had no idea that they had a separate shower and bath. Our room was located on the 33rd floor on the South East side. From our window we could see Lake Michigan. They were doing construction but we didn't notice the noise. We ordered room service for late night ice cream and fruit and also breakfast and it was prompt and very excellent food. The fresh fruit was very tasty. We will visit here again and I truly enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel & price!”
Reviews.Author: hmparrish
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll first start with my opinion of the hotel and then move on to the reservation itself. The hotel was in an excellent location (although hotels on Mag. Mile are better located of course) about 3 blocks from Mag. Mile right along the Chicago River. From the hotel we easily walked south to Millenium Park and the Art Institute and north to the John Hancock Building. Donâ€™t wear yourself out walkingâ€”the Navy Pier is not as close as it looksâ€”take the free trolley! We also took the train in from Midway and it was about a 15 minute walk to the hotelâ€”no problem at all and only cost $2 (the whole trip probably took about 50 minutesâ€”it is a bit of a walk from the airport terminal to the train, but it is very accessible). We arrived at the hotel around 2 pm and had no trouble checking in and our room was ready for us even though we were early. Our room was on the 23rd floor and faced the Chicago River with a great view of the skyscrapers and Navy Pier. The room was very clean and had enough space for 4 of us, although I wished the beds were queens instead of doubles. My only complaint about the room was the small shower. A marble bath is nice and all, but when thereâ€™s 4 of us and weâ€™re in a hurry, all weâ€™re going to do is use the shower and it was tiny! Plus the nozzle faced the door so you couldnâ€™t turn it on to warm it up before you got in without making a huge mess on the floor. As a side note the linens on the bed are quite comfortable, but the towels are your typical hotel towelsâ€”scratchy and small. We didnâ€™t use any of the hotel amenities or eat in their restaurant so I canâ€™t comment on that.
